story:
Our Story

The Kronberg Ensemble is a full-time, professional string chamber ensemble, consisting of a core group of 6 to 18 players, dedicated to the performance of classical music and education for all ages. The group’s primary purpose will be to perform a wide range of string chamber music repertoire from Baroque to Modern for audiences initially in the Midwest region of the United States, where it is based. Additionally, the group serves as an educational entity through performances, workshops, private coaching, and masterclasses.

The Kronberg Ensemble is just starting out and trying to attain our non-profit status. Our fundraising goal may be less exciting than others, but our mission promises to make this journey an exciting one. We want to make classical music accessible and enjoyable for EVERYONE, not just those with lots of money. We hope that free concerts will attract new listeners of our generation (the 20 and 30-something crowd).


The Impact

Because the Kronberg Ensemble is in its infancy, our activities are being paid for, out of pocket, by our founder.  A $20 fee here and there for state filing or opening a bank account with the local credit union was manageable, but it is going to take a lot of effort (and a lot of packets of ramen instead of real food) for our founder to pay the $850 I.R.S. filing fee on her own.  

Filing with the I.R.S. for non-profit 501(c)(3) status will allow us to apply for grants to bring classical music to people around the country who would not have a chance to experience it otherwise. Grants also help to pay our performers who have chosen to be a part of something larger than themselves.  Because this is a professional group, our musicians will never be forced to go without pay for playing.

It isn't the end of the world if we don't make our entire goal, but every dollar (or ten) donated gets us that much closer to providing chamber music and education for EVERYONE, not just those who have disposable income. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need $850 to pay the filing fee for non-profit status with the I.R.S.  The remaining portion of the $1,200 goal will go towards helping us purchase QuickBooks software to do our own accounting (and save money on hiring a bookkeeper).  Right now the I.R.S. fee, followed by QuickBooks are our priority, but any additional funding we receive will go towards paying the musicians of the Kronberg to play future concerts.


What you get: 
See the contribution perks!  They're pretty sweet.


Other Ways You Can Help

How else can you help us? 


Check out our website for volunteer opportunities, both local and national (we are especially in need of anyone with accounting experience and graphic designers).  http://tinyurl.com/kronbergensemble


Like us on Facebook!  http://www.facebook.com/kronbergensemble


Follow us on Twitter!  @TheKronbergEns


Do you or someone you know have a concert series or venue you would like to book the Kronberg Ensemble in?  Shoot us an email: kronbergensemble@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary.

About the Festival of Lights

Production group Taos Tandoori brings together internationally acclaimed ensembles Music Meets Bells, from Kolkata, India, and Sangeet Millennium, from Austin, Texas, who team up for the first time ever to present the Festival of Lights in the Land of Enchantment, a four-day “journey of the senses,” Oct. 24-27. You will experience world-class concerts, Indian dance and Indian and Indo-jazz music workshops, Tandoori cuisine, yoga sessions with live music, and more … all in the visually stunning, artistically inspiring setting of Taos, New Mexico.

The showpiece concert of Indian classical music, Odissi dance, and Indo-jazz fusion music will take place Saturday, Oct. 27, 7:30 p.m., at the iconic Old Martina’s Hall, a historic 230-year-old adobe venue much-beloved in Taos. Friday, Oct. 26, an inaugural night Tandoori dinner with the artists will be served at the historic La Posada de Taos Bed & Breakfast, just two blocks from the Taos Plaza, followed by an impromptu Indian music performance. 

Workshops and yoga sessions with live music will take place Oct. 24, 25, and 26. Times and locations TBA. Check www.facebook.com/taostandoori and here for updates. 

If you cannot travel to the Festival Lights, we will bring it to YOU by providing a live event CD and DVD to contributors of $40 or more.

Who We Are

Like the mix of spices for which it named, Taos Tandoori brings the sights, sounds and tastes of India to Taos. Producer Ana Chávez is a native New Mexican and resident of Taos for 24 years.

Sangeet Millennium, one of the leading world music ensembles in central Texas, presents traditional and new music and dance of the Indian subcontinent through collaborative and interactive performance, workshops, classes, festivals, and films. Founder and Director Amie Maciszewski is a sitarist, music educator, ethnomusicologist, and native of New Mexico. Saxophone player/composer Paul Klemperer is a regular collaborator. Both are based in Austin, TX.

Music Meets Bells is a unique experimental duet between the sensuous temple dance form Odissi and the 100-stringed Indian hammered dulcimer santoor. It is a musical conversation on stage—jamming together! Music Director Pandit Tarun Bhattacharya isa maestro of the santoor and an internationally acclaimed performer and composer, named as Rotary International’s Global Ambassador for Peace and Goodwill. His wife and professional partner, Guru Sanchita Bhattacharya, acclaimed by the Edmonton (Canada) Journal as the “ambassador of Odissi dance around the world,” is also recipient of the Shree Kshetra Mahari (revered temple dancer) award from the Jagannath Temple in Puri, Orissa, India, among numerous awards.

How You Can Help

We need your contributions to cover the costs to produce this event, including production costs, and artists’ travel costs and fees. The amount raised from tickets sales along is not sufficient to cover these costs.

What You Get

Each of our nine levels of giving offers a unique package of benefits that you can customize, regardless of whether you plan to attend the Festival or would like to “listen in” through live recordings and support the artists’ efforts in other ways. Benefits include discounts at La Posada Bed and Breakfast, the chance to help light the lamp at the opening night dinner, free admission to the workshops, VIP seating at the concerts, public acknowledgement, signed live event CD and DVD recordings with your name in the support credits, and more.

 

 WHAT WE NEED:

Our Indiegogo fundraising GOAL: $4500

We need this to cover artists' travel expenses and fees, as well  videography and photography of the event. 

 If we don’t reach our entire goal, we will still use whatever funds we raise to pay the artists’ travel expenses and fees but will seek in-kind contributions for ground transportation and lodging. Since the video and photo shoot is an essential part of the project, we may have to set up a barter arrangement with the videographer/photographer.

 

WHAT YOU GET:

 For $5 or more

  • a shoutout of thanks on Facebook, Twitter, and our Indiegogo page
  • a “like” of your page
  • $5 off any one of the Taos events you can attend
  • 20 karma points

 For $25 or more

  • a shoutout of thanks on Facebook, Twitter, and our Indiegogo page
  • a “like” of your page
  • a signed copy of the live audio recording of the shows (expected Jan. 2013) (outside of the US please add $10 for shipping)
  • free admission to the Indo-jazz music and yoga class
  • 40 karma points

 For $40 or more

  • a shoutout of thanks on Facebook, Twitter, and our Indiegogo page
  • a “like” of your page
  • ONE of the following
    • free admission to  the show in Taos
    • a signed copy of the live DVD recording of the shows  (expected Feb. 2013)
    • two signed copies of the live audio CDs (outside of the US please add $10 for shipping)
    • free admission to the yoga class with live music by Sangeet Millennium
  • 60 karma points
  • Festival rates at the historic La Posada Inn in Taos

For $65 or more

  • a shoutout of thanks on Facebook, Twitter, and our Indiegogo page
  • a “like” of your page
  • your name in the “additional support” credits of the DVD (outside of the US please add $10 for shipping)
  • ONE of the following:
    • free admission to Pandit Tarun Bhattacharya’s workshop on Indian rhythmic grooves
    • 50% off Guru Sanchita Bhattacharya’s workshop
    • a one-hour private lesson with any of the artists
    • one signed copy each of the live audio CD and live DVD recording of the show
  • free admission for you and a guest to the yoga class with live music by Sangeet Millennium
  • 100 karma points
  • Festival rates to stay at the historic La Posada Inn in Taos
  • 100 karma points

For $100 or more

  • a shoutout of thanks on Facebook, Twitter, and our  Indiegogo page
  • a “like” and written endorsement of your page
  • free admission to the Sangeet and yoga class
  • ONE of the following:
    • free admission to the show with VIP seating
    • a signed copy each of the live audio CD and live DVD recording of the shows (outside of the US please add $10 for shipping)
    • a one-hour on-ground private lesson or two one-hour skype lessons with any of the artists
  • your name in the “special thanks” credits of the CD and DVD online, in print, and in the liner notes/credits.
  • Festival Rates to stay at the historic La Posada Inn.

 For $200 or more

  • a shoutout of thanks on Facebook, Twitter, and our Indiegogo page
  • a “like” and written endorsement of your page
  • free admission for one to both shows and opening night dinner with the artists with VIP seats at each event
  • ONE of the following:
    • Free admission to Pandit Tarun Bhattacharya’s Indian music grooves workshop
    • Free admission for your companion to both shows and opening night dinner with the artists with VIP seats at each event
    • 50% off Guru Sanchita Bhattacharya’s dance workshop
    • One on-ground private lesson or two skype lessons with the artist of your choice
  • one signed copy each of the live audio CD and live DVD recording of the shows (outside of the US please add $10 for shipping)
  • your name in the “special thanks” credits of the CD and DVD online, in print, and in the liner notes/credits.
  • festival rates to stay at the historic La Posada Inn.

 For $350 or more

  • a shoutout of thanks on Facebook, Twitter, and our Indiegogo page
  • acknowledgement as Co-producer of the DVD and CD, online, in print, and in the liner notes
  • free admission for two to the opening night dinner with the artists and the performance night with VIP seats at each event
  • invitation to help light the lamp at the opening night dinner
  • a signed copy each of the live audio CD and live DVD recording of the shows
  • free admission to any of the workshops
  • festival rates to stay at the historic La Posada Inn.

 

For $500 or more

  • All of the above
  • Acknowledgement as Festival Sponsor of the entire festival, online, in print, and on the CD and DVD liner notes
  • invitation to help light the lamp at the opening night dinner and  present opening remarks at the shows
  • 50% off one night’s stay at the historic La Posada Inn in Taos.

 

$1000 or more

  • All of the above
  • Acknowledgement as FESTIVAL PATRON online and in print, and as producers of the CD and DVD in the liner notes
  • invitation to help light the lamp at the opening night dinner, present flowers to the artists and speak at the opening night dinner
  • one night’s free stay at the historic La Posada Inn in Taos.

 

Impact

Your contribution will help to make artistic and cultural history by supporting the Festival of Lights for the third year, firmly establishing it as an annual tradition. Together, we will help to light lamps of cross-cultural understanding and artistic delight in Taos, NM, an artistic center that remains somewhat isolated because of its geographic remoteness and socioeconomic challenges.

Other ways to help

Please donate today, and share the link to this page widely through social media and email. The event is a little over a month away, so we appreciate your help in getting the word out!

 You may ask, “What if I just can’t contribute?” Well, that sure doesn’t mean you can’t help! You can, by doing the following:

  • Getting the word out and making some noise about your campaign.
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Time to make a record...

This project has been a long time coming. I've always loved playing music, recording, writing songs, and leading worship. After much thought, prayer and many great conversations with many great friends, I've decided it's time to record an EP of original music - songs written specifically for the church. I've had all kinds of experiences shape me and inspire me - leading worship in Southern Ontario in my teens, touring with a worship team from Heritage Bible College, my time at Briercrest writing, recording and leading worship with Elevate, and my last 4 years working in Lethbridge at the E-Free Church.

There's a TON of 'worship' music out there these days, but I think there is still a need for great songs that can be sung by the church - songs with simple melodies and rhythms, truth packed lyrics which inspire and challenge, and music/arrangemets that are compelling when played by a single person or a worship team of 15. I've talked to many of my friends who work and lead worship in other Canadian and American churches, and they agree.

In Feburary of this year, I made my first trip down to Nasvhille to start things off with Ben Reynolds (a Canadian friend and writer, producer, artist extrordinare - www.benreynoldsmusic.com) and Jason Germain (one of the frontmen in Downhere, and also a fellow Canadian!) who are producing this project for me. I've got a second trip planned for early August to finish up all of the recording, and then a brief trip sometime in October (with any luck) to sign off on all of the mixes and final stuff.

I'm really excited about this project - I'm not looking to quit my day job or become famous, but to help lead people deeper in their discipleship with Christ through great music that we sing together. Recorded music is the way in which our culture speaks best these days, so I'm jumping in. 

Thanks for reading this so far, and I'd love it if you'd consider partnering with me by pre-ordering the album or some other cool perks. Every dollar helps, and this project is going ahead regardless of how much I raise - I'd just love to be able to keep paying my mortgage and feeding my family this fall. I think there's something really significant about a project like this and it being comissioned by the community of people around me - I feel honoured and inspired to ask you to help. Great art speaks to people in ways in which simple words cannot and I'm excited to give back my mere gifts and skills in a way which I hope will serve and inspire the community.

Stay tuned throughout this campaign for videos of me doing simple acoustic videos of a few of the songs that'll be on the disc! And feel free to check out my blog at www.davesiverns.com or follow me on twitter.

Frequently Asked Questions

(okay, no one's asked any of these yet, but I'm figuring you would at some point...)

Where's the money going? - Recording music well costs money. Thankfully, it's WAY cheaper than it used to be! I've already completed the first trip of three down to Nashville and started the recording process. Much of the money is going to the people who help to make this happen - paying for production time, studio time, mixing time, mastering time, and musican time. Some of the budget is for travel, and some is for the costs of producing the physical copy of the CD. There are lots of things I'm NOT budgeting for and am trying to do myself or foregoing - graphic design, marketing, and the first part of the project which I payed for out of pocket.

Why are you going to Nashville? Aren't there studios here, isn't there one at your church? - Yes, we actually do have a really great setup at the church where I work, but it's a great setup for good demo stuff. The reason I'm going down to Nasvhille is mostly to get the expertise and experience of Ben and Jason, as well as the other friends we'll bring in for this. The gear and know-how down in Nasvhille is also well beyond what I've got access to at our little setup, and to go up to Calgary or somewhere else and rent the same gear would actually cost just as much (including travel expenses). I'm enjoying the opportunity to get away and hope to be bringing lots of things back with me to do recordings here at home in the future.

I want something that's not on your list of perks, can I get it? - Send me a message and I'm sure we can work something out. You can't have my wonderful family, but I'm sure we could have you over for dinner or something.

I'd like to help with support, but I don't really want the perk/I don't want the whole perk - Thanks for your generosity! That's easy to do - just click 'contribute now' and there's an option for just a contribution with no perk. If you'd like to give MORE than the perk amount but a smaller perk, select this option and just put what you want in the comment section.

I can't give you any money, can I still be involved? - Of course you can! I always appreciate your encouragement and prayers throughout this whole thing. You can also give me a hand by spreading the word about this project - throw it on your facebook, email it to your friends, tweet it to your neighbours, anything helps! Indegogo has some really easy 'share' tools which will link right in to whatever social media is your thing, so check it out.

Stay tuned throughout this campaign for videos of me doing simple acoustic videos of a few of the songs that'll be on the disc! And feel free to check out my blog at www.davesiverns.com or follow me on twitter.


Frequently Asked Questions
(okay, no one's asked any of these yet, but I'm figuring you would at some point...)
Where's the money going? - Recording music well costs money. Thankfully, it's WAY cheaper than it used to be! I've already completed the first trip of three down to Nashville and started the recording process. Much of the money is going to the people who help to make this happen - paying for production time, studio time, mixing time, mastering time, and musican time. Some of the budget is for travel, and some is for the costs of producing the physical copy of the CD. There are lots of things I'm NOT budgeting for and am trying to do myself or foregoing - graphic design, marketing, and the first part of the project which I payed for out of pocket.
Why are you going to Nashville? Aren't there studios here, isn't there one at your church? - Yes, we actually do have a really great setup at the church where I work, but it's a great setup for good demo stuff. The reason I'm going down to Nasvhille is mostly to get the expertise and experience of Ben and Jason, as well as the other friends we'll bring in for this. The gear and know-how down in Nasvhille is also well beyond what I've got access to at our little setup, and to go up to Calgary or somewhere else and rent the same gear would actually cost just as much (including travel expenses). I'm enjoying the opportunity to get away and hope to be bringing lots of things back with me to do recordings here at home in the future.
I want something that's not on your list of perks, can I get it? - Send me a message and I'm sure we can work something out. You can't have my wonderful family, but I'm sure we could have you over for dinner or something.
I'd like to help with support, but I don't really want the perk/I don't want the whole perk - Thanks for your generosity! That's easy to do - just click 'contribute now' and there's an option for just a contribution with no perk. If you'd like to give MORE than the perk amount but a smaller perk, select this option and just put what you want in the comment section.
I can't give you any money, can I still be involved? - Of course you can! I always appreciate your encouragement and prayers throughout this whole thing. You can also give me a hand by spreading the word about this project - throw it on your facebook, email it to your friends, tweet it to your neighbours, anything helps! Indegogo has some really easy 'share' tools which will link right in to whatever social media is your thing, so check it out.

story:
CHECK OUT THE GALLERY TAB FOR A VIDEO ON THE CORE MECHANICS OF RELICS!!!

PROJECT OPENED TO ALL FACTIONS IN RELICS.

Originally this project was meant to be a pre-order system for the Nuem new faction that allowed people to pre-order a Nuem starter and get some extras if enough people ordered.

Then we were asked to open it to the other factions, and as we like to listen to what you say and try and meet your requests, we did just that!

You can find the original project pitch down below the ----- if you are interested in taking a look, but all you need to read now is what is above that line!

Current Stretch Targets

If the project hits $13,000 we will have the postcard artwork for the Britanan, Orcnar and Vaettir done and add them to the pile!

Already achieved Stretch Targets

Every backer who backs the project with a TARGET BUSTER Perk will receive the Perk they chose plus the following

  • Relics rules in PDF format
  • A single choice for each starter set you have in your Perks from a SpecialisPueri,  Britanan Company Sergeant Major, Orcnar Niwian or Vaettir Evocatour.
  • A single choice for each starter set you have in your Perks from a pack of Auxilium Concursus, Britanan Marksmen, Orcnar Grymann or Vaettir Elvspon
  • A single choice for each starter set you have in your Perks from a pack of Britanan Highlanders, a pack of Orcnar Angilde, a pack of Vaettir Cwalu, a Pack of Nuem Auxilium Sagittarius
  • A single choice for each starter set you have in your perks from a pack of Nuem Tormenta (Will need concepting!), Britanan Company Colour Party, Orcnar Spatga (Will need concepting!), Vaettir Cylod (Will need concepting)
  • A single choice for each starter set you have in your Perks of 10 x custom d6 dice with the faction logo of your choice on the 6 plus a drawstring dice bag with the faction logo screen printed on.
  • Pack of four full colour Nuem art postcards (Check out the Gallery tab for a preview of the first two cards!)

NOTE: Your choices above DO NOT have to be the same faction as your starter set/s.

How does this project work?

When you contribute to this project and choose a perk with Target Buster in it’s text, you will get the perk you chose plus all stretch targets we set.

However, it is slightly more expansive as that because depending on which perk you choose will determine how much from each stretch goal you get:

If you choose a perk called: Get a Different Starter, Nuem Starter Set or Nuem Starter plus Rulebook you will receive the choice of one option form each stretch target!!

If you choose the perks that give you two starters (or contribute twice and choose the options above twice) you will get two choices from each stretch target!!

Basically, the number of starter sets you are getting denotes the number of choices you get from EACH stretch target!!

So, contribute enough time and choose the ‘Get a different starter’ three times and you will get three choices from each stretch goal!

In addition, ALL Target Busting Perks will also receive a FREE copy of the Relics PDF rules.

When do I get my stuff???

Once the project is complete, we will email everyone to find out what their choices are for each target we exceeded. We will include the Relics full rules pdf in this email for you.

The goods will hopefully be sent out within 6 weeks of the project end - But that really depends on how we do. If we hit the targets for more sculpts, we need to get them sculpted and cast first so obviously this takes time. But we hope it won't be longer then 6 weeks after the project ends.

Upgrading Your Perk - Just 'cause you want too!

If you've already selected a Perk but want to upgrade a more expensive non-limited perk, all you need to do is contribute the difference between the two perks, then email us with the details and we will adjust your perk in our records.

If you want to upgrade to a limited perk please email us first.

How Much is Shipping Going To Set Me Back?

Nothing, zero, nil, zilch, nowt, nada. Yep, Nothing. No matter where your models are going, you will pay nothing for basic land based shipping.

If you wish for your pile of swag to be sent with tracking, you will need to add $10 if outside the UK to your pledge.

----------------------------------------

The Nuem Have Returned!

Thantos stalked slowly through the undergrowth ahead of the main Cohort searching for a pathway that would be less troublesome for his kin to travel on. The journey had been treacherous thus far and their numbers had been thinned along the way but as Thantos walked out into the clearing and the blinding light of the sun beamed down upon his pale sunken face he felt a strange twinge of a feeling that he had almost forgotten, hope.

He stood and enjoyed its warmth for a moment but as he looked down into the valley something startled him and he suddenly ducked behind the nearest boulder. His heart raced with anticipation as the adrenaline shot through his veins, he had not felt this urge of excitement in years but he managed to keep his composure and remained hidden and waited for Cerctes to join him.

“Why have you stopped Thantos? It’s not safe here!”

The young Dolor ranted his words and sprayed Thantos with an unhealthy dose of spittle.

“Shhhh!”

Thantos stared him dead in the eye and lifted his left drill arm to his lips like one might do with a finger when hushing an unruly child.

“Keep low Cerctes and tell me I am not imagining things, take a glance out over that clearing there.”

Cerctes faintly nodded and gingerly moved to look out where Thantos had directed him. As he looked out into the valley he saw them, Orcnar, hundreds of them in all shapes and sizes. He slumped back down out of sight and grinned at Thantos.

“What did you see Cerctes?”

Cerctes paused for a moment and then smirked.

“Fresh meat for us to butcher my dear Thantos!”

Thantos sniggered at the unexpected response.

“Indeed Cerctes, their agonising screams will ring out long into the night and all of Relicia will know the Nuem have returned from the darkness. Ready yourself for war; I can almost taste their torment.”

Tor Gaming is a Tabletop Wargames producer based in the UK. We are best known for the Stitchpunk wargame Relics. Not surprising really as it’s our only game at the moment! Relics is a unit skirmish game in the 28mm scale. You can check out the light version of the rules here with some of the most original concepts around!

We’re using this project is a sort of ‘Pre-order Plus’ system. Back the project (effectively Pre-order the Nuem listed on the reward you choose) and you are guaranteed to get the reward you have chosen, no matter if we meet our target or not. And not only the Nuem, we have included some rewards for the other factions to help you get into the game!

But, it doesn’t end there! The more people that back the project the more we can give away to everyone claiming specific rewards!! As we hit targets that we define as the project grows, we will add more to your rewards for no extra cost. 

What Do They Look Like?

The Nuem are sadomasochistic Dwarfs. Oh, and they tend to wear clock work suits of armour and wield chains and drills and stuff as weapons.

The Dedicatus pack comes with one of two sculpts, one standing and one running. Both sculpts come with arm options to build either the Metus or the Dolor. If you chose the Reward of a Dedicatus Model, we will send you the sculpt you prefer.

Both sculpts also come with face plates to make their suits enclosed.

The Metus Dedicatus:

 

The Dolor Dedicatus:

 

The Dedicatus Face Plate 1:

The Paenitentiam:

Check out the video posted in the Gallery tab we have released showing the content of the Paenitentiam blister, including one assembled. THEY ARE AWESOME!

So, How Is It Going To Work?

Pure and simple, you pledge for the reward you want and you will get it guaranteed. It doesn’t matter how much we raise, you will get what you asked for at the very least.

If the reward you selected has the text ‘TARGET BUSTER’ in it, the more that is pledged to the project, the more YOU will get! Let’s take a look at an example (the following is just an example...The actual targets and rewards may be differ):

You pledge for the NUEM STARTER SET – That is yours, guaranteed. It will be sent out to you once we have them produced. The project has an initial target of $XXX. If we do not hit this target, no worries – you will still get your Nuem Starter Set. However, if we do hit the target then in addition to your NUEM STARTER SET, you will also receive a copy of the SPECIALIS PUERI sculpt for FREE!.

At this point, we will set a new target and a new reward:

So, we have hit the first target! Great!! Now is time for a new target. Let’s say we set a new target of $YYY with a bonus of a unit of AUXILIUM CONCURSUS. 

This continues until the project ends or we just run out of what we can give you!!

So, What Are The Funds Being Spent On?

As I say, this is like a ‘Pre-Order Plus’ system, so we already have the moulds made for the Dedicatus and Paenitentiam units, so that is sorted. The money that is raised here will be used to sculpt and cast more Nuem units!!! And that is where the Target Busting rewards kick in and you get more stuff!!!

How Much Is Shipping Going To Set Me Back?

Nothing, zero, nil, zilch, nowt, nada. Yep, Nothing. No matter where your models are going, you will pay nothing in shipping.

Help Us Spread The Word!

You can help us to spread the word about the Nuems arrival on Relicia.

If you have a facebook and/or twitter account, post links to this project on them. Make sure everyone knows about it! Start threads on wargames forums you visit and point people here!

Remember, the more people that support the project, the more miniatures you could end up with!

Use the share buttons on this page to spread the word and lets make the Nuems entrance into Relicia something to remember!

story:
photo by Anthony Georgis

Our Story

Hello, I'm Jess Gulbranson.  You may know me musically DJFalsifier, or one half of Coeur Machant.  I've been working in electronic music for a couple of years now, and I'm starting to get into scoring and composition.  Since I'm not actually trained in those areas, I'm hoping that a stout supply of audacity and morbidity will carry me through.  When I'm not planning on hitting everyday objects with a hammer and calling it music, I am a novelist, music critic, and interviewer.  By day I work for a natural foods company and am a husband and father.  My daughter Amelia is 3, and has already helped me with several experimental compositions, but she is slightly afraid of ghosts and we'll see how much she wants to do on this project.


The Impact

When was the last time music moved you?  It probably happens all the time.  But when was the last time music scared the hell out of you and made you afraid to go to the bathroom at night?  IN YOUR OWN HOUSE?  I would like to spread fear and confusion to a jaded populace, and give them something to play at their Halloween parties that isn't "Monster Mash" or "Ghoul, You'll Be A Woman Soon".  Instead, we'll have songs about and manifesting the spirit of some of the creepiest locations in the world... Aokigahara, Pripyat, The Lalaurie House, and more...


What We Need & What You Get

To be perfectly honest, my recording facilities suck.  I prefer to run lean, like a thief in the night, but that won't be enough for this project.  I mean, I could just sneak into an abandoned warehouse with a length of rebar and a dictaphone- actually, that sounds like a really good idea.  Maybe I'll do that.  BUT IT WON'T BE ENOUGH FOR MY GRAND VISION!!!  To really evoke the dark presence of haunted locations, I'm going to be getting some electronic percussion (to use as a midi controller to "play" my locations), some better microphones and audio equipment to do field recording, and whatever is left will be used to buy random crap that I will hit with a hammer. Come to think of it, I may need to buy a coupla hammers as well.


Now, I really want to do something unique and original.  So, apart from cool, normal stuff like downloads, physical copies, thank-you notes, etc., I have put in the very top support bracket a slightly weird opportunity- I come to your house, set up my stuff, and record the ambient life (or unlife) of your living space.  I will then take what I find and plug it into reverbs and sampling and PLAY YOUR HOUSE on a song.  Okay- and if that wasn't creepy enough, I will then either haunt your house or unhaunt it using a special ritual.  How's that for supporting the arts!?!?!


Other Ways You Can Help

Now, I'd love it if you could help financially, but if you can't, I'd appreciate you getting the word out there.  Indiegogo has some great sharing options, please avail yourself of them. And of course, if you happen to live somewhere haunted and want to send me creepy audio clips, I will most certainly not turn them down.  If I use your audio you will of course receive credit and I will probably give you a download.  Because I am super nice.

story:
Our Story

Capeside Records is a small and very independent record label based in Saginaw, Michigan.  Started in 2003 by brothers D-Jay and Kevin Bidwell, the brothers did not want to take out a huge loan to support the label so they paid for everything straight out of their pockets.  It was imperative that they be very selective on who to sign to the label and always remember the music came before anything else. They thought if they could find bands that believe in the music as much as they did, than they would make it. 

After supporting the local music scene for the past nine years strictly on a zero budget profit margin, Capeside has made a name for themselves with all of their hard work and dedication to the label.  With only 12 bands on the roster due to such limited funding and willingness to work for free, Capeside is ready to take 2012 to a different level and make the next big move in the industry.

Our mission is to let the artist be the artist.  We focus on the opinions and the input that the fans give us and always make them a priority. We are looking for fans of music to help us discover and release the next great artist.  We just want to help bands that deserve it and work hard towards their hopes and dreams of being a successful recording artist on a label they can count on.


The Impact

Just think, by donating to our campaign you could be potentially helping the next great artist that could change the world with their music, especially if it inspires others to never give up and follow their heart.


What We Need & What You Get

We need about 5,000 dollars to properly record, promote and press the album.  We do this as a hobby because we love the music and the opinions of our fans. We hope that music lovers out there will understand and help out the cause.  In order for us to work with potential great musicians, we want you to know that you are just as much a part of this label as our recording artists are, considering how much pride we take into your opinion.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our campaign and give Capeside Records a shout-out on all of your social networks!

who to sign to the label and always remember the music came before anything else. They thought if they could find bands that 
believe in the music as much as they did, than they would make it.  After supporting the local music scene for the past nine years strictly on a zero budget profit margin, Capeside has made a name for themselves with all of their hard work and dedication to the label.  With only 12 bands on the roster due to such limited funding and willingness to work for free, Capeside is ready to take 2012 to a different level and make the next big move in the industry. Our mission is to let the artist be the artist.  We focus on the opinions
 and the input that the fans give us and always make them a priority. We are looking for fans of music to help us
 discover and release the next great artist.  We just want to help bands
 that deserve it and work hard towards their hopes and dreams of being a successful recording artist on a label they can count on. 

The Impact
Just think, by donating to our campaign you could be potentially helping the next great artist that could change the world with their music, especially if it inspires others to never give up and follow their heart.


What We Need & What You Get
We need about 5,000 dollars to properly record, promote and press the album.  We do this as a hobby because we love the music and the opinions of our fans. We hope that music lovers out there will understand and help out the cause.  In order for us to work with potential great musicians, we want you to know that you are just as much a part of this label as our recording artists are, considering how much pride we take into your opinion.


Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word about our campaign and give Capeside Records a shout-out on all of your social networks!

story:
Thank you to all of our supporters

TICKETS ARE NOW ON SALE!

This campaign is now closed. If you made a contribution and requested any perks, you will be receiving a personal email by the second week of August regarding your perks. If you would still like to make a tax-deductible contribution to the opera, please send it to:

Anima Mundi productions
1327 SE Tacoma St. #143
Portland, OR 97202


IMPORTANT UPDATE (June 23): A generous donor has agreed to match every contribution dollar for dollar. From now until the end of the campaign, your tax-deductible contribution will be DOUBLED!

“You honor me, and my brothers and sisters in arms, with this opera. Please know that as a combat veteran I am truly and deeply touched that you have undertaken such an elusive and misunderstood issue as combat-related PTSD in America today. I am thankful to you all for what you do, and I know my fallen friends would be as well.”

Miah Washburn
1SG, U.S. Army Infantry

An Opera and Service Project that Changes Lives

The Canticle of the Black Madonna is a new opera premiering in Portland, Oregon on September 5, 2014. Created by Ethan Gans-Morse and librettist Tiziana DellaRovere, it is the culmination of four years of hard work in bringing together veterans, military families, nationally-renowned artistic talent, and key supporters needed to produce a ground-breaking, professional performance.

Set in coastal Louisiana, The Canticle of the Black Madonna tells the story of a soldier with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) returning from Afghanistan to his wife during the devastating 2010 Gulf Oil Spill. Together, they face many of the challenges that our nation’s military families encounter in their daily lives. Through stirring music, sets, costumes, and drama, The Canticle  of the Black Madonna ultimately reveals the healing power of divine love, represented by the Black Madonna, which transforms them both forever and touches all who witness it.


More than an Opera

The Canticle of the Black Madonna project goes beyond the opera performance to encompass the following free services for veterans and their families:

  • A facilitated workshop before and after the opera
  • An exclusive performance of the opera 
  • Three weekly art therapy sessions 
  • A guest lecture event featuring experts on combat-related PTSD

The project also provides the following:

  • Casting veterans to appear onstage during the opera
  • Hiring veterans to work on the design of the opera
  • Marketing and sales opportunities for veteran-owned businesses

“The Canticle of the Black Madonna opened my heart and brought new healing to me, 44 years after I returned from Vietnam. This is a gift that should be shared with the world.”

Bill Ritch, Combat veteran, Silver Star recipient,
Former West Point instructor

How you can contribute

  • Help bring this life-changing project to the world by clicking on the “Contribute Now” button in the top-right corner of this page.

  • Write a check to: 

    Anima Mundi productions
    1327 SE Tacoma St. #143
    Portland, OR 97202

  • Please share this campaign with friends using the social media icons at the top of this page (underneath the campaign video):

  • Not sure what to say about us in your social media posts? No problem! We've made sharing a one-click breeze here on our sharing page. 

How your contribution makes a difference

Every dollar contributed goes directly to ensuring that this opera improves the lives of veterans and their families.

Now four years in the making, The Canticle of the Black Madonna is a production of immense reach and proportion. With widespread support, this project has a major cultural impact well beyond its overall $300,000 budget.

This crowdfunding campaign offers a really important means for you, the community, to engage and support a life-changing event. Every dollar you contribute goes directly to ensuring that this opera improves the lives of veterans and their families. 

Here’s a breakdown of where your money will go:

Who We Are

Anima Mundi Productions is a 501(c)(3) non-profit arts initiative dedicated to creating and producing  projects that harness the power of art to stir the soul, foster community, and address urgent social problems.

Art is much more than entertainment. It reconnects us with ourselves, restores our wounded self-image, and reaffirms our passion and our sense of belonging. The arts are the ideal vehicle for social change and the healing of the wounds of the world because they speak directly to the human unconscious through symbolism, ritual, and shared communal experience.

Meet the Creators

Composer Ethan Gans-Morse is a native Oregonian and the executive director of Anima Mundi Productions. His works have been performed by numerous ensembles in the United States, Mexico, and Italy, including the Portland Vocal Consort (winner of the 2010 Composer Competition), Chorus Austin, the American Creators Ensemble, the Quartetto Indaco, the Fireworks Ensemble, and the Eugene Contemporary Chamber Ensemble.

Writer/Librettist Tiziana DellaRovere was trained at the University of Milan, Italy, the California College of Arts and Crafts, and San Francisco State University. She is a published author, mystical artist, and professional counselor with over three decades of experience healing a wide range of psychological conditions.

For complete composer and librettist biographies, click here

Nationally Renowned Talent

Stage Director:  Kristine McIntyre, formally of the Metropolitan Opera and the San Francisco Opera.

Music Director: Ryan Heller, Award-winning Director of Chorus Austin and Southwest Washington Symphony.

Chorus Master: Ethan Sperry, Director of the PSU Chamber Choir, winner of the Seghizzi International Choral Competition in Gorizia, Italy.


Star talent including: 

Michael Mayes, Baritone, recently starring as Rigoletto with Boston Lyric Opera, and as Joseph DeRocher in three productions of Dead Man Walking this year.

Gwendolyn Brown, Contralto, called "a transfixing force of nature" by the LA Times and starring as Maria in the Lyric Opera of Chicago's Porgy & Bess.

For complete cast and production biographies, click here

Audio Clips


Audio clips feature the cast of the 2013 workshop production at the University of Oregon: Catherine Olson, Soprano, Harry Baechtel, Baritone, Dr. Karen Esquivel, Contralto, Andre Flynn, Bass, Heather Holmquest, Soprano, Joshua Heying, Tenor. Orchestra conducted by Maestro Vincent Centeno.

Full 9-minute professional project video

story:
OUR STORY
We met while attending the American Musical and Dramatic Academy (AMDA) in Manhattan. Attending the same school allowed us to experience each other’s work ethic, personal strengths, and performing ability. Upon graduating we each prepared ourselves to audition for casting directors, talent agencies, regional, and local theatre houses. We quickly discovered the reality of being on-again, off-again, working actors. The expense burden of living in this glorious city combined with the need to stay invested in our craft led us to create the New York Nightingales. We decided to determine our own success, and the New York Nightingales are taking flight.

It is the Nightingale mission to serve our community by teaming with fellow artists and nonprofit organizations to promote creative independence and awareness.  Performing is a passion for many that often goes unrewarded or unsupported.  By combining efforts with other artists, musicians, performers, and non-profit organizations, we hope to increase opportunities and raise awareness about performing arts-related issues.

WHAT WE NEED
The New York Nightingales will establish ourselves as a self-sustaining business that will support us doing what we love—performing.  As a business, we will track income and expenses, hire musicians, pay salaries and taxes.  

As performers and recent graduates, the Nightingales do not have the funds necessary to get our business off the ground.  Therefore, we are asking friends, family, and others who believe in the Nightingale mission to donate to our “getting started” campaign.

We’ve put together a detailed budget of what we need to get started.  The summary along with details and justification for each category are below:

Establishing an LLC = $400
Because it’s part of our name, and we live and perform mainly in New York City, we will be establishing our business in accordance with NY State law.

  • Registering the Nightingales name
  • Filing Articles of Organization
  • Publishing Articles in two local newspapers
  • Filing Certificate of Publication

Sound Equipment = $2,300.00
While some venues will be able to provide sound equipment for us, we anticipate that many of our performances will require that we provide our own.  

  • Live Performance Equipment: Portable PA, Eight Channel Mixer, 2-way Speakers, Speaker stands, Mic Stands, and Mic Cables
  • Recording Studio Equipment: Focusrite Scarlett 18i8 USB 2.0 Audio Interface and PreSonus Studio Channel Tube Microphone Preamp
  • Recording and Live: Shure Beta 87A Microphones

Musicians for Recording Holiday EP = $800.00
The Nightingales will record several demo tracks and a Holiday EP.  While “karaoke style” backing tracks are available for a few of our songs (e.g., Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy), most songs will require the help of musicians.  Any funds received beyond our campaign goal will go towards hiring musicians for additional recording and live performances.

General Business Expenses = $700
The New York Nightingales will need various materials for raising awareness about the campaign, rewarding those who contribute, and establishing a brand.

  • Business Cards
  • Printing
  • T-shirts
  • Postage and Shipping
  • Launching Website
  • IndieGoGo Commission

TOTAL = $4,200.00

WHAT YOU GET
We are extremely grateful to everyone who can help us get started and have some amazing gifts for contributing to our campaign!

THE IMPACT

Every artist, musician, actor, or performer knows how hard it is to earn a living doing what he or she loves.  Many don’t get the opportunity.  By contributing to our campaign you will be helping us, as we strive to help other artists and musicians along the way. We will be working with other musicians and performers for live performances and recording.  We will also work with multiple non-profit organizations to raise awareness about the performing arts.  

THE RISK
Any new business has its risks.  But, we are an extremely dedicated and determined group of women.  We will not give up on our dream or our mission if we do get what we need from this campaign.  We will simply find another way to make it happen.  The New York Nightingales is more than a hobby.  It is our livelihood.  Failing is not an option.  

We are currently targeting the holiday season as a major performance opportunity.  If we are unable to meet our campaign goal, our budgeting priorities will shift, and our performance options will be limited.  We still intend to register ourselves as an LLC, but will need to raise funds before we can do so.  We would like to raise funds through performing, but we will not be able to perform in many venues without our own equipment.  We will also not be able to record demos or perform certain songs without musicians.  Everything we need to get started requires money that we simple do not have at this point.  

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you can’t contribute please help us spread the word about our campaign!  Share! Like! Subscribe!

-xx NGs

Facebook:  /nynightingales
Instagram: @new_york_nightingales
YouTube:  New York Nightingales

story:
Hello everyone! Thank you for visiting our Indiegogo project. We are only at 2%. Help us reach our goal to make this project possible. Every dollar counts. 

 
 
Who Are We?

Mark Mautone, Project Creator/Designer

Mark Mautone has over 18 years experience in special education and is currently a lead teacher for a New Jersey school district in their Applied Behavior Analysis Program for children with autism.  He is also the designer/developer of ITPADD iPhone/iPod Touch app, which was named one of 27 life changing apps for people with Tramatic Brain Injury by Brainline.org. Mark is an Apple Certified Associate in iWorks Suite.  Mark has extensive knowledge in assistive technology that includes adapting and creating curriculum that is effectively harnesseed to iPad/iPod Touch applications to create a seamless learning experience. 

In addition, Mark speaks professionally for organizations, school districts and companies on using technology with individuals with autism.  He has presented for Autism Speaks, Autism NJ, Caldwell College, Hofstra University, Camden Community College, Aruba Autism Foundation, Apple Retail, Apple Education K-12 (Reaching All Learners), and Macworld/iWorld 2013.

Brian McGlade, Lead Developer

Brian McGlade started his career as a software developer during his studies at Cornell University, where he graduated with a BS in Computer Science. He has been a developer for the mobile team of S&P Capital IQ for the past one and a half years, working on both their iPad and smartphone financial apps. He is primarily responsible for the front-end development of the iPad app, specifically creating custom UI controls. He also works on bringing new data sets to the app, both on the front and back ends. Brian primarily works in Objective-C and C#, but has experience with the major web development languages as well as Java, Python, and Matlab. Brian previously interned with Microsoft, on the Windows team. His main contribution there was creating an automation tool for the Windows Logo Kit team.

Why are we doing this?

We are raising funds for the development of an integrated universal interface suite for the Apple iPad that is simple for a parent, teacher, or individual with autism to learn. Over the past couples years, apps have been introduced to parents and teachers that are designed to educate individuals using specific tools. I own over 2300 apps and have had the opportunity to apply them in the capacity in which it was designed. Although some are helpful, most aren't easy to learn, share a similar interface, poorly designed and are very costly. But one important aspect I found across most apps is the limitation of independent usability for an individual with autism spectrum disorder. As we strive for an individual with autism spectrum disorder to become independent we must also provide them with the tools to do so.

The Spectrum Tool Suite has been carefully designed for a parents, teachers and individuals with autism spectrum disorder to learn, implore, and meet educational needs. The Spectrum Tool Suite will have 5 fully customizable tools that are needed to educate an individual with autism that share a common interface. The tools include a photo schedule, text schedule, token system, communication system, and picture identification program.

What We Need & What You Get

Our campaign is looking to raise $23,000. The funds raised will be used for the development of the Spectrum Tool Suite. We have some GREAT perks when you contribute to this campaign. Check them out!

If we are successful with funding the project, the Spectrum Tool Suite will cost 75% less than buying all 5 comparable type apps separately. If we do not meet our goal, the funds we receive will be applied directly to the project.

The Impact

The Spectrum Tool Suite is comprised of the essential learning platforms needed to educate an individual with autism. The development of this project will give parents and teachers a set of tools that can be applied across all environments.  The enhanced design of the Spectrum Tool Suite was not only geared for a parent or teacher to easily learn, but also an individual with autism. These set of tools have similar interface throughout the platform making it easy for anyone to create or update learning materials.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people are not able to contribute. We ask if you share this project on your social media platform to help spread the word.

story:
WHO IS HAZARDIS SOUNDZ?

Hazardis Soundz is creative talent, Christian Rodriguez, who has been making music for well over a decade. He is a certified Audio Engineer since 2003, graduating from the School of Audio Engineering (SAE) in Miami, Florida. He is a recognized music producer and head engineer for multi-platinum recording artist N.O.R.E (aka Noreaga) and works closely with Benzino, founder of Hip-Hop Weekly and star of Love and Hip-hop Atlanta. 

Hazardis Soundz is a brand and a family-owned business. We pride ourselves in providing the BEST sound quality for all our mixing and mastering services, as well as providing our clients the best recording experience by working with a top-notch professional engineer/producer. We have a long list of satisfied clientele, and are sought after by high-profile artists and producers. We use the latest equipment and technologies in the music industry providing a competitive advantage over other music studios and engineers.

In 2011, Hazardis Soundz released his latest independent album, HazMat 2: The Outbreak, all comprised of his original production and featured such artists as Rick Ross, N.O.R.E., Curren$y, Ace Hood, Fat Joe, Raekwon, and Busta Rhymes.

Hazardis Soundz has had great success in working with many well-known artists in the industry and his music has been used on HBO, Sirius XM, national television, clear channel radio, movies, and many music albums. He has also been featured in national publications such as Hip-Hop Weekly.

Read Hazardis Soundz’s full bio HERE.

 

 

WHAT IS THE PURPOSE OF THIS CAMPAIGN?

We all know how difficult it is to operate your own business, and we also know how tough the music industry can be.

Unfortunately due to unforeseen circumstances, Hazardis Soundz has to leave the location where the studio has been operating. It is very critical that we find a new location to be able to continue the business, because at the end of the day, this studio is what helps provide for our family. We also have clients that we have to continue to provide services for. Our clients are our backbone and we cannot disappoint them. This is where your contributions come in! 

 

WHAT DO WE NEED?

Building a music recording studio takes a lot of work and modifications. From special flooring, acoustics, and wiring to furniture, equipment, and interior designing.  With your help, Hazardis Soundz will be able to secure a new location for the studio and be able to cover the start-up costs needed to fully run and operate the studio.

We need to raise $7,000 to keep the business going.

  • $3,000 start-up costs = first month, last month rent and security deposit
  • $2,000 building costs = acoustics, flooring, painting, etc.
  • $2,000 equipment = wiring, microphones, computer, furniture, etc

 

WHAT DO YOU GET?

Not only are you assisting a family-owned business stay afloat, you are also being a positive contributor to our community by helping to keep the doors open of small businesses.

As a way for us to thank you for your contributions, we are offering unique perks that you can choose from. Check out the Perks section for more information and make your selection today!

Where there’s a will, there’s a way. Every little bit helps and is greatly appreciated.

 

WHAT’S IN THE FUTURE FOR HAZARDIS SOUNDZ?

Hazardis Soundz recently finished working on N.O.R.E 's sixth album Student of the Game which he engineered, produced, and was A&R on it. 

Currently in the works is the 3rd studio album HazMat 3 which will be entirely produced and engineered by Hazardis Soundz. There are also two collaborative projects in the works sladed to be released later this year/early next. One is with Boston-native Reks and the other is with Miami’s LMS. Both artists have a large following and are well respected.

Hazardis Soundz is planning to expand the business by offering mentoring and internship opportunities to college graduates who are interested in music careers. We also plan on offering a summer camp program to youth and young adults that will teach them about production, recording, engineering, and song making. The goal is to have the first camp during the summer of 2014. With your help we can truly make this happen!

 

 

Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign and for any contribution you decide to make. Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can always help by spreading the word! Indiegogo's share tools are very effective for doing that. 

Love and Light,

Christian and Vivian Rodriguez

www.hazardissoundz.com

Get ya Sound Right!! ™

story:
About The Sound Shelter

The Sound Shelter is a full service recording studio and rehearsal space in Nashville created by Brett Ryan Stewart, Chris Tench, Tres Sasser, and Robyn Davis to provide an affordable recording space for the independent musician.
 
Description
 
The Sound Shelter was at one time a shelter for people who had fallen on hard times and needed a temporary place to stay. We took that vision of helping people and applied it to musicians and their music. While the aesthetic at the Sound Shelter has become modern and spacious, the spirit has remained independent. We are committed to the independent artist as well as the professional, partnering with them to offer the highest quality recordings and services while keeping cost at a minimum!
 

So where do you come in?

We are looking to cover our building costs ($35,000) in order to remove our overhead so we can offer the lowest rates for independent artists to create and record their music. All of the money we raise will go towards paying off that intial investment the Sound Shelter team made to get the studio up and running...and as you can see from our Facebook Page, we are indeed up and running! Even if you are not a musician, we have some cool rewards for you to check out that way you can partner with us as well! Any help you can provide, whether it be financial, or just spreading the word, will make a huge difference in the success of this campaign. 
 
Be sure to watch our video above and also check out the Studio Tour Video.

We look forward to having you out to the Sound Shelter!

 

Check Out the Swag!

Sennheiser M421 (2)

story:
Short Summary

I am a solo Canadian folk and indie artist from Hamilton, Ontario, Canada.

After moving from Toronto to Niagara in 1991, I began an immense passion for creating an unique and dynamic sound in the Niagara community. Since 2011, I have been an activist for mental health awareness as I have been coming to grips with my own bouts of depression and anxiety that I have been battling for years, and on my worst days, leaving me helpless on the floor, unable to move. Music is what has always grounded me, along with the sense of community that music brings with it.

My solo efforts have earned me a reputation in Niagara as a noble and sincere artist. I also have a deep passion for my community. Every year I am contantly looking to make charitable contributions in any community I am part of, meanwhile yearning to add a different perspective of the folk and indie genre to the music scene.

My early success as a solo artist are due in large part to my passion for writing creative and fulfilling lyrics, which I like to  describe as observations of life.

I want to write songs that can reach through the speakers and grab a person and let them know we are there with them. Music can have such an emotional and spiritual aura about it that in order to be considered successful, you must tap into that aura because you will never know who is listening to your words.

This campaign is about encouraging and supporting the creative minds of not only for my own endeavours but also for the youth of the Niagara Region. Half of all the donations will be going to the youth group at the Niagara Regional Native Centre. The purpose of the funds will be to purchase art supplies for their program.

This campaign is very important because not only will it assist me in acheiving one of my life long goals, it is also going to support the youth and their creative minds while they reclaim their culture in ways that they may never have been able to before.. With each donation of $100 or more, you will receive a free digital copy of the album I will be creating as well as a piece of artwork created by one of the youth!

The way the money will be broken down per group is:

JAY SHAWANA

- Pre- and Post-Preduction

- Studio Time

- Sound Engineering and Mixing

- Mastering of songs

- CD manufacturing

- Packaging

and

- Marketing

 

YOUTH GROUP

- Purchase of Art Supplies

- Funds for Art related field trips

- Administration and Operating costs of youth group

 

With your help, not only will I be able to fulfill my dream, but you will also be helping these youth by giving them not only the freedom of expression, you may also be giving them a way of communicating things they may not be able to say through other forms of communication.


If you would like to help in other ways, you may do so by making donations of art supplies or musical instruments for the Niagara Regional Native Centre Youth Group by contacting Jay Shawana - jasonshawana81@gmail.com or the Youth Group Leader, Seth Hill at bhill_ccay@hotmail.com

story:
Tune Into The Windsinger Vibration

Can you feel it?

The Windsinger is a sonic vibrational musical instrument.

Whether you know how to play an instrument or not, or hold a tune, or not, we all have a primal sense. A feeling within us, that enables us to feel along with music when it is played for us. It gets us to move. To dance...

Albert Einstein said, “Concerning matter, we have been all wrong. What we have called matter is energy, whose vibration has been so lowered as to be perceptible to the senses. There is no matter... We are all Vibration!”

 

Enter the Windsinger...

“The Windsinger is the newest and easiest instrument to play in the world!”

The Windsinger enables you to be one with any music played, any tone, any vibration, even a chainsaw, or traffic noise is vibration that you can play with. All without the fear of making a wrong tone!

This tune-able vibrational instrument has many applications percussion, drone, wind-chi workout, sound healing device, lightsaber, and many more

Did you ever want to play an instrument, or play with a band?

Have you ever dreamed of playing the Didgeridoo, but couldn’t master the circular breath?

The Windsinger is an extension of your breath and your breadth, an extension of your arms, an extension of your very energy field... helping you to vibrate in a new and primal way.

 

But it is much more than that...

This is a movement—A vibrational movement and way to empower individuals, especially young people to play with vibrations and to connect our thoughts and feelings as we project our energy... together!

 

R*evolutionary MISSION

Our mission and purpose is to connect people... to get them to resonate within themselves and with one another; For people to have fun as they play with vibration, in a new way!

 

Funding Needs

Minimally, we need the funds to purchase 1000 fully decked out Windsingers (with LED lights) that we can give away (to you!) so we can create a number of "Windphonys" throughout the Bay Area, at Burning Man and ultimately around the world! A Windphony is a band of Windsingers (which could mean hundreds of players, or more, who will gather together to play this vibrational instrument in concert.)

We want to create an effective video and social media campaign that will light the fuse on the Windsinger Re*evolution! Once created we will seed Windsngers around the world, especially at hot spots, and through our video train "Windsinger bands" to use these powerful tools to better the world.

 

Cool Perks

Our perks are way cool! Our supporters can get one of the first of the Windsingers that are now being manufactured, as well as acknowledgement in the video, on the website and in our growing global community, for their contribution to help us spread this powerful vibrational message...one Windsinger at a time.

 

Venues

We plan to do a number of performances throughout the Bay Area and a premier Windphony with 888 players at Burning man 2013. And we want YOU to be a part of it! This will create a template that can be applyed to "bands" coming together around the world, to vibrationally transform a space. We will produce a video tha will inspire the world to the benefits of the Windsinger.

We want to create a new genre of transformational movements that can be produced over and over again, as a template for positive actions around the world. We will empower and "arm" a small army of Windsingers to lead the charge...and ultimately inspire millions of Windsingers to come together to make positive change—on a vibrational level!

Help us in our cause and even if you can't contribute financially, please help us get the word out. Use the IndieGoGo share tools and let's get the show on the road...it is time for the world to shift gears, one Windsinger at a time!

story:
Is this the real life? Is this Just Fantasy?

Being able to record our First Album is simply put an honor. Few people get to experience such an overwhelming amount of joy that we feel every time we get to share the stage with our talented friends and colleagues. As a band we pour our hearts out on stage at every show and we want to be able to share that energy to a wider audience. An album to us isn't just about the music but it's a representation of who we are, where we've been, the struggles and the triumphs we all face. We have never been a sideline band and try to include our fans and supporters in everything we do and this campaign is one of the biggest extensions of that. This campaign isn't just about raising funds. To us it's about sharing the uncommon experience of building something bigger than ourselves with people we've come to love and those we haven't had the pleasure to meet...yet. 

Become a Supporter

Unfortunately putting together an album, merch, artwork, and recording isn't cheap. After hundreds of emails and countless hours of research we've set our goal to $3,000- which we think with your help and support is more than achievable! These funds will ensure we can record, mix, master and deliver merch that is professional and doesn't hinder our creative abilities. We found an amazing Designer Andrew Stephens that greatly reduced his fees to help us make this happen. We are working with him on creating a unique album design and with his vision a cohesive line of brand new stunning + high quality merch. We've included perks that we think our friends and supporters are going to love. One of our favorites is actually including select perk contributors on the album as back-up vocalists! If we do not reach our goal we may have to sacrifice some recording options, however, all perks will be fulfilled regardless of the amount of money we raise.  Any excess funds raised will go to produce a professional music video for one of our songs from the Album.

We know you have options

There's a lot of amazing bands across the country that deserve your support. We do not take your contribution or attention lightly. We will be posting at a minimum weekly updates to our indiegogo campaign as well as to our Facebook Page!

Going the Extra Mile

Besides claiming one of our perks you can help us spread our music and passion by sharing this campaign to your social media pages,

liking us on Facebook @ https://www.facebook.com/buildingslikemountains

Subscribing to our Youtube Page @ https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqKggWGGIzYKh2...

Few people get to experience such an overwhelming amount of joy that we feel every time we get to share the stage with our talented friends and colleagues. As a band we pour our hearts out on stage at every show and we want to be able to share that energy to a wider audience. An album to us isn't just about the music but it's a representation of who we are, where we've been, the struggles and the triumphs we all face. We have never been a sideline band and try to include our fans and supporters in everything we do and this campaign is one of the biggest extensions of that. This campaign isn't just about raising funds. To us it's about sharing the uncommon experience of building something bigger than ourselves with people we've come to love and those we haven't had the pleasure to meet...yet. 

Become a Supporter
Unfortunately putting together an album, merch, artwork, and recording isn't cheap. After hundreds of emails and countless hours of research we've set our goal to $3,000- which we think with your help and support is more than achievable! These funds will ensure we can record, mix, master and deliver merch that is professional and doesn't hinder our creative abilities. We found an amazing Designer Andrew Stephens that greatly reduced his fees to help us make this happen. We are working with him on creating a unique album design and with his vision a cohesive line of brand new stunning + high quality merch. We've included perks that we think our friends and supporters are going to love. One of our favorites is actually including select perk contributors on the album as back-up vocalists! If we do not reach our goal we may have to sacrifice some recording options, however, all perks will be fulfilled regardless of the amount of money we raise.  Any excess funds raised will go to produce a professional music video for one of our songs from the Album.

We know you have options
There's a lot of amazing bands across the country that deserve your support. We do not take your contribution or attention lightly. We will be posting at a minimum weekly updates to our indiegogo campaign as well as to our Facebook Page!

Going the Extra Mile
Besides claiming one of our perks you can help us spread our music and passion by sharing this campaign to your social media pages,
liking us on Facebook @ https://www.facebook.com/buildingslikemountains
Subscribing to our Youtube Page @ https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqKggWGGIzYKh2...

story:
SING music video 

Sing is a project written with the intent of giving hope to people going through hard times. Adding a visual element to a song increases it's ability to impact the listeners and helps to tell the story. Click on link below to listen to the song.

https://soundcloud.com/abraham-james-216028596/...

What We Need 

Any resources donated to this project will go toward the following:

  • Childrens Choir 
  • 2 days of filming
  • Video arrangment and editing

The Impact

I am hoping to create a music video that encourages people who are battling heartbreak and depression, especially around the holiday season. Music is amazing in it's ability to lift our spirits and help us deal with difficult circumstances. I have felt more and more recently, the necessity to write music with a positive message with the idea of spreading hope and giving people motivation to continue to try even when they feel like giving up. 

How you can Help

Any donation, small or large, will be greatly appreciated. A project of this magnitude would generally require somewhere between $1000 and $1500 to see to completion. Rashad believes in the project and has committed to help regardless of compensation, but I have set a goal of $650 to help with some of the costs of making this video, as well as providing some compensation for Rashad's time and generousity.

story:
A Rannygazoo album at last?!

Hello, Our Public. We, as you’ve doubtless surmised, are Rannygazoo, America’s Favorite Ukulele Duo*. For, oh, a dozen years now, we’ve been bringing our own special brand of joy** to audiences as far-flung as Brooklyn, Connecticut, & Humboldt County – but mostly Louisville, Kentucky, our home sweet home. We sing songs left behind by time’s brutal onward slog, primarily songs about alcohol of illegal provenance and women of questionable reputation. We sing them in harmony against a spectacular backdrop of ukulele and with occasional interjections of other noises we hesitate to name, lest they lose their powers.

We are also married. To each other, yes.

We feel it is our duty to bring a proper recording of some of these (sometimes justly) forgotten lyrics and melodies into the world, because many people have requested just such a thing of us, and who are we to reject their pleas, particularly when said pleas are accompanied by the offer of an honest buck?

Your contribution(s) will make this dream a reality, but not nearly so harsh a reality as, if adulthood has taught us anything, the usual sort of reality tends to be. We seek only to spread joy and maybe a bit of remembrance, flask-bound and sprinkled over the graves of songs long-neglected yet promising to tell us something about where we are and where we’ve been. Like that time we tried to make booze illegal and accidentally turned the entire population into criminals.

*some precincts have not yet reported

**and a little pain, without which joy is meaningless; patent pending

What We Need & What You Get

So here’s what we need:

  • We’ve gotta record those songs;
  • We’ve gotta have those recordings mixed and mastered;
  • We’ve gotta get a pretty cover made;
  • We’ve gotta put them on physical and digital media platforms;
  • We’ve gotta get them into people’s hands;
  • We’ve also gotta pay for the very perquisites we offer below;
  • And if we don't reach our entire goal, we’ll do as much of the above as we can – by hook or crook, there will be an album; that’s an inevitability. You can’t get out of it that easily.

The Perquisites

You’re not just throwing piles of spondulix* our way; heavens, no. Depending on your contribution, you get...stuff! Though not really merch - there are plenty of t-shirts & bits of plastic cluttering your home & the world. No, GOOD stuff like:

  • A copy of the album in whatever form best suits you, CDr digital (vinyl, shellac, &/or cylinders aren’t currently a part of the plan, unless this thing takes off more than we expect);
  • Oodles of our personal thanks, expressed verbally in written form, on nice paper with a fountain pen;
  • A credit in the album liner notes
  • A custom ringtone of that…that weird muted trumpet sound Greg makes…you know the sound…once you’ve…it just…*shudders*…anyway. Ringtone;
  • An evening out with the Maupins at a local watering hole we frequent frequently;
  • A song, in our inimitable style, written and dedicated personally to you! (we’ll ask whether you prefer “charmingly witty” or “just filthy”);
  • An acoustic house concert (provided your house is within a reasonable distance from ours or one of the places we visit regularly);
  • Some combination of the above!

*that, like "rannygazoo", is another lost word, but context clues will serve you well here

Other Ways You Can Help

And if you can't contribute, we understand and ask only that you please help us get the word out to those who can. Every little bit helps.

Short Summary

Whether you’re a long-time Teramaze fan or recently converted one, Dean, Andrew, Nick and Chris thank you for your support, whether it be buying our albums, streaming our music and of course the die-hard fans that attend our live shows.

Teramaze have had a long recording career starting in 1995 with the debut album ‘Doxology’ all the way up to our sixth album ‘Are We Soldiers’ released in 2018. One of the most amazing things about this band’s survival and ability to make records is that we have always had financial backing from record labels.

Earlier this year we were released from our record label we were presented with two options.

1. Shop around our next album’s and see which labels were interested and would fund it… and ultimately have to do things on label’s terms.

2. Go independent. Release music when we want, as fast as we want and be able create our music on our own terms.

When you look at the two options, it’s pretty obvious which one we as a band wanted to go with. The problem with going independent is that it puts a massive, up front financial strain on the band, to not only cover the costs of the album, but also its promotion, film clips, designing costs… the list goes on.

What We Need & What You Get

We have set our end goal to $20,000 - $40,000. Where does that money go? It’s only fair you as the fans and backers of this project should know!

ALBUM BUDGET

Studio Time (tracking, mixing mastering)                             $15,000 

Artwork                                                                                              $2,000

2 Film Clips + Visualizer/Lyric Video                                        $4,000

Photography for promo                                                                 $2,000

Choir hire                                                                                            $1,000

CD & booklet design & printing                                                  $2,000

The Impact

We can comfortably say this album is the most honest, heart-felt, intricate and well-orchestrated piece of music that Teramaze have done to date. 

We’d love you to be involved, and the best way to get involved is jump on the perks below!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some fans may not have the means to financially contribute... but that doesn't mean they can't help us! You can help Teramaze by:

1. Spreading the word and sharing this campaign

2. Continuing to stream our music
