story:
HELCULT:  Fenrismaw immortalized.

Fenrismaw unleashed its self-titled demo in 2010, which recieved substantial acclaim. It was heralded as "dynamic... crushingly heavy, highly melodic" (Forged WNY) and "full of potential" (The Metal Observer).

We went on to play countless shows alongside local and national acts alike and established ourselves as one of the region's driving forces.

Check out this full-set video from our show with Marduk, Inquisition, and Moonspell.

 

HELCULT

After 4 years of crushing devastation in the name of Heathen Gods, Fenrismaw has reached the end of its road. Our vocalist is going to Iceland for at least 2 years, and the band is going on indefinite hiatus. But before that happens, we are set to release our full-length album: "Helcult."

The "Helcross" symbolizes the Heathen Black Trinity: the fury of the Fenris Wolf, the unrelenting carnage of Jormungandr, and the cunning venom of Death. Our music embodies the primal wrath of the old, the forgotten powers, to whom the album pays homage.

The album is a testament to the dedication of both ourselves and our fans. Recorded and ready for release, it picks up where our demo left off and burrows straight into the underworld. It is exactly how we, as a band, envisioned our music.

"Helcult" includes a rerecording of three of the four songs from our demo, four all-new originals, and a bonus cover of Grave's "Extremely Rotten Flesh."

 

 

But we need your help!

Helcult is recorded, mixed, and mastered--it just needs to be printed. With the help of our friends and fans, we need to raise $2000.  

This money will go towards the hefty cost of printing 6-panel digipaks and creating a host of new merch items, including T-shirts, posters, and limited edition Helcross pendants.

 

How we'll use the money

Of the $2000 we hope to raise, roughly $1500 will go towards production of the CDs, another $400 (at least) will go towards T-shirts, and the rest will go towards the formidable cost of production and shipping/transportation of the perks.

 

Make "Helcult" a reality

Like many bands, Fenrismaw has had its ups and downs over the last 4 years, but "Helcult" is by far the greatest thing we have accomplished. With your help, we can turn our hard work into something permanent and leave off on a positive, triumphant note.

 

Bonus items:

Helcult T-shirt:

Limited edition Helcross pendant, designed by Mindless Heron Custom Pendants:

Hand-painted, one-of-a-kind skull from the Fenrismaw photoshoot:

 

 

 

 

*NOTE - To have your name put in the liner notes, the accompanying perk must be claimed by July 20, 2013.

story:
What

The Virgin Wolves have come a long way in their 3 year lifespan, and are finally releasing their 3rd studio effort, and very first Full Length Record! Doing things right takes precious time and money, and The Virgin Wolves have put everything they have into this record. They are so proud to release it, but still need to pay off the team that has worked just as hard as they have to make it happen.... AND THEY HAVE LESS THAN 30 DAYS TO RAISE THE MONEY!

Donation Amounts

TVW has come up with 3 simple donation amounts and packages. Please, no matter what you can spare, send this to family, friends and fellow fans! Every little bit helps!

  • $25 (or more) DONATION:
    • You get a link to download the record on Thursday, before anyone else!
  • $50 (or more) DONATION:
    • You get a link to download the record on Thursday, before anyone else,
    • AND a Free t-shirt.
  • $100 (or more) DONATION:
    • You get a link to download the record on Thursday, before anyone else,
    • a Free t-shirt
    • AND 2 ALL ACCESS passes to a The Virgin Wolves show of your choice in 2013.
  • $250 (or more) DONATION:
    • You get a link to download the record on Thursday, before anyone else,
    • 2 Free t-shirts
    • 4 ALL ACCESS passes to a The Virgin Wolves show of your choice in 2013,
    • AND an autographed 8x10 photo of the band!

story:
https://soundcloud.com/samantha-marsh-5

Hello Friends!

I went to Uganda with a team last summer to help with an organization called Hope for Humans that helps kids with Nodding Syndrome. This summer I will be going back to Uganda with my campus Ministry to help start a school in Kitgum and visit the school in Odek that we went to last year. I am using this page to exchange a new record that I am recording for financial support for this trip. The new record will have four songs and will be recorded using some fairly nice equipment that my university is graciously letting me use for free. Hopefully, it will include guest artists (i.e. my friends) to thicken up the sound. As well as selling the new record, I will also be offering my first EP I ever recorded (arguably shouldn't have recorded) with some packets and offering living room concerts and things of that nature. The options abound!

By March 1st I need $1000 dollars to go towards the plane ticket, which is why this campaign is so short. All of the money that is donated here (minus the percentage that will be taken by Indiegogo, which is reduced if I reach my goal) will go directly to my mission trip fund. I will, hopefully, be playing at a local coffee shop to raise money for this trip also.

Nodding Syndrome is a disease that came about when Joseph Kony terrorized Uganda forcing people to flee to refugee camps. In these camps kids up to age 18 ended up with this disease, cause and cure being unknown. When we go to Uganda we will help begin a new school for these kids in Kitgum, similar to the one we visited in Odek last year, we will visit the school in Odek and our biggest goal is to love on the people of Uganda. 

If you can not help me financially please help me by spreading the word of this page to anyone you may know via facebook, email or any of the tools this site offers. It would be a huge help to me if you helped spread the word.

I am working on recording the new album starting this week. Since it is a short album I will hopefully have it finished by the end of the semester. I will try my hardest to get your records to you as soon as I possibly can (physical copies and digital downloads).

Thank you all so much for even visiting this page and being a part of my journey with the Lord! I can't wait to return to Uganda as it has stolen my heart.

story:
Heart to Heart Jerry Williams- Pastor

Jerry is a  Pastor at  Heart to Heart  Ministries in Detroit,  last yr after searching and finding a van to help the elderly and needy,,,,,,,it was stolen,  please help this man of  God continue his  Ministry to those that society has left  behind,  but  NOT  by  God.       

link to the  website.   THANK  YOU for even  $1

http://ccpc.dlinkddns.com/mb/h2hmin/services/our-newsletter/

Mark 12:41-44


The Widow’s Offering

41 Jesus sat down opposite the place where the offerings were put and watched the crowd putting their money into the temple treasury. Many rich people threw in large amounts. 42 But a poor widow came and put in two very small copper coins, worth only a few cents.

43 Calling his disciples to him, Jesus said, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow has put more into the treasury than all the others. 44 They all gave out of their wealth; but she, out of her poverty, put in everything—all she had to live on.”

story:
Hello there, and thank you for stopping by our campaign! We're Eric and Eunjin, a classical duo who teamed up to perform works by Beethoven, Brahms, and new commissioned works in the Chicago-land area in March 2018.

 

 

We began our collaboration in early Fall 2017 at the University of Massachusetts Amherst exploring works by composers ranging from the 19th century to today. We want to share our perspectives on Beethoven and Brahms by performing their works and by having an open educating our audiences about them. In addition, we would like to use part of the campaig funds to commission a new work by a Chicago composer to expand the violin/piano duo repertoire.  

Having an open conversation about classical music in a concert setting is one of many ways to get new people interested in this genre. With your help, you can send us to Chicago to perform, and be a part of a project that will allow us to bring music education in a series of community outreach events in local schools and libraries.

What We Need Help With

The way we'll be breaking down our campaign funds is through the following:
- New Commission by Chicago Composer
- Venue Rental/Piano Tuning (venue TBA)
- Travel Expenses (airfare/equipment handling)
- Recital Recording (part of perk)

Our biggest challenge is to perform a program that's diverse, and engaging to our audiences in the hope of creating a sustainable project in the future. 

We hope that you will consider donating to our campaign. If you cannot make a contribution, all we ask is if you can kindly send this along to someone who may be interested in our cause. 

Hope to see you in March!

-Eric and Eunjin

story:
We've come along way this last year.


Our Debut album was released in February. We've recorded more tunes – now with more disco beat – and played a bunch of stupidly fun Berlin shows. Now it's time to spread our wings and go on TOUR!

Here's the hard bit. We love playing. We love playing to new people and friends alike, and will go on this tour regardless – we're incredibly excited, but, like many indie undertakings it's a difficult and expensive endeavour, and we usually lose out in the end. A lot. So if you have the means to support us, please donate to our fund. A fund for flights, van hire, petrol money, roadside jumbo pack dried noodles. 

If you give us some cash we'll give you so many things: EP/album downloads, free entry to gigs, t-shirts, guitar lessons, songs, animations and naming our first born children*. 

If you can't donate but can contribute in another way, please get at us. (We're thinking a floor to sleep on, a shower, directions, links to local media/photographers, hugz)

(If €10 is a stretch we'd be so delighted with any donations from 1euro up.)

Tour Schedule

18/08 Berlin                28/08 Manchester
23/08 Dublin              29/08 Rhyl
24/08 Belfast             30/08 Cardiff
25/08 Edinburgh       31/08 Bristol
26/08 Glasgow          01/09 TBC
27/08 Leeds                02/09 London

*not entirely true

story:
What happens when you're in quarantine? You watch a LOT of movies! That's when Chris Laney (PRETTY MAIDS) realized how many fantastic soundtracks there are out there. After an online chat with Allan Sørensen (PRETTY MAIDS, ROYAL HUNT) and Morten Sandager (PRETTY MAIDS, MERCENARY), they decided to contact some friends asking them to join in for some quarantine fun. When Björn “Speed” Strid (SOILWORK, THE NIGHT FLIGHT ORCHESTRA), Pontus Norgren (HAMMERFALL), Pontus Egberg (KING DIAMOND) and Linnéa Vikström Egg (KAMELOT, THERION) joined, “At The Movies” was born.

The group set out to record and release videos of ten movie soundtracks from the 80’s over the course of ten weeks. The songs were recorded in everyone’s home studio, production and mixing was done by Chris Laney while Allan Sørensen and Pontus Egberg shared video editing duties.

On the song “We Don’t Need Another Hero” the group was also joined by heavy weights like Ronnie Atkins (PRETTY MAIDS), Bruce Kulick (ex-KISS) and Jacob Hansen (star producer of VOLBEAT/AMARANTHE/PRETTY MAIDS) as guest stars.

The anthem “No Easy Way Out” from Rocky IV was the first one out and is already praised by its original singer Robert Tepper. The ten songs featured are:

 

 

1. No Easy Way Out (Robert Tepper - Rocky IV)

Björn Speed Strid- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Chris Laney- Guitars, Backing Vocals

Allan Sørensen- Drums

Morten Sandager- Keyboards

Pontus Egberg- Bass

Pontus Norgren- Solo guitar

 

2. Maniac (Michael Sembello - Flashdance)

Linnéa Vikström Egg- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Björn Speed Strid- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Chris Laney- Guitars, Backing Vocals

Allan Sørensen- Drums

Morten Sandager- Keyboards

Pontus Egberg - Bass

Pontus Norgren- Solo guitar

 

3. St. Elmo’s Fire (John Parr – St. Elmo’s Fire)

Björn Speed Strid- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Chris Laney- Guitars, Backing Vocals

Allan Sørensen- Drums

Morten Sandager- Keyboards

Pontus Egberg- Bass

Pontus Norgren- Solo guitar

 

4. A View To A Kill (Duran Duran – James Bond 007 – A View To A Kill)

Björn Speed Strid- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Chris Laney- Guitars, Backing Vocals

Allan Sørensen- Drums

Morten Sandager- Keyboards

Pontus Egberg- Bass

Pontus Norgren- Solo guitar

 

5. (I’ve Had) The Time Of My Life (Billy Medley, Jennifer Warnes – Dirty Dancing)

Linnéa Vikström Egg- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Björn Speed Strid- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Chris Laney- Guitars, Backing Vocals

Allan Sørensen- Drums

Morten Sandager- Keyboards

Pontus Egberg- Bass

Pontus Norgren- Solo guitar

 

6. Wouldn’t It Be Good (Nik Kershaw – Pretty In Pink)

Björn Speed Strid- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Linnéa Vikström Egg- Backing Vocals

Chris Laney- Guitars, Backing Vocals

Allan Sørensen- Drums

Morten Sandager- Keyboards, Solo

Pontus Egberg- Bass

Pontus Norgren- Solo guitar

 

7. We Don’t Need Another Hero (Tina Turner – Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome)

Ronnie Atkins (Pretty Maids) – Lead Vocals

Bruce Kulick (ex-Kiss) – Solo guitar

Jacob Hansen – Guitars & Backing Vocals

Linnéa Vikström Egg- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Björn Speed Strid- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Chris Laney- Guitars, Backing Vocals

Allan Sørensen- Drums, Backing Vocals

Morten Sandager- Keyboards, Backing Vocals

Pontus Egberg- Bass, Backing Vocals

Pontus Norgren- Guitar, Backing Vocals

 

8. The Power Of Love (Huey Lewis And The News – Back To The Future)

Björn Speed Strid- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Linnéa Vikström Egg- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Chris Laney- Guitars

Allan Sørensen- Drums

Morten Sandager- Keyboards

Pontus Egberg- Bass

Pontus Norgren- Guitar

 

9. The Heat Is On (Glenn Frey – Beverly Hills Cop)

Björn Speed Strid- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Linnéa Vikström Egg- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Chris Laney- Guitars

Allan Sørensen- Drums

Morten Sandager- Keyboards

Pontus Egberg- Bass

Pontus Norgren- Guitar

 

10. The Neverending Story (Limahl – The Neverending Story)

Björn Speed Strid- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Linnéa Vikström Egg- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Chris Laney- Guitars

Allan Sørensen- Drums

Morten Sandager- Keyboards

Pontus Egberg- Bass

Pontus Norgren- Guitar

 

11. Far From Over (Frank Stallone - Staying Alive) - BONUS TRACK

Björn Speed Strid- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Linnéa Vikström Egg- Lead Vocals, Backing Vocals

Chris Laney- Guitars

Allan Sørensen- Drums

Morten Sandager- Keyboards

Pontus Egberg- Bass

Pontus Norgren- Guitar

story:
THE BARRETT ANDERSON BAND'S 3rd Album

Get ready for Hypno-Boogie Live!

The Barrett Anderson Band will be recording a brand new, live double album at the beginning of 2020, and you can help make it happen. Be a part of the team with interactive perks and, through your support and funding, help create The Barrett Anderson Band's best album yet.

Barrett, winner of a 2013 Boston Music Award - Blues Artist of the Year, and his rock-solid band's live shows are truly special events.  Drawing from a blues background but not limited by the form, The Barrett Anderson Band plays by feel, improvising and pushing the songs forward with every performance; creating original music that connects with the audience and makes them move and groove, filled with the spirit and soul rolling off the stage.

On February 1, the proverbial tape will be rolling, forever capturing the performance as Barrett Anderson's third album. Your support is needed to "do this right."  Join the action, take advantage of great perks, and get ready, because The Barrett Anderson Band is going to get groovy in 2020.  Here comes Hypno-Boogie!!

What We Need

Making an album is not cheap; making a double album even more-so.  The music on this recording is unique, original, important music.  Capturing it in a way that stands the test of time - all the post-production needed to ensure it sounds as good as it can - takes time, effort, and money.

We have constructed a bare-bones budget; one that allows us to do everything we need to make this music sound great, and that budget comes to $6,000.  This includes recording, editing, mixing, mastering, licensing, and duplication, with a tiny amount of funding set aside for art and promotion.  The more we raise, the more we can do.

If our funding exceeds $6,000 we will be able to increase the promotional campaign, helping to introduce the album to a larger audience.  If our funding exceeds $10,000 we will be able to enlist the aid of a fantastic line artist to make the album look as good as it can.  If our funding exceeds $11,500 we will be able to press this album on vinyl.

We have a solid plan and budget in place to maximize the effectiveness of your investment in this project.  The team is in place, we simply need the funding to do this right. 

What You Get

The Barrett Anderson Band is incredibly grateful for how supportive and dedicated the fans and friends of the band are, and we've put our heads together to create highly interactive, individualized perks across the full range of price options.  We offer some traditional perks, including:

  • A sticker and an online thank you video from Barrett and the band for $5
  • A signed copy of the brand new, live double album to you "hot off the presses" for $30
  • Want the entire collection?  Get all 3 albums by Barrett for $60
  • For the biggest fan/true collector (or maybe someone who wants to have some blackmail leverage on Barrett and Jamie), you can get the "ultimate collection," all 3 of Barrett's commercially available albums signed, plus a special copy of The 708 Club, an album made by 16 year-old Barrett in 1999, featuring a young Jamie "Black Cat Bone" Hatch on the guitar!

Some of the most exciting perks offer direct interaction with the band, and we are really thrilled to do this with you!

  • The Barrett Anderson Band will learn a song of your choice and post it online with a special shout out to you for $100
  • An hour-long lesson with the band member of your choice is $150.  Want to learn your favorite Barrett Anderson Band song?  Get in on Doug's drum secrets?  Do you want to learn about how Barrett approaches soloing?  Want to talk gear?  Let's do it.  The lessons are via Skype, although could be in person by special arrangement
  • Have a strong vision for the sound of The Barrett Anderson Band?  Want to be involved with the whole process and thanked on every album Barrett releases from this point forward?  Then look into being an Executive Producer for $2,000

By contributing to this project on any level, you're helping to make important music by independent musicians on their own terms.  

We chose "Flex Funding" for this project, which means that we will receive the donated funds whether or not the project goal is met.  Our project goal does represent the most bare bones way we can make this album without having to make some sacrifices, however, if the project goal is not met, we will be able to compromise some of the production decisions without forsaking the integrity and intent of the project.  We are prepared to make this album one way or another and can guarantee a return for your investment and enthusiasm in this project, whether or not the fundraising goal is hit.

The Impact

Music is one of the great joys in life - a language we're all hardwired to understand and react to...  A language that speaks to us deeply, bridging the conflicts that divide us.  Music matters.  Good music matters.  The Barrett Anderson Band's music matters.

Barrett was 16 when he joined Ronnie Earl & The Broadcasters.  Ronnie took young Barrett under his wing and his very first advice was "Make sure you play music because it's what you have to do.  Find something else if you're in it to get famous, to get rich, or even to get girls.  Be a musician because you have no other choice."

Twenty years later, Barrett is still at it, making music because it is in him and it has to get out.  The music industry truly is the "hardest way to make an easy living."  With your help and support The Barrett Anderson Band will be able to make and market their third album on their terms.  The band has never been better.  The music has never been more vital.  The time is now and we need you on our team.  Every donation helps, we can use all the support we receive, and we are truly grateful for the community that allows us to make this wonderful music.

Thank you for your consideration.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  Share https://igg.me/at/barrett for this campaign, and www.barrettandersonband.com for up date info about the band and their music.  Keep in touch and we hope to see you soon!!

Phew, you made it all the way to the end of this.  Thanks for giving this so much of your time and attention.

story:
Help the Buffalo Chamber Players get a harpsichord!

After years of borrowing or renting harpsichords for our performances, we have the opportunity to finally have our own harpsichord! The Buffalo Philharmonic Orchestra has given us a Richard Taylor double manual harpsichord that has been in storage at Kleinhans Music Hall for over 20 years and is in need of a major restoration. 

Though the harpsichord was given to us free of charge, we need $4800 to cover the restoration of the instrument. The work will be performed by our wonderful piano and harpsichord technician Robert Sowyrda. Mr. Sowyrda has many years of experience working on keyboard instruments throughout Western New York, including the tuning and maintenance of the Buffalo Philharmonic Orchestra's pianos. 

While the cost of this extensive restoration is not insignificant, it is a fraction of the cost of a new or newly restored harpsichord of this quality. This is a world class instrument that deserves to be restored and played again. And play it we will!

The harpsichord will be featured on many of our concerts at the Albright-Knox Art Gallery and beyond. In 2018, we plan to launch a new concert series in various venues throughout the community featuring works of the Baroque era. Most of this music features the harpsichord and would be cost prohibitive to do without our own instrument.

All donations are appreciated! You are welcome to donate any amount via the "BACK IT" button above or take advantage of the various donation rewards we have created. Any funds raised in excess of our campaign goal will be used for maintenance of the instrument and future concerts throughout the community featuring our harpsichord.

Please help us get the word out about our quest for a harpsichord! Use the buttons above to share our campaign on social media and send friends our way. 

Thank you!

F.A.Q:

What is the goal of this campaign?
We are raising money to cover the cost of the restoration of a harpsichord for the Buffalo Chamber Players.

How much money is needed?
The repairs and restoration of the instrument will cost $4800. Any money raised beyond that will be applied towards future maintenance of the instrument and performances.

Are donations to the campaing tax deductible?
The Buffalo Chamber Players is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization and your donation is tax deductible. Please consult your accountant.

How will you use the harpsichord?
Over the years, our programming of works with harpsichord has been limited by the availability of an instrument to rent or borrow. Having our own instrument gives us greater flexibility to explore and program more repertoire with harpsichord. The instrument will be heard on our concerts at the Albright-Knox Art Gallery and other venues throughout the community.

What is the campaign timeline?
The funding campaign will run through December 31 and we hope to have the instrument playing in January.

Do I need to choose a reward? Any other options?
You may donate any amount without claiming a reward or feel free to contact us with your sponsorship ideas!

I can't donate but want to help. Any other ways to help?
Certainly! You are the best ambassadors to our campaign, so please help us spread the word among your friends and family. You can use the social media links above, email, or word of mouth. The more people we reach, the more succesffull our campaign will be.

Where can I reach you with other questions?
Please visit our website, www.buffalochamberplayers.org.

Any funds raised in excess of our campaign goal will be used for maintenance of the instrument and future concerts throughout the community featuring our harpsichord.

Please help us get the word out about our quest for a harpsichord! Use the buttons above to share our campaign on social media and send friends our way. 
Thank you!

F.A.Q:
What is the goal of this campaign?We are raising money to cover the cost of the restoration of a harpsichord for the Buffalo Chamber Players.
How much money is needed?The repairs and restoration of the instrument will cost $4800. Any money raised beyond that will be applied towards future maintenance of the instrument and performances.
Are donations to the campaing tax deductible?The Buffalo Chamber Players is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization and your donation is tax deductible. Please consult your accountant.
How will you use the harpsichord?Over the years, our programming of works with harpsichord has been limited by the availability of an instrument to rent or borrow. Having our own instrument gives us greater flexibility to explore and program more repertoire with harpsichord. The instrument will be heard on our concerts at the Albright-Knox Art Gallery and other venues throughout the community.
What is the campaign timeline?The funding campaign will run through December 31 and we hope to have the instrument playing in January.
Do I need to choose a reward? Any other options?You may donate any amount without claiming a reward or feel free to contact us with your sponsorship ideas!
I can't donate but want to help. Any other ways to help?Certainly! You are the best ambassadors to our campaign, so please help us spread the word among your friends and family. You can use the social media links above, email, or word of mouth. The more people we reach, the more succesffull our campaign will be.
Where can I reach you with other questions?Please visit our website, www.buffalochamberplayers.org.

story:
Greetings and salutations from SoN! 

We're thrilled that our latest album, Almost Paradigm -- 14 tracks, 72 minutes, our first collection of all-new all-original material in eight years! -- is finished. Right now it's only available as a download at our Bandcamp site, but we've heard from quite a few listeners who would prefer to purchase a CD copy. 

Well, we're down for that. As fans and as artists, we've always loved physical media. All of our previous albums have been released that way, and we want to keep the tradition going.  So we asked ourselves: this time, why not make it an event? 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $600 to cover the cost of manufacturing and shipping a short run of compact discs.  That's the main event. But there will be multiple contribution levels, with accompanying bonus content.   

  • $10: Almost Paradigm digital download
     
  • $15: Almost Paradigm CD + Almost Paradigm digital download 
     
  • $20:  Clarity CD + Almost Paradigm CD + Almost Paradigm digital download
     
  • $25: Album-X (AP demos) or Clarity Live digital download + Clarity CD + Almost Paradigm CD + Almost Paradigm digital download
     
  • $30:  Album-X (AP demos) and Clarity Live digital downloads + Clarity CD + Almost Paradigm CD + Almost Paradigm digital download
     
  • $100: Cover song recording of your choice + Album-X (AP demos) and Clarity Live digital downloads + Clarity CD + Almost Paradigm CD + Almost Paradigm digital download
     

The Impact

Our primary objective is to get this album into the hands (literally!) of anyone who wants it. This being our first step into the crowdfunding world, we're keeping it simple. But if all goes well, we hope to continue this method of involving listeners in future projects and creating a community around our music.  
 

Risks & Challenges

Because Indiegogo offers flexible funding, we don't have to meet the $600 total in order to use whatever funds we do raise. In other words, the financial risk is all on our side of the table; if we aren't able to make back our budget, that's on us...but even so, we can ensure that everyone who makes a contribution will get what they pay for. Think of it as a pre-order, with benefits!  

In the event that we actually exceed the original $600 goal, we have some further ideas for more stuff and things to add...but we'll unveil those when and if the time comes.  

If you're new to Sons Of Nothing and wish to try before you buy, you can find all of these tunes and more available to stream at our Bandcamp site. Have a listen! 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not able to contribute funds to the campaign, we appreciate you taking an interest, and ask that you help spread the word by sharing this link via social media.  Thanks!

story:
My name is BZ. Among other things in the music world, I'm a Dubstep composer based out of Oakland, California, and I'm raising funds for a new album project that with your help will be completed in the Spring of 2019. The album will be pretty unique in that it combines the typical elements you'll find in Dubstep, but it's based in heavy guitar. Think along the lines of "Skrillex and The Crystal Method get together and have Rob Zombie as their bastard child." I do a lot of things like having pads built from guitar lines, multiple harmonies happening at once, and weird sound effects that only a guitar with a whammy bar can create. Anyway, it should be a lot of fun.

 

 

 

Here's a breakdown of where the money will go:

Mastering is 31% of the budget, a video is about 48%, CD manufacturing makes up 12.5%, and artwork is almost 10%.

One on hand, there's never been a better time to be a self promoted artist. On the other, the labels just aren't "there" anymore to help with support and promotion. I love the freedom of calling my own shots, and I love that so many dedicated fans want to bypass labels and big corporations and support me directly! I can't tell you how much I appreciate that. Creating a work of art is a lot of hard work. I do this sort of thing because internally I simply have to. There's no way around it for me- I simply have to do it. I'm a parent of two kids, a husband, and we have a dog. There's not a lot left financially to pursue a creative project and do it well. 

Having said all that -  one thing you really need in order to do anything worthy (ie. produce a great-sounding album, print merch, create videos, etc.) -- is funding. So I'm hoping you'll join me in this journey to the next musical project: my 5th FULL-LENGTH ALBUM!

For my previous CD fundraiser I was still getting my name out there, and I still am. I raised just  enough money to print physical CD's.  I'm confident this time around I have enough faithful listeners and friends that are willing to "step up" and be co-contributors to push this album further. My goal is to get the project Mastered by Michael Romanowski or Piper Payne (Beats Antique, Glitch Mob), create a video or two produced by Josh McClain, and have some high quality graphics by Ozan Berke for the album and T-Shirts.

I feel more inspired than ever to write better music, always pushing and challenging myself. 

I have a ton of material to sort through and refine, and in the process I usually end up writing even better songs and nix a few others. I've begun to flesh out a theme for the album content and the visualization which will affect the photography and art. I'm very excited about where this next album will take me - and you! 
 

Thank you so much for reading, supporting and sharing this campaign with your friends and networks. That's really the only way I'll be able to do this!

If you can't directly contribute, then please share with your social networks! 
Need some ideas?

Email!

Facebook!

Twitter!

Blogs!

Youtube!

Music forums!

Thanks a million - I can't wait to get started!!! 

XOXO,

BZ

Bandcamp

BZ Website

iTunes

story:
Alabaster is a jam band at our roots. We flaunt a style that is very passionate and energetic. Our emotions are poured into every lick and riff they play. Alabaster is not bound by genre but draws influence by Rock, Blues, Psychedelic, Reggae, to name a few, with a more old school take, similar to Black Sabbath or Led Zeppelin. We consistently challenge ourselves to push our creativity and musicianship to a new level through improvisation and exploring our music and to make sure the crowd really gets down. 

Alabaster has had a lot of success in the midwest but now it's time to push it forward--with this trip down to Austin, TX, we're breaking into a new market and starting to spread Alabaster's name into new national markets.

What We Need & What You Get

This is a FLASH FUNDRAISER to help us through the next two weeks as we tour down to SXSW.

We want to raise $1000. This money will help us book hotels in the colder states (we plan on camping but sometimes that just won't be realistic in midwestern March!), gas, food, and provide us a level of security if something goes wrong with our van on the road (ask us about the time we toured out to Colorado and our van broke down). This money will also help us use our time as best as possible while we're traveling to Austin as it will allow us to check out more places and meet more people.

Our fundraising goal is flexible--if we don't meet our total, every dollar donated toward it will still help us make our SXSW dreams a reality.

Our perks will provide you with all sorts of intimate behind the scenes moments from the band--starting from the first level where you'll get a personal thank you, to the last where we will play you a private show.

The Impact

Alabaster believes in the power of music--to build community, to create joy, and to heal minds and bodies. We draw inspiration from the stone alabaster after which we are named as well; alabaster the stone has healing properties that aid forgiveness, ease anxiety, clear the mind, and spark creativity. When we are together onstage and playing, our riffs and improvisations have similar qualities, allowing the audience a moment to get in the groove and experience the ways in which our spontaneous creativity and jams can get you out of your head and into the present moment.

Supporting a band like ours is an opportunity to spread these positive vibes and support independent artists as we pursue our dreams.

Risks & Challenges

Going on tour is a risky thing. Unreliable venues, problems with transportation, security for our equipment--there's a lot of different factors at play when you travel for a show. Since we've gone on the road out west before, we have some experience now that we think will help prevent any unforeseen circumstance totally derailing the tour. But this is also why we're fundraising: with additional funds, we will be more equipped for success.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? No problem. Here's some other ways you can support Alabaster:

  • Follow us on social media! Instagram: alabastertheband; facebook: alabasterband
  • Spread the word about our campaign!
  • Connect us to your friends or networks in Austin or on the road from Chicago to Austin!

story:
Ghana Recording Studio Project

Background

Ghana is a deeply musical place with diverse traditional and popular music. Since 2000, I have developed personal and professional ties in Ghana that have shaped my outlook as a musician, scholar, and teacher. I began conceptualizing the Ghana Recording Studio Project during a two-year (2013-2015) visiting scholar position in the University of Ghana’s Music Department. I was inspired by the students’ level of engagement and dedication though I found that the University facilities required a great deal of improvisation due to the limited resources. At one point, I taught an eight-student studio production class in my office with one computer, a borrowed projector and keyboard, and two microphones.

The Ghana Studio Project

I will be working under a Fulbright Fellowship to install a music production studio and develop a program of study within the University of Ghana's Department of Music. This studio will serve to teach music production, promote student activities, connect visiting scholars and artists to the University of Ghana's music department, and provide a place for generating creative output. As the studio develops, I hope that it will become a focal point of musical activity in Accra for both local and visiting musicians, producers, and artists.

The Importance of Music Production and Education in Ghana

This project is important because music is one of the most visible and lasting cultural exports of West Africa and embodies an ongoing process of national formation and participation in global economies. Ghana’s first president, Kwame Nkruma, believed that local music traditions were more than entertainment or static culture and that they should play an important part in shaping a Pan-African political and social consciousness that would carry African nations forward in the postcolonial era. I follow Nkruma’s lead in looking to these traditions as archives of knowledge and ways of understanding the world as well as valuable resources for the development of cultural products. 

As Ghana continues to develop leadership opportunities in West Africa, music should provide a vibrant part of positive change in the region. Musicians, producers, promoters, educators, and venue owners are facing the difficult challenges of negotiating a music industry defined by streaming services and unrestrained piracy. However, great potential exists in establishing West African cities as new centers of music production that do not rely solely on European and U.S. distribution and promotion companies.

This project would directly benefit the University of Ghana, local scholars and teachers, and the student body by providing a sustainable recording studio for:

●      Teaching Graduate and Undergraduate courses

●      Music production

●      Hosting resident artists

●      Networking with local artists, promoters, educators, and producers

●      Generating income for the department

I expect this project to have a lasting impact as it will provide a foundation for students who wish to pursue further studies or work in music production.

Our Goals

I aim to raise $10,000 which will cover costs for equipment that will be donated to the Music Department, shipping costs to Ghana, labor for building and installing sound treatment, and fees for visiting artists who can interact with students as they work through music production projects. 

    Impact

    Your contributions will help build a place for the students to creatively engage with West Africa's vibrant music scene.

    My previous experiences designing and working as a producer in Accra led to many incredible collaborations with...

    • University of Ghana music students
      • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4fMoYqpuqSM
    • Bridget Kearney (Lake Street Dive) and Ben Davis (Cuddle Magic) 
      • https://bridgetkearneybenjaminlazardavis.bandca...
    • BBC 1xtra featuring Sarkodie, Efya, and others 
      • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kZJrL5i1pH4
    • Seperewa master Osei Korankye 
      • https://soundcloud.com/akwaabamusic/sets/osei-k... 
    • Ghana's premier rock band Dark Suburb with rapper E.L. and pop singer Wiyaala
      • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=58mDulytA0M) 

    With the Ghana Studio Project, we will continue to develop music collaborations that explore new directions in Ghanaian music.

    Timeline and Goals

    Through the fall months of 2018, we will be working on the studio install and also developing projects that bridge music production, composition, theory, analysis, and musicology. The Spring of 2019 will be dedicated to hands-on work with students in the production space seeing their projects through completion.

    As this is an ongoing project, the first stage of funding will go largely to equipment and install with the remaining 20% being used for studio assistants and guest artists. 

    In the first year we aim to produce a CD of recordings by student artists as well as keep an online website dedicated to showcasing the work being done in the Studio.  

    Having worked extensively in Ghana as a musician, teacher, and producer, I see the main restraints on this project being time. With your donations, we can work efficiently to build the studio so that students can begin to benefit from its facilities!

    Other Ways to Help!

    We are taking recording equipment donations too! We need computers, microphones, and audio interfaces. Any audio cables, audio controller, instrument, or other auxiliary item donations are also welcome! 

    Help spread the word! 

    Thank you!

Help spread the word! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Ray Wild is an explosive combo of shredding guitar, groovy basslines, and sexy vocals that is here to bring back that funky rock and roll. Inspired by the rock gods of Jimi Hendrix, Led Zeppelin, and the Red Hot Chili Peppers- our music will get you on your feet and banging your head. And we want to spread those funky rock and roll vibes across America.
One of our goals as a band is to tour the country, and this is just the beginning. From our own fundraising efforts like the Ray Wild Car Wash and with your help, we can go from Columbia, Missouri all the way to Los Angeles and back and gain invaluable experience along the way. This tour will provide us with more exposure, opportunities for radio play, networking with other locals, and new songwriting material to make our tunes and live show even more exciting.

What We Need & What You Get

Basically, we need to get from Lawrence -> Boulder -> Salt Lake City -> Santa Rosa -> Oakland -> Los Angeles -> Las Vegas -> Albuquerque -> Oklahoma City -> Columbia and that's where you guys come in.  All of your contributions would go towards getting us and our gear from place to place, which is easily the most important part of this whole tour.
Gas for 2 cars at 20mpg (4344 miles @ $2.50/gal) = $1,090 .00
Lodging for 4 nights (the rest of the two weeks we are couch surfing) = $533.40
Trailer Hitch rental for 15 days = $225.00
Show Marketing budget for 9 shows = $220.00
Check out our sweet perks and just know that your help will not go unnoticed - we greatly appreciate all of the good vibes!

The Impact

This tour is honestly just the beginning for us. With the exposure and experience we would gain on this tour, we can really take off. We want our music to reach as many people as possible and for people to really feel connected to our music. We've got that covered in Columbia but we want it to reach everyone. Touring out west is the jumpstart we need. We will gain so much more experience on the road, learn how to communicate and reach fans in other markets, gain loads of new songwriting material, and meet people that can help us achieve our ultimate goal.

Risks & Challenges

With touring comes great challenges. We could make it all the way to California and only play for 10 people, but we're prepared for that challenge and many more. We're already working on marketing plans to combat the challenge of getting people to the show. We also gained some experience with dealing with booking agents for venues and other local bands from our midwest tour last summer so we have faced those challenges before and we're ready for them again.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but can't actually contribute money, you can just help get the word out! Share our campaign on Facebook and everywhere else you can think of. Every little thing helps!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Ray Wild is an explosive combo of shredding guitar, groovy basslines, and sexy vocals that is here to bring back that funky rock and roll. Inspired by the rock gods of Jimi Hendrix, Led Zeppelin, and the Red Hot Chili Peppers- our music will get you on your feet and banging your head. And we want to spread those funky rock and roll vibes across America.

One of our goals as a band is to tour the country, and this is just the beginning. From our own fundraising efforts like the Ray Wild Car Wash and with your help, we can go from Columbia, Missouri all the way to Los Angeles and back and gain invaluable experience along the way. This tour will provide us with more exposure, opportunities for radio play, networking with other locals, and new songwriting material to make our tunes and live show even more exciting.   What We Need & What You Get
Basically, we need to get from Lawrence -> Boulder -> Salt Lake City -> Santa Rosa -> Oakland -> Los Angeles -> Las Vegas -> Albuquerque -> Oklahoma City -> Columbia and that's where you guys come in.  All of your contributions would go towards getting us and our gear from place to place, which is easily the most important part of this whole tour.
Gas for 2 cars at 20mpg (4344 miles @ $2.50/gal) = $1,090 .00
Lodging for 4 nights (the rest of the two weeks we are couch surfing) = $533.40
Trailer Hitch rental for 15 days = $225.00
Show Marketing budget for 9 shows = $220.00
Check out our sweet perks and just know that your help will not go unnoticed - we greatly appreciate all of the good vibes!
    The Impact
This tour is honestly just the beginning for us. With the exposure and experience we would gain on this tour, we can really take off. We want our music to reach as many people as possible and for people to really feel connected to our music. We've got that covered in Columbia but we want it to reach everyone. Touring out west is the jumpstart we need. We will gain so much more experience on the road, learn how to communicate and reach fans in other markets, gain loads of new songwriting material, and meet people that can help us achieve our ultimate goal.
    Risks & Challenges
With touring comes great challenges. We could make it all the way to California and only play for 10 people, but we're prepared for that challenge and many more. We're already working on marketing plans to combat the challenge of getting people to the show. We also gained some experience with dealing with booking agents for venues and other local bands from our midwest tour last summer so we have faced those challenges before and we're ready for them again.   Other Ways You Can Help If you want to help but can't actually contribute money, you can just help get the word out! Share our campaign on Facebook and everywhere else you can think of. Every little thing helps!

story:
À écouter durant votre lecture.
https://soundcloud.com/rebeccabanana


♥ Parle moi d'toi (dixit Kaïn) 

Je suis une princesse royale qui s'intitule Rebecca Leclerc. J'aime les longues balades en forêt, les toupies Digimon et  je suis très belle. Je suis également à la recherche de dollars afin de réussir à concrétiser un projet d'album qui vous tient à coeur. 

♥ Pourquoi vous devez m'enrichir

Vos contributions financières me permettront de couvrir une partie des frais liés à la production de ce disque compact qui bouleversera votre existence humaine.

Exemple des frais couverts par vos sous: 

♥ La pizza pour engraisser mon technicien de son vraiment maigre

♥ Les nouveaux vêtements de mon contrebassiste

♥ La coupe de cheveux de mon percussionniste encore dans sa phase punk-métal

♥ Une muselière pour mon pianiste

♥ Les conséquences sur l'univers et ses composantes

Ce disque compact que vous pourrez perdre aisément entre vos deux bancs d’auto est essentiel à la survie humaine. Nous sommes dans une période critique, une période où les gens sont en train d’oublier la magie. Mon apparition sur Terre s’est faite au bon moment (merci maman); je suis là pour vous rappeler que la magie est mienne, la magie est vôtre, il n’est PAS trop tard pour redonner à ce monde un peu d’éclat. 

♥ Les dépenses financières

Afin d'être une personne crédible, je vous présente le réel budget du projet (vous verrez OÙ s'en va votre argent.)

♥ Frais de studio: 1000 écus

♥ Prise de son et mixage: 1500 écus

♥ Impression du disque compact: 1500 écus

♥ Photographe: 400 écus

♥ Design/Graphisme: 500 écus

N.B. C'est un disque compact d'environ 5000$, mais en bonne personne que je suis j'assumerai le reste des coûts liés au projet, ne vous quémandant que 2000$ sur l'entièreté du montant total des coûts totaux. 

♥ Liste des raisons pourquoi je mérite votre aide

♥ Je suis jolie

♥ Il y a du diabète dans ma famille

♥ Il est temps pour moi de prouver aux gens que j'écris des chansons pour de vrai

♥ Mon groupe&moi sommes extrêmement motivés à faire des tournée en Europe, et seule cette carte de visite nous donnera accès à nos rêves de grandeur

♥ Je vous trouverais gentil, je vous caresserais l'échine, je vous mordillerais l'oreille, oh mes beaux agneaux, laissez moi vous aimer en retour

♥ En conclusion brève

J’ai besoin de TOI, cher lecteur, pour que tu puisses par la suite te balader dans les rues avec ma voix en poche. 

Il est temps de jeter ta cassette de Roch Voisine. 
Fais place au disque compact de Rebecca Leclerc.

♥♥♥ DIRE MERCI C'EST GRATUIT ♥♥♥

Photos&vidéo: Jean-Philippe Sansfaçon
Mes musiciens: Nathan Vanheuverzjiwn, Samuel-San Vachon, Charles Guay
Mes parents: Annie Lespérance et Michel Leclerc (et mon frère Bagou, et son chum Samuel, et mon chien Flocon. Et Cachou et Mozart.)
Mes amis: Safia Nolin, Kevin Lambert, Charlène Blanchette, etc.
Mes amants: vous êtes ces chansons.
Mes collaborateurs: Alexandre Beauregard, Jean-Benoît Pinard, et les autres qui participeront au projet en y mettant âme, chair et coeur. 

MERCI À VOUS, mes caresses, mes belles bêtes sectaires, mes contributeurs, c'est grâce à vous que je pourrai présenter ma plus grande fantaisie onirique d'ici quelques mois. C'est grâce à vous que je pourrai partager magie&sorcellerie à travers le monde.

MERCI D'AVANCE, MERCI PRÉSENTEMENT, MERCI AU FUTUR SIMPLE.

story:
Help produce Quiet Hollers' new album!

We are ready.  So ready.   

  • We have 12 new songs written, arranged, extensively rehearsed and demoed-- we all agree it is our best work EVER.  We think you will, too. 
  • A string of successful tours have taught us how to sustain our art, and be a functioning DIY band.  This time, we want to "DIT":  Do it Together!
  • An album of this quality (and firm support behind it) will be some next level shit for us.  You can help us get there.

Why pledge?

Of course it's challenging for independent bands to support their art.  Luckily, we're surrounded by fans, friends, and families who believe in what we're doing.  We don't need some major record deal, or a fancy tour bus.  But we DO need you! 

Why now?

  • Our January 2015 single, "Liar Song" earned a Top 5 spot on Louisville's WFPK,  and we played some of our biggest shows in 2014-15.  Our band is growing at a fast pace, and we aim to capitalize on this wave of good things; full speed ahead.
  • We'll be touring as much as possible with this new album, with the support serious publicity campaign, and indie radio support.

Where does your pledge go?

Our $15,000 goal will score us:

  • 10 days at La La Land studio with engineer extraordinaire Kevin Ratterman (My Morning Jacket, Houndmouth, Murder By Death...)
  • Pressing for our first ever  vinyl release!  Plus CDs, download cards, stickers, t-shirts, etc.
  • A modest budget to work with a publicist on the album's release.
  • AND LITERALLY NOTHING ELSE.  Shit is expensive.  We'll pay for the rest with our blood and sweat.  

Help spread the word!

Can't afford to pledge?  No sweat!  You can support by telling your friends in real life, and on "the facebooks" why they should help us take our band even further.  Share our campaign and video in as many places as you can!

story:
Short Summary


  • My name is Janine Willard, and I run The Choral Agency. It started a few years ago, as an attempt to seek out work for singers, and arrange recitals and concerts for them across the country.  
  • In the past few years, children have been systematically failed by the powers that be, with respect to the Arts. Working with children is something I am passionate about, and 90% of my work involves children, teaching them privately, and within choirs. So we want to bring them top quality music, introducing them to something new, and giving them the chance to perform in beautiful settings. 
  • Our first event is planned for May 2015 - children will take part in rehearsals with some of our professional singers, on the final Saturdays in January - April, and then come together at Arundel Cathedral, to perform Vivaldi's Gloria with supporting professionals, and a string orchestra, as well as some more recently written pieces. They will take away a CD and a professional photograph of the event. 
  • With some funding, we can advertise fully and comprehensively to the whole of Sussex and Surrey, to try and get the event more widely known about. It would also mean that we could offer free places to those children who might not be able to afford the cost (albeit as small as we could make it). If we get enough, we might be able to do it for the children completely free! What is absolutely certain, is that we will be able to arrange more of these events within the next two years, offering these events to children right the way across the UK.


What We Need & What You Get


  • The more we are able to raise, the more children we'll be able to reach. It's not just about singing the music, but the children will be asked to engage with it, to listen in their own time, and be given ideas on how to express what they feel the music is trying to say. The majority of the money will go on hiring buildings, such as other cathedrals, and later on, concert halls. With enough funding, we could also let the children take DVDs instead of CDs.
  • We have Choral Agency mugs, t-shirts, and hoodies available for funding, as well as CDs of all our events for 5 years, or for large donations, naming one of our financial awards after you!
  • Because our amount is so flexible, any amount we raise can go towards our Youth Projects, but if we should fall short of arranging more than one other, we would arrange an event at Durham Cathedral, and the money could go towards the hire, which would most likely mean free participation for the children. 

The Impact


  • Nobody ever got to the end of their lives and said "I wish I'd performed less music!". Music has a positive impact on physical and emotional health. It contributes to language skills, it can engage children in history and mathematics, as well as having the obvious and frequently proven benefits to organisational skills, discipline, 
  • We already have some children signed up, and we are doing a lot of work to spread the word about our project, and the building hires aside, the majority of our funding will go to marketing and to offering free places for some, or if we get enough, even all!

Risks & Challenges


  • Implementing this on a country wide basis will be a huge challenge, which is why, at least to start with, we will spend a minimum of £1000 on promoting our events, doing talks in schools, making promotional videos based on our first event in Arundel.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Give us a share on Facebook, or follow us on Twitter!

story:
This is purely a pre-order campaign; you'll get a record regardless if any other people order, no threshold has to be met. Production of this record is already in progress, funded by the band.  This is merely an opportunity for people to be able to pre-order the record and get it as it's pressed. As an incentive to order ahead of time, we're offering some cool things that will only be available during the pre-order.

We'll send you a download code as soon as you pre-order. The LPs will ship as soon as they are available, likely mid-December.

Other information about the people behind this campaign:

New Tongues is:

J. Nardy- Bass/Vocals

S. Johnson- Guitar/Vocals

M. Quinn- Drums

Recorded/mixed by Daniel Ruder

Mastered by Carl Saff

Recorded at Suite 1003 in Columbia, MO May 30th-June 1st 2014

Mixed in St. Louis

Mastered in Chicago

Photos by Tony Irons

Suite is the follow up EP to New Tongues 2013 release We Are The Ones We Have Been Waiting For. Suite was recorded in a single weekend in Columbia, MO at a undisclosed location, using a mobile recording studio. It was a experiment of sorts to see if we could record a record under some unique conditions. We are pleased with the results. Suite consists of four songs and clocks in at 22 minutes. It will be available on vinyl and in digital format sometime in the fall/winter of 2014.

Everything else:

SUITE will be a limited edition pressing of 500 records. There will be 250 black records and 250 clear records. Pressed on 12 inch, 150 gram vinyl, at 45 rpm. Plus a very limited run of cassette tapes put out by our friends at Already Dead Tapes in Chicago.

story:
theLowerEchelon is excited to announce that we have completed the recording, mixing and mastering of our first 4 song EP, "Descent of... the Lower Echelon.” But we could use some help in getting these songs out into the world!

We are looking to release the EP on vinyl and all contributions will go directly toward the pressing of a 7" record plus more studio time and support us in promoting the EP.  We are also thrilled to announce that we have an indie label that is onboard to assist with distribution once it's done.  We appreciate any contributions you can make.

Feel free to take a listen to “Descent of... the Lower Echelon" EP on our Bandcamp page: http://thelowerechelon.Bandcamp.com.  

If our Indiegogo goal is reached, all those that contribute $20 and above will receive the final 7"vinyl and other merchandise as a show of gratitude for your assistance!!!  

Flat donations, in whatever amount you can give, are also very much appreciated. 

Thank you for all your support.


tLE

story:
All is Faded is a rising rock band from Lapeer, MI, USA. We write songs that aren't only situations we've faced as a band or people, but we write songs that bring an uprising to peoples lives. We help them succeed through hard and difficult times. We truly appreciate the support from our fans, family, & friends. We are All is Faded "Cherish the Moment".

We are trying to raise $800 so All is faded can be put into AP Magazine this will help us out because AP Magazine is sold in stores such as Hot Topic, Target, Kroger, Wal-Mart, etc. so with this Ad we will get noticed by people all around the world and will hopefully have success with getting a record label and management. 

If we get put into AP Magazine we will try our hardest to succeed in every way we can for this band like promoting and showing record labels all around the world that we have what it takes to succeed. 
If you cant contribute to this fund raiser there's ways you still can spread the word of All is Faded and check out our Facebook, YouTube, Soundcloud pages.

https://www.facebook.com/AllisFaded11

https://www.youtube.com/AllisFaded
https://soundcloud.com/all-is-faded

story:
Who Are We?

DreamCatchers is a vision of Ariel Clinical Services that started in 2012 with the mission to provide vocational training for adults with intellectual disabilities and at risk youth in our Blank Canvas Cafe & Gallery, The Alibi Room (gallery & venue), and The Studio (handcrafted goods).
Our participants receive job training in customer service, salesmanship, craftsmanship, culinary skills, facilities and maintenance that extend to the operation of the our cafe, galleries and community contracts.

We believe that every individual has a right to a meaningful life and an opportunity to contribute to their community despite any intellectual/developmental disability. We also believe in empowering and strengthening the at risk youth in our community to facilitate their success. 


The Studio

The DreamCatchers Studio mission is to supply our adult artisans with the workspace, tools, recycled materials and craftsmanship training they require to create quality handmade goods for sale. Upon completion, artists price and present their work to be curated into the store. If accepted, the artwork is available for sale in our Etsy store, Blank Canvas Cafe and The Alibi Room Gallery and Venue. 

What We Need & What You Get

Currently, we require better materials and tools to increase the speed, quality and level of our projects. Any help is greatly appreciated, so even if a monetary donation is out of reach, spreading the news of our program is great support! 
Your contributions are also directly providing a creative outlet, relationship building,  independency, learned skills, a sense of pride and a job for these artisans in the local community.
Your Money Will Support These Expenses:
Table Saw                                       $2100
Cordless Drills (4 Festool)        $2000
Paint Machine                               $1310
Cabinets                                          $1200
Sanders                                           $1105
Band Saw                                        $1100
New Safety Equipment              $1000

Air Purifier                                      $1000

Router                                              $900

Miter Saw                                        $650
Biscuit Joiner Kit                          $250

Our Perks:
For your incredible support, we are offering an assortment of personalized perks from The Studio. These include: thank you notes from our artists, candles, coasters, or larger perks highlighting our very popular flags and coat racks for home decor.

Example of Handcrafted Flags:



Large Coat Rack:


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can support us through monetary donations, but if you believe in our mission there are other ways you can be involved:

Volunteer your time
Share our goal with your friends
Check out our Etsy store or share it
Commission a piece from The Studio
Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram
Stay updated with our newsletter
Share our Facebook events with your friends or invite them!

Lastly, join us for our free UPROAR event featuring our in-house artisans, local artists, live music, our Blank Canvas Cafe, and a wine/beer tasting. They occur every First Friday of the month from 6-9pm. It's fun for you, your friends and family and helps spread the word about what we do.

Contact Information:
DreamCatchers
103 S Wahsatch 
Colorado Springs, CO 80918
719 505 5476
manager@dreamcatcherscos.com
story_txt:
Who Are We?


DreamCatchers is a vision of Ariel Clinical Services that started in 2012 with the mission to provide vocational training for adults with intellectual disabilities and at risk youth in our Blank Canvas Cafe & Gallery, The Alibi Room (gallery & venue), and The Studio (handcrafted goods).
Our participants receive job training in customer service, salesmanship, craftsmanship, culinary skills, facilities and maintenance that extend to the operation of the our cafe, galleries and community contracts.






We believe that every individual has a right to a meaningful life and an opportunity to contribute to their community despite any intellectual/developmental disability. We also believe in empowering and strengthening the at risk youth in our community to facilitate their success. 


The Studio
The DreamCatchers Studio mission is to supply our adult artisans with the workspace, tools, recycled materials and craftsmanship training they require to create quality handmade goods for sale. Upon completion, artists price and present their work to be curated into the store. If accepted, the artwork is available for sale in our Etsy store, Blank Canvas Cafe and The Alibi Room Gallery and Venue.    

What We Need & What You Get
Currently, we require better materials and tools to increase the speed, quality and level of our projects. story:
Summary

Kappa Delta and Alpha Gamma Rho are hosting a very special Ag Olympics on November 14th, 2015 at 1:00 pm. All of the proceeds will be going directly to Heart 4 Tart, an organization focused on offsetting the medical costs for heart transplant for Kappa Delta alumni Caroline Tart.

Caroline is loved by her sisters as well as those throughout the NC State community who know her. The men and women of our organizations want to give back and help Caroline with her medical bills.

In order to do this Kappa Delta and Alpha Gamma Rho are hosting an Ag Olympics for all Greek organizations to raise money and share her story!

What are Ag Olympics?

Ag Olympics are like a field day centered around agricultural and farm activities including...

  • Pumpkin chunkin'
  • Egg toss
  • Wheelbarrow races
  • Pie eating contest
  • Best dressed Mr. and Mrs. Farmer
  • Tire flip
  • etc.

How does it work?

The Ag Olympics are open to any Greek organization who would like to participate and help raise money for this great cause! An entrance fee of $75 from each organization allows them to send team members to the events and games and try to win first place!

Don't want to participate? That's OK! Spectators are welcome and encouraged! We will have hot dogs, hot apple cider and hot chocolate to offset that Autumn chill, so come out and cheer on your friends!

Other Ways You Can Help

Not a part of a Greek organization? You can still donate to this cause and help Kappa Delta and Alpha Gamma Rho raise money for Caroline Tart! Together we can make a difference for Caroline and show everyone what the Pack is made of! GO STATE!!!

story:
My name is Ivy Ross Ricci.  I am a teacher and a musician based in Port Angeles, Washington and Portland, Oregon.  I have spent the better part of the last 20 years working on behalf of the freedom and creative expression of girls' and women's voices nationwide.

My most recent album, 'It's Hard to Know' features a song that exposes the essence of the many double standards that girls and women experience in the classroom, in the workplace, and in our society in general.  It is called "Girls Sit Screaming".

Renowned Portland director, Alicia J Rose and I are partnering to make a video that will allow the song to reach a wider audience. Known for her subversive pop portraiture and ability to tap into cultural zeitgeist, Alicia has created inventive music videos for well-known national artists like First Aid Kit, Cake, EMA and Bob Mould as well as playing a key role in branding NW bands like The Decemberists.

Join us in spreading the message of Girls Sit Screaming, an anthem for the cultural shift we are experiencing in which women's voices are beginning to be heard, believed, and valued,

By donating and sharing word of this song and this campaign with your friends, you will be helping the movement towards  a safer world for girls and women, a world in which there is equal pay for equal work, a world in which no girl feels afraid to take up space, a world in which women inhabit at least half of leadership roles in every field.

We need to raise $5500 to create and promote the video. These funds will cover pre-production fees (producer/director), day rates for crew & featured cast (talent, director, producer, camera crew, lighting crew, hair/makeup etc), all equipment rentals, insurance, location fees, art/props/costume budget, hard drives, and Post Production.

The PERKS that you will receive by being a part of the team that makes this video happen include: the song itself; my latest album "It's Hard to Know"; a blockprint of the album cover on Ricci Handmade Paper; a hardcopy of my very first solo album; and House concert Anywhere in the world!!

I have already invested many years and many dollars in making this work, and I am so grateful that with your help Alicia and I can take it to the next level and have an impact on more lives by encouraging creative critical thinking about the cultural expectations for girls and women in mainstream culture.

Whether or not you are able to contribute, PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD.  We all need our girls' voices to make it to a beautiful tomorrow.  I do believe our survival depends on it.
 
To hear the full song and read the lyrics visit: https://ivyrossricci.bandcamp.com/track/girls-s...

story:
“All killer no filler” ‘Hit Me’ is a 10-song, not to be missed compilation of freshly recorded classic, party rock n roll hits by Brian Mannix and The Androids."

When you combine Brian Mannix (lead singer of 1980s band Uncanny X-Men) and The Androids (led by Tim Henwood of The Superjesus & The Rogue Traders) 
you get LIGHTNING IN A BOTTLE!

After booking heaps of huge festival shows for Brian Mannix And The Androids, this f***ing thing called COVID-19 came along, shutting everything down and cancelling all gigs on the horizon.

"Everyone was pumped to see Brian with The Androids! It’s a Pop/Punk match made in Rock n Roll heaven!"

When news came in that these shows were being cancelled, rather than sit around and mope, Tim Henwood of The Androids got straight on the phone to Mannix and asked him if he wanted to hit the studio and make an album together!

Mannix jumped at the chance to get in the studio with the boys (keeping social distancing in mind of course), and after 10 slabs of VB (one per track) the result was ‘Hit Me’! 

This is the party album YOU NEED for the party you’re gonna throw when all this virus sh** is over!

We (Brian and The Androids) will be rocking the ‘Hit Me’ album LIVE along with all the X-Men and Androids hits as soon as we’re allowed.

Until then, do yourself a favour and get behind this exclusive pre-order campaign. This won't be available anywhere else!

The album's almost complete but the boys need your help to finish the job...

Support some out-of-work muso’s and help make this album a reality!
Select a package to the right, and grab a copy of ‘Hit Me’ (as well as some merch & extras) while you can!

story:
Hello!

First, I like to say on behalf of everyone who is involved in making this Christmas charity single thank you for looking at this page which will go to the 'Help Musicians' charity and will go towards the charity 3rd hardship fund to help musicians.

Here is the lowdown on this Christmas charity single called 'Christmas of Hope'.

This Christmas single which we have made will send proceeds of the single sale to the 'Help Musicians' charity who were the chosen charity to receive the funds to go towards helping musicians in these hard times.

The 'Christmas of Hope' single features eight hard working independent music artists from the UK to as far as Canada as well as vocals from the Sweet Charity Choir. The music artists who are being featured on this single are Elyse Aeryn, Sam Jefferson, Maddisun, Slick Division, Jenny Deacon, ELA, Michael Parma and James Millier. 

 

Why playing a key role towards this Christmas charity single will help musicians.

Due to the effects of Covid-19 it's more now than ever that musicians are having a tough time making money however it's not just about the money for the musicians it's harder to showcase their identity as a music artist. So if you do support on making this Christmas charity single not only you will be helping musicians in these tough times but you will be keeping their music identity at the forefront of people's minds.

What will your funds cover?

Firstly I would like to say this Christmas charity single will be released no matter what because  everyone involved in this single are passionate about this idea to supporting musicians and hopefully making some sort of difference with this single. 

So the funds will cover the producer, songwriter, single artwork designer and videographer costs who to be honest are the unsung heroes of making the single because they have done the producing, mixing, mastering, co-writing,  musical scoring, choral arranging, creating the single artwork and making the music video for this Christmas charity single. 

I would also like to say if you are wondering why all these talented creative individuals are receiving a fee for this charity single, firstly they have all put a discount for all the hard work they will be doing for the Christmas single and I feel like I should say they are all independent producers, songwriters, photographers and videographers who just like all the independent musicians have felt the impact due to covid-19 in their work lives.

I would also like to add that any funds over the target amount we are aiming to raise will be donated to the 'Help Musicians' charity who are about to launch their 3rd hardship funds to support musicians.

Here are the treats you will get in exchange for your funds.

So for a very small donation you will get a shout out on the official group social media sites, if you donate a little bit more you can receive the MP3 of the Christmas Charity Single with the single artwork earlier than it's general release date, a tiny bit more you will receive the music video earlier than it premier date plus a little bit more you can be credited at the end of the music video.

If you are looking for something more personised then you can receive a beautiful handwritten calligraphy lyric sheet of the Christmas Charity single, if you want to get into the Christmas party mood then why don't you come and join us for our private Zoom Christmas party on 16th December plus with that reward you get 5 downloads songs from 5 of the music artists from the charity single.

If you want something you can wear then we have a custom made hoodie with a nice big snowflake in the centre with Merry Christmas however we can change the wording for you plus you can choose your hoodie colour from 27 colours!

If you are more interested in the creative process of how this Christmas single was made then we have a reward that will give you a storybook where you can see the early drafts of the lyrics plus you can hear the demo's of the Christmas charity song coming together along with the music being developed from the early stages to full production and unseen footage of the music video. 

Then if you really want something unique then why don't you go for the reward that you can choose any song whatsoever for myself (James Millier) to cover.  Before I do the cover we can have a video chat about how you would like the production for the music to be for the song and once it's completed I will send it by email to you.

What are the risks

Like I said before this Christmas charity single is definitely happening because this project has been in development since 16th September and all the production stages for making this single is booked for the 4th, 7th and 11th November. Then the single will be going into distribution for the Friday 18th December release date.

When it comes to covering the fees for the unsung heroes which this Christmas charity single wouldn't have happened without them, we do have a backup plan however it would take a longer period for their hard work to be paid off.

Other ways you can help

If you want to help in a different way then there are definitely a number of different ways you can help towards this crowdfunding campaign and this Christmas charity single. You could share our Indiegogo crowdfunding page or spread the news about this upcoming Christmas Charity single to your social media accounts like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram plus when the single is released on 18th December you can stream or download the song on Spotify, iTunes, Amazon, Tidal, Apple Music and many more music sites.

Thank You

Thank you so for taking time out to read about this campaign that will help musicians in these hard times and if you do play a role to help make Christmas charity single come alive then not only will you be helping musicians, I'm sure you will be spreading some Christmas joy which I'm sure we need from what we all have been through this year! 

Links for all the music artist and creative people involved in this Christmas charity single.

Slick Division - https://open.spotify.com/artist/29tlcTK8j2y73RI...

Elyse Aeryn - https://open.spotify.com/artist/3Fa1ciSY3kGhtrj...

Sam Jefferson - https://open.spotify.com/artist/7qwxEb3kNYC7wwz...

Maddisun - https://open.spotify.com/artist/1qriZPGph2Xi2Gr...

Michael Parma - https://open.spotify.com/artist/65EdCZvEDYdfc3y...

ELA - https://open.spotify.com/artist/6iInLw1AEXlw4Ba...

James Millier - https://open.spotify.com/artist/2jhq7nMMdpYA0hH...

Jenny Deacon (Songwriter, Musical Director and Singer) - https://www.sweetcharitychoir.co.uk/

Olli Daffarn (Producer) - http://www.bluedotbrighton.com/

Glen Jevon (Artwork Design) - https://www.glenjevon.com/

Musicians Together FB site - https://www.facebook.com/Musicians-Together-117...

Musicians Together  Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/mtmusicofficial/

Musicians Together  Twitter - https://twitter.com/MusiciansToget1

Sweet Charity Choir Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/sweetcharitychoir

Sweet Charity Choir Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/sweetcharitychoir/

Sweet Charity Choir Twitter - https://twitter.com/SweetCharityCh
