story:
Peace and Healing Summer Virtual Choral Festival

Led by Michael Bussewitz-Quarm, Composer, Educator, and Advocate

Tuesdays, July 13 through August 24, 2021, Virtually (no rehearsal 7/27)

Workshops:  Wed 7/14, Thurs 7/22, Wed 8/4, Wed 8/11 at 8 pm Eastern Time 

Virtual Concert and Zoom Reception Wednesday September 22, 2021 at 8 pm Eastern Time

 

  • Work with Renowned Guest Teachers and Clinicians

  • Collaborate with Singers from Across the Country

  • Perform the WORLD PREMIERES of 2 New Choral Works!

  • Learn and Perform Choral Music

  • Share Your Performances With the World

  • Develop Your Musical Citizenship and Support Social Justice

Premiere of "I Am a Voice that Sings"

Listen to a draft by clicking here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HUb7UzlmNnQ

About the Festival

Sing this summer with composer, educator, and social justice advocate Michael Bussewitz-Quarm and renowned clinicians from across the country.

Over this summer, we will meet to rehearse, collaborate, learn, play, express ourselves, and deepen our understanding of how we can be a positive force for change in the world. 

By the end of the festival, you will record and submit your vocal parts for the choral repertoire. After the festival, the recordings will be edited together. We will have a reunion on Wednesday September 22 at 8 pm Eastern Time to watch the final choral videos as they are released on YouTube to be enjoyed by your friends and family across the world! Immediately after the virtual concert, we will have an exclusive zoom reception for all the singers to celebrate your accomplishments. 

The Festival is an inclusive environment. 

We are the Peace and Healing Choral Festival, run by MB Arts.  We celebrate being different together. We value each other by listening and trusting in each others’ truths. These are our strengths and how we connect with each other. We welcome you and your education, opinions, culture, ethnicity, race, sex, gender identity and expression, nation of origin, age, languages spoken, veteran’s status, color, religion, disability, sexual orientation and beliefs. We welcome and affirm LGBTQ+ singers.

 

 

The Choir (open to ages HS and up)

Meets Tuesdays 8:00-9:15 pm Eastern Time starting 7/13 for six weeks (no rehearsal 7/27)

Reunion watch party and zoom reception: Wednesday, September 24, 8:00 pm Eastern Time

Faculty and Clinicians:

  • Michael Bussewitz-Quarm, Composer (she/her)
  • Dr. Lisa Neher, Mezzo-Soprano & Voice Coach (she/her)
  • Dr. Derrick Fox, Choral Director (he/him)
  • Rev. Dr. Philip Hobson, Minister (he/him)

 

Repertoire:

  • I am a Voice that Sings  (World Premiere)  
  • The Great American Choral Reef (World Premiere)  
  • How Did You Feel?

  • Come to Me In the Silence of the Night

 

Activities:

Choral Rehearsals, Workshops & Clinics, PLUS Exclusive Private Facebook Group, Choral Music Listening Party, Community Circle.

 

Workshops:

  • Take Charge of Your Vocal Health & Technique with Dr. Lisa Neher
  •  Acknowledgement, Affirmation and Action: Cultivating an Inclusive Choral Community with Dr. Derrick Fox
  • Deep Breaths/Deep Spirit: a Healthy Spirituality for Performers with Rev. Dr. Philip Hobson

 

Workshop Descriptions

Take Charge of Your Vocal Health & Technique

How can you take the helm of your vocal health and technique as a choral singer or vocal educator? In this interactive workshop, Dr. Lisa Neher will share practices for developing and maintaining lifelong vocal ease, flexibility, stamina, beauty, and health. You will learn a framework for building or revamping your own singing practice, plus tools for returning to singing after illness and maintaining vocal efficiency through the aging process. 

Acknowledgement, Affirmation and Action: Cultivating an Inclusive Choral Community

Unpacking the bias in our curriculum and in ourselves is a difficult process but necessary journey in creating and fostering an inclusive choral community. In this presentation, Dr. Derrick Fox will present concepts that help you ACKNOWLEDGE your biases (personal, curricular and organizational ) with the hopes that you will identify blind spots that may minoritize and marginalize singers in your ensembles or classrooms, outline methods that support the AFFIRMATION of varied lived experiences represented in your ensembles and offer ACTION steps that break the cycle of oppression and support diversity equity, inclusion, access and belonging. Our journeys are unique and this presentation is intended to be a starting place and not a final chapter for your work towards creating an inclusive choral community.

Deep Breaths/Deep Spirit: A Healthy Spirituality for Performers

Our lives are made up of many elements: family, work, home, relationships, religion, education, identity, and more.  We will begin with the idea that spirituality is not a separate category alongside these others, but a quality found in all aspects of our existence and experience.  We will explore this quality of depth and meaning through practices of rest, gratitude, self-awareness, and integrity.  The goal is to help each person gain a better self-understanding and bring more of their whole selves to their performance.  Our work together will not presume a religious identity and is accessible to people of any faith or no faith.

 

Technical Requirements

  • High speed internet
  • Laptop or tablet to join the daily sessions, 2nd device (such as smartphone) to use when making recordings of yourself (see below)
  • Headphones
  • Quiet space with a clean backdrop to use when you record yourself
  • Optional: ethernet connection to use during daily sessions for fastest internet, tripod for when you record yourself

When you record your parts for the choral pieces, you will need 2 devices:

  • Device 1 (computer, laptop, etc): to play the guide audio track through headphones
  • Device 2 (smartphone): to video record yourself singing your part. You may want a tripod to hold the device while you record.
  • New to recording yourself? Don’t worry! We will have time to show you exactly how to do this.

 

Why Peace and Healing?

The last year and a half has been an incredibly challenging one for us all, as we’ve lived through a historic pandemic and come to understand even more deeply some of our society’s biggest social justice challenges. As we look forward to returning to in-person living and singing, it’s time to give our hearts and our voices love and to lift those voices in song to make it clear how urgent these social justice issues are. That’s why this music addresses violence in schools, the climate crisis and its impacts on our oceans. But while these are difficult topics, we believe there is enormous hope and possibility for change, thanks to the work being done in our communities. That’s why we will also sing about the power of singing itself, and the power we each have to make a difference. 

You’ll have support with PDF scores of the music, rehearsal tracks, and guidance from the faculty on how to record your vocal parts at home. 

After the festival, my team will edit together everyone’s recordings and we will have a reunion on Wednesday September 22 at 8 pm Eastern to have a watch party as the recordings are released in a virtual concert for all of your family and friends across the world to enjoy. In this way, our combined voices from across the world, lifted in song, raising awareness and building urgency on some of the most important issues of our time, will create ripples that will expand across the globe. 

 

What Others Have To Say

Michael is an excellent musician with a clear, engaging musical voice. She has the ability to work quickly and flexibly with collaborating musicians and composes music that is both topical and accessible, while never vapid. Being a conductor herself she understands the learning process, the abilities of singers, and the need to write music that fits the voice. I highly recommend collaborating with this excellent musician and person. 

--Dr. Allan Friedman, Director, Women’s Voices Chorus of Chapel Hill

 

Rarely have we sung a piece where the poetry and music truly combine to create something approaching divine.

--Shelley Hedtke, Soprano with Women’s Voices Chorus of Chapel Hill, about Michael's work Only Time To Love

 

About the Faculty and Clinicians

 

Michael Bussewitz-Quarm

The choral music of Michael Bussewitz-Quarm engages singers and audiences with the leading social and environmental issues of our time. Michael is passionate about effecting change through choral music on topics ranging from the health of the world’s coral reefs to the epidemic of gun violence in the United States to the global refugee crisis. Michael is an active advocate for the transgender community. It is her fervent wish to spread knowledge and understanding of the transgender community through guest speaking and by simply being present in the lives of the talented musicians and artists surrounding her.

A finalist for the 2019, 2020, and 2021 American Prize, Ms. Bussewitz-Quarm’s works are performed by leading professional and educational choral ensembles across North America. Recent collaborations include the west coast premiere of The Unarmed Child by Eugene Concert Choir and Orchestra, I’ll Fly Away at the International Society of Contemporary Music’s New Music Days in Vancouver, BC, and Nigra Sum, performed by The Duke University Chorale on their California tour. Michael’s works have been rebroadcasts on Public Radio East, KMUZ, and WCPE, with performances by Singers of New and Ancient Music, musica intima, the Gregg Smith Singers, the Duke University Chorale, the Esoterics, among other exceptional choral ensembles. Michael is published by Peermusic Classical. Ms. Bussewitz-Quarm will be making her Carnegie Hall debut as a composer in the spring of 2022. 

Current projects include Peacebomb, inspired by Laotian families who make jewelry from metal taken from unexploded ordnance, Where We Find Ourselves, a pandemic-proof choral project inspired by the portraits of Hugh Mangum, and The Death and Life of AIda Hernandez: A Border Story, based on the book of the same name that tells the story of an undocumented teen’s harrowing experiences with the U.S.’s militarized immigration system. 

Ms. Bussewitz-Quarm attended Ithaca College (BM ’94), for piano performance and music education, and received her MM from the Aaron Copland School of Music, Queen’s College in New York. For more information, visit her website, https://www.mbqstudio.com/.

Dr. Derrick Fox

Dr. Derrick Fox is the Director of Choral Activities and Distinguished Associate Professor of Music at the University of Nebraska-Omaha. He has conducted, presented and lectured in venues, conferences and institutions across the United States and internationally. His compositions/arrangements are published by Hal Leonard and Brilee Music, his book Yes You Can: A Band Director’s Guide to Teaching Choirs, is published by Carl Fischer and The Derrick Fox Choral Series publishes works by marginalized/minoritized composers. He created the Professional Choral Collective to collect and create learning activities and teaching strategies for choral music educators during the pandemic of 2020. He partnered with the Country Music Association Foundation to create the 2020 Unified Voices for Music Education Initiative. www.drderrickfox.com

Rev. Dr. Philip Hobson

Philip grew up in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, the historic “secret city” of the Manhattan Project of World War II.  Wanting to know the other side of the story, he earned his bachelors in Japanese Studies.  Following his calling to help others, he received his masters from Chicago Theological Seminary, was ordained by the United Church of Christ, and has served churches in Texas, Michigan, and New York.  Philip’s doctoral work focused on listening carefully to the stories of the congregation and community as a way to deepen connections and communication.

Dr. Lisa Neher

Dr. Lisa Neher is mezzo-soprano, composer, and educator on a mission to empower and inspire her students to unlock their unique artistic voices and achieve their dreams. Her teaching style emphasizes transparency, believing that students should always know why they are doing what they are doing. She breaks down vocal technique into easily understandable tools that students can experiment with in between lessons, becoming their own teachers. Lisa’s teaching combines focused work on practical skills, physiological concepts and logical problem solving with exercises to build empathy, tap into your innate communicative instincts, and nurture trust and joy in the artistic process. With advanced training in theatre and movement skills and a background as a triathlete and yogi, Lisa grounds vocal training in the body, promoting holistic wellness and the using the entire body as the vocal instrument. In addition to teaching voice lessons, Lisa coaches singers on advanced acting techniques and composers on writing for singers and building their businesses. For more information, visit her website, www.lisanehermusic.com.

Festival Minimum & Maximum Participation

To keep the festival an intimate experience tailored to our participant, registration is capped at 60 singers.

Festival participation minimum is 20 singers. In the unlikely event that this threshold is not met and the festival cannot take place, you will be refunded 100%.

 

Spread the Word!

Help us spread the word by sharing this campaign with a singer in your life!

Not a singer, but want to support the music? Join us as a Forte, Fortissimo, or Angel Donor!

story:
La genèse 

Depuis les premiers cahiers gribouillés de la poésie de mes 7 ans en passant par la dizaine de groupes plus ou moins viables dans lesquels j'ai joué, l'écriture, la musique et la scène ont toujours fait partie de ma vie.
GalvaniséE par mon expérience de chansonneure à Petite-Vallée à l'été 2010, j'ai produit un premier EP 'Le goût de rien' paru en 2011.  Après plus d'un an à conjuguer monoparentalité, travail de survivance et musique, fatiguéE d'essayer de vendre/promouvoir/booker des chansons que je n'avais pas le temps de travailler avec un band que je n'avais pas les moyens de payer, j'ai abandonné la chanson.  Puis, doucement, sans attentes et sans enjeux, j'ai lentement renoué avec elle.  J'ai joué pour les amiEs, dans les salons, dans les soirées. Seule avec ma guitare ou en femme-orchestre, j'ai retrouvé le plaisir de partager mes histoires.  Un jour, j'ai eu assez de chansons et de confiance pour avoir envie de les immortaliser et j'ai lancé l'idée à Jean-Sébastien d'en faire un EP numérique.  Le projet du z'album (zine+album) était né. 
Avec Jean-Sébastien Brault -Labbé (réalisation, batterie) et Alex Pépin (contrebasse), on a rapidement arrangé une poignée de chansons que l'on a enregistrée en 4 jours au chalet. De retour en ville, on a invité des amiEs à ajouter leur touche et le z'album était. Ce sont les chansons du z'album qui nous ont valu d'être selectionnéEs pour les Francouvertes et c'est notre performance aux Francouvertes qui nous a fait rencontrer les gens qui travaillent maintenant avec nous. S'est aussi ajoutée au projet, Julie Miron, qui a joué dans au moins huit des dix bands dans lesquels j'ai joué et dont les guitares se mêlent incroyablement bien aux miennes.  

C'est donc extrêmement bien entouréE que je me suis attaquée à la production de ce projet d'album, un premier album complet.

Les filles sages vont au paradis, les autres vont où elles veulent

C'est un slogan féministe qui est devenu le titre d'un livre.  
Ou bien c'est l'inverse, je sais plus.
Je sais que c'est écrit en grandes lettres blanches sur fond noir et rose sur le mur du salon chez isApArdi (artiste visuel et amie responsable du visuel du zine et de l'abum).  Le même salon où ont été créés et assemblés les zines du z'album.  Comme l'album qui s'en vient est la suite du z'album et que j'adore ce slogan qui, je crois, gagne à être lue/vue/entendue/criée/chantée, j'ai choisi d'en faire le titre de l'album. Le premier 'vrai' album.

Certaines chansons de l'album ont déjà été jouées en spectacle, d'autres ont été écrites pendant la pré-prod.  Si les termes abordés sont plutôt sombre (déception, amour impossible, suicide), l'album, lui, ne l'est pas.  À force d'explorations et de jams, nous avons développé un son bien à nous, un son un peu sale, sexy et brodé de hooks entrainants. Un son unique que nous avons  baptisé du terme scientifique: stoner-rock/blues-fusion.

Cet album ne sera donc pas seulement notre premier album complet, il sera aussi le premier album de stoner-rock/blues-fusion  francophone au monde!



(Photo par Isa Pardi, dans le fameux salon, en train de taper les textes pour le z'album, printemps 2015)


Money talk

Le projet d'album est financé par Musicaction, c'est-à-dire que Musication couvre 50% du budget et nous assurons le reste. Comme le budget total du projet est de 20 000$, Musicaction nous verse 10 000$ (merci!), nous investissons 5000$ de notre argent et nous sollicitons votre aide pour l'autre 5000$. (merci!!)

Les frais encourus par une production d'album sont nombreux et élevés;
- Location de studios pour les répétitions et l'enregistrement
- Location d'équipement pour l'enregistrement
- Temps de studio + technicien pour le mix
- Mastering
- Cachets des participantEs


(Le groupe: Jean-Sébastien, Alex, Samuele et Julie)

On ne sait pas encore quand l'album va sortir, mais on sait qu'en contribuant, vous aurez la chance de mettre le résultat dans vos oreilles bien avant tout le monde.  


Toutes formes d'aide compte!

Le projet vous anime, mais votre budget est serré? Croyez-moi, on comprends bien. Passer le mots est aussi une excellente façon de nous aider à atteindre notre objectif. 

Et si jamais on arrivais à le dépasser, on ajouterais un ensemble à cordes sur une ou deux chansons!


Merci!!

Depuis les premiers cahiers gribouillés de la poésie de mes 7 ans en passant par la dizaine de groupes plus ou moins viables dans lesquels j'ai joué, l'écriture, la musique et la scène ont toujours fait partie de ma vie. GalvaniséE par mon expérience de chansonneure à Petite-Vallée à l'été 2010, j'ai produit un premier EP 'Le goût de rien' paru en 2011.  Après plus d'un an à conjuguer monoparentalité, travail de survivance et musique, fatiguéE d'essayer de vendre/promouvoir/booker des chansons que je n'avais pas le temps de travailler avec un band que je n'avais pas les moyens de payer, j'ai abandonné la chanson.  Puis, doucement, sans attentes et sans enjeux, j'ai lentement renoué avec elle.  J'ai joué pour les amiEs, dans les salons, dans les soirées. Seule avec ma guitare ou en femme-orchestre, j'ai retrouvé le plaisir de partager mes histoires.  Un jour, j'ai eu assez de chansons et de confiance pour avoir envie de les immortaliser et j'ai lancé l'idée à Jean-Sébastien d'en faire un EP numérique.  Le projet du z'album (zine+album) était né. 
Avec Jean-Sébastien Brault -Labbé (réalisation, batterie) et Alex Pépin (contrebasse), on a rapidement arrangé une poignée de chansons que l'on a enregistrée en 4 jours au chalet. De retour en ville, on a invité des amiEs à ajouter leur touche et le z'album était. Ce sont les chansons du z'album qui nous ont valu d'être selectionnéEs pour les Francouvertes et c'est notre performance aux Francouvertes qui nous a fait rencontrer les gens qui travaillent maintenant avec nous. S'est aussi ajoutée au projet, Julie Miron, qui a joué dans au moins huit des dix bands dans lesquels j'ai joué et dont les guitares se mêlent incroyablement bien aux miennes.  C'est donc extrêmement bien entouréE que je me suis attaquée à la production de ce projet d'album, un premier album complet.
Les filles sages vont au paradis, les autres vont où elles veulent

C'est un slogan féministe qui est devenu le titre d'un livre.  Ou bien c'est l'inverse, je sais plus. Je sais que c'est écrit en grandes lettres blanches sur fond noir et rose sur le mur du salon chez isApArdi (artiste visuel et amie responsable du visuel du zine et de l'abum).  Le même salon où ont été créés et assemblés les zines du z'album.  Comme l'album qui s'en vient est la suite du z'album et que j'adore ce slogan qui, je crois, gagne à être lue/vue/entendue/criée/chantée, j'ai choisi d'en faire le titre de l'album. Le premier 'vrai' album.
Certaines chansons de l'album ont déjà été jouées en spectacle, d'autres ont été écrites pendant la pré-prod.  Si les termes abordés sont plutôt sombre (déception, amour impossible, suicide), l'album, lui, ne l'est pas.  À force d'explorations et de jams, nous avons développé un son bien à nous, un son un peu sale, sexy et brodé de hooks entrainants. Un son unique que nous avons  baptisé du terme scientifique: stoner-rock/blues-fusion.Cet album ne sera donc pas seulement notre premier album complet, il sera aussi le premier album de stoner-rock/blues-fusion  francophone au monde!
(Photo par Isa Pardi, dans le fameux salon, en train de taper les textes pour le z'album, printemps 2015)


Money talk
Le projet d'album est financé par Musicaction, c'est-à-dire que Musication couvre 50% du budget et nous assurons le reste. Comme le budget total du projet est de 20 000$, Musicaction nous verse 10 000$ (merci!), nous investissons 5000$ de notre argent et nous sollicitons votre aide pour l'autre 5000$. (merci!!)
Les frais encourus par une production d'album sont nombreux et élevés; - Location de studios pour les répétitions et l'enregistrement- Location d'équipement pour l'enregistrement- Temps de studio + technicien pour le mix- Mastering- Cachets des participantEs


(Le groupe: Jean-Sébastien, Alex, Samuele et Julie)On ne sait pas encore quand l'album va sortir, mais on sait qu'en contribuant, vous aurez la chance de mettre le résultat dans vos oreilles bien avant tout le monde.  


Toutes formes d'aide compte!
Le projet vous anime, mais votre budget est serré? Croyez-moi, on comprends bien. Passer le mots est aussi une excellente façon de nous aider à atteindre notre objectif. 
Et si jamais on arrivais à le dépasser, on ajouterais un ensemble à cordes sur une ou deux chansons!

Merci!!

story:
Le Projet

Hello la OBC Family !

Cela fait maintenant plus d'un an que notre premier EP « The Lost Side Of The World » est sorti, après une tournée française ainsi qu'une tournée anglaise en Mai dernier, il est temps pour nous de rentrer en studio pour préparer notre nouvel album.

Nous allons enregistrer au studio The Office / The Artist avec Jean François Di Rienzo, et nous sommes désormais managés par Dooweet Agency.

Notre dernière tournée anglaise nous a encore plus encouragés à poursuivre notre aventure, les rencontres faites sur la route nous motivent à écrire de nouvelles compos pour pouvoir les partager avec vous !

La OBC Family grandit petit à petit et ce n'est que grâce à vous que nous réussirons à évoluer, vous êtes la base de notre projet et on espère le faire grandir encore plus ! 



L'album en détail 

Studio : enregistrement + mixage + mastering : 4200€

Pressage de 1000 EP : 1250€

SDRM : 1000€

Graphisme : 500€

Total: 7000€


Notre tournée 2016

21 Janvier – La péniche Antipode – Paris
04 Février – L'Espace B – Paris
13 Février – Le pub ADK – Roissy-en-Brie
27 Février - L'envers - Bordeaux
11 Mars - L’Akroche - Lyon
12 Mars - Espace Daudet - Orange
15 Mars - Black Out - Montpellier
17 Mars - OFF Rock The Piste - Morgins (CH)
18 Mars - Boardrider Quicksilver - Chamonix
07 Mai - The Mulberry Tavern - Sheffield (UK)
08 Mai - Mono Chorlton - Manchester (UK)
09 Mai - Head of Steam - Newcastle (UK)
10 Mai - The Snooty Fox - Wakefield (UK)
12 Mai - Tap'n Tumbler - Nottingham (UK)
13 Mai - Pi Bar - Leicester (UK)
14 Mai - Dublin Castle - London (UK)


Merci à vous la OBC Family ! On a hâte de vous présentez notre nouvel album !

Alexandre, Florian, Maxime, Vincent

story:
My name is Rebecca Harris, and I am a violinist with a passion for early and new music. Born and raised in England, I am based in Philadelphia, where I serve as concertmaster of the Philadelphia Bach Collegium, and as associate principal violin of Tempesta di Mare. I enjoy a busy chamber music calendar as a member of the Franklin Quartet and Night Music, and as an independent artist I’ve been engaged in new music recording projects with outstanding musicians and ensembles such as The Crossing (Lloyd: 'Bonhoeffer', 2017 GRAMMY nominated), Maren Montalbano (Sea Tangle) and Andrew Lipke (Siddhartha).

This year I am recording my first solo album on baroque violin, a string mysterious. 

a string mysterious

a string mysterious combines ancient and new musical meditations on transcendental subjects. Three of Henrich Biber’s Mystery Sonatas (The Annunciation, The Crucifixion, and The Resurrection, composed c. 1676) are contrasted by arresting new pieces for baroque violin by Mark Rimple and Riho Esko Maimets.

Several recordings of the Biber sonatas on this program exist, but the new works have never been recorded, and this album will present them for the first time. This project is rooted in my fascination with the relationship between works of art when they are placed next to one another - each work in the program sheds light on the others, revealing how artists of different eras have responded to the strange and supernal, and creating something truly unique. 

For this recording, I will be joined by Richard Stone (lute and theorbo) and Matthew Glandorf (organ), two exceptional artists with whom I have collaborated for many years. 

This project is already underway - I have been tirelessly (and joyfully) working on clarifying the vision, budgeting, planning, and organizing. Next comes the exciting process of recording and producing, and here is where I need your help.

What is involved?

Undertaking a solo recording project is a huge enterprise, requiring hard work, careful planning, and of course total artistic commitment. It also requires financial resources, and this is where I invite you to become directly involved. This album will cost around $6500 to make - many different skills and processes come together behind the scenes to create the recording that you eventually hear, and it adds up. It can be fascinating to learn about what’s involved, so I’ll explain:

Musician fees: $2000

This portion will be used to compensate my collaborating musicians. I have worked with them for many years, so you can be confident that you are investing in a performance based on experience and mature artistic relationships.

Recording and production fees: $2500

John Baker will be recording this album – he is a brilliant engineer, so you can expect the recording to be of high quality. This figure also includes the manufacture and online and physical distribution of the album once it’s finished.

Marketing: $800

Since I am self-producing, I will be responsible for getting the word out about my recording – that includes things like photos, videography, advertizing, press releases, and the album release itself.

Odds and Ends: $1200           

One side of making a recording is creating beautiful art, and the other is making sure that fees and taxes are paid! This portion of my budget will cover aspects of project such as the fees for using Indiegogo, taxes, and manufacture and delivery of rewards after the campaign has ended.

Any extra funds raised will be used to create additional performance opportunities of this program. If I do not reach my target, I will still make this album, but the process will be slower. I will be recording later in 2017, and aim to release the album in the 2017-18 season. With the goal of $6500 reached, and your support behind me, I’ll be in a position to dive into making this album come to life.

What do you get out of supporting this project?

Firstly, my endless thanks. It would be impossible for me to do this without your help. My impulse is to say that I can never repay you, but I will - by transforming your investment into a work of art.

To remind you of my gratitude, I’m offering an assortment of rewards. One of the unique aspects of this album is that I have created the sleeve artwork myself, so I have used this as inspiration for some of the perks. Simply select your giving level from the sidebar to claim your reward – it’s that easy!  

You might invest in this project because you know my playing, or that of my collaborating artists, and want to help because you believe in our artistry. You might love the distinctive voices of the composers involved, or maybe you are curious to hear from them for the first time. You could be a fan or early music, new music, or both! Whatever your reason for contributing, thank you – I can’t wait to share the journey and the end result with you.

Other ways to help

Making a financial contribution is one way to support this project, but there are other things that you can do to participate, too. Spreading the word is one of the quickest, easiest ways that you can help:

Share this project via the built-in Facebook tool – consider sending it directly to a friend.

Share this campaign page via email with someone who might find it intriguing.

Sign up for my mailing list to follow the progress of this project – I would love to stay in touch with my supporters every step of the way. 

Follow me on social media: Facebook @rebeccaharrisviolin / Instragram @rebecca_vln

Thank you for the support that you have shown by reading my story. I hope you’ll feel inspired to choose a way to join me on the next phase of the journey – with your help, I’ll be well on the way to bringing this album to life! 

(Video credit: Sharon Torello)

story:
WHAT

Plain and simple—we want to make an amazing music video. We'll be traveling to a remote location to spend the day capturing all sorts of great things. The video will feature all seven band members, a cast of six professional dancers, and original choreography, all to be directed and shot by cinematic experts.

WHO

The Band:

If you don't already know us, Fellow Fellow is a Los Angeles based circus-pop band.  After making music for a few years, we've developed our own truly unique sound.

"With guitars, a tuba, and blaring trumpets, the band gives you a big circus of sound while Cooper Wolken’s vocals carry you through like an 18th century American frontiersmen.." —The New LoFi

" . . . a woozy, wonky joyride." —Buzz Bands LA

Fellow Fellow is: Steven Kai van Betten, Marcus Buser, Nick Hon, Stefan Kac, Louis Lopez, Andrew Rowan, and Cooper Wolken. We released our debut CD The Traveler in July, 2016.

The Filmmakers:​

After our CD release show at Bootleg Theater in July, we were approached by filmmakers Sarah Prinz and Daniel J. Rosenberg (collectively Flexsus Studios) about collaborating. Having seen the quality of film they make, we were flattered that they were inspired by our music. How could we say no?

The Choreographer:

Unbeknown to Sarah and Daniel, Fellow Fellow has a history of visual collaboration with accomplished choreographer and dancer Jordan Saenz, with whom we co-created an immersive and interactive cabaret-style dance-theater production that premiered at ArtShareLA in April 2015.

Thus our team was born: Fellow Fellow'd make the music, Jordan would choreograph the movement, and the masterminds at Flexsus Studios would direct and capture it all.

WHY

Our goal, as always, is to create something special, something beautiful, something sublime, something impactful—and that's exactly what we aim to do with this video. We also want to share our music with as many people as possible, and in 2016 there's no better way to share music than through the art of the music video. Something about moving images just captures more attention and encourages more people to press "play." And understandably so—we love a good music video. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $1,100 to make this video happen to its fullest potential.

Here's the breakdown of costs for the 12-hour film shoot:

  • Dancers: $600 (minimum, $100 per dancer)
  • Crew: $250
  • Wardrobe: $100
  • Camera package: $50
  • Food: $60 (for +/- 15 people, for a 12-hour shoot.)
  • Props: $20
  • Gas: $20 (several vehicles needed for 7 musicians, 6 dancers, plus film crew and equipment.) 

What you get: PERKS!

Depending how much you're willing and/or able to donate, there's a whole mess of PERKS that you could receive as a huge thank you for helping us reach our goal. Check 'em out over there on the right! —> —> —>

If we don't reach our goal, we'll use whatever is raised to make the best music video we can with a more limited budget. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Just get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing this page with someone you know would be interested in our project!

story:
Who am I? 

My name's Ruben Bellavia and I'm a professional jazz drummer and teacher. Last year I focused my practice on learning the style of the great Tony Williams

I discovered that  Tony Williams' drumming is a topic that no-one ever wrote about and I'm here to fill this gap.

I want to dive into the great analysis I have done of both Comping and Soloing in different periods of Tony Williams’ career. With this campaign I am aiming to fund the realization of Part 1 of this amazing journey. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to be able to realize this journey there’s a few costs involved:

- 1200£ for Filming with a professional cameraman/lights hiring/location hiring

- 1250£ for video editing/color correction

- 300£ for the website development

- 250£ for Indiegogo fees

 

In exchange for your help, you will gain access to the content produced during the 2-week process plus some exclusive rewards, including Skype Lessons, Live Recordings and access to my new weekly lesson website where I will share tons of drumming exercises!

 

I will be recording Part 1 of the Tony Williams Style analysis, which will include 4 comping transcriptions from the straight ahead era recorded at slow, medium and fast tempos, detailed lessons on each of the transcriptions and a longer analysis of the general comping style of Tony Williams with tons of examples and exercises!

Why is this important?

This project has a special place in my heart. Tony Williams is one of the most influencing drummers in the history of music and his playing has changed the way we see music and the role of drummers in ensembles. I believe that it’s important that we understand not only what he was playing but also why, and that’s the reason I started the journey to deeply understanding his style of drumming. I believe that every drummer (and not only!) will benefit immensely from something like this and will give them year worth of material to practice!

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you like this project I ask you to share it with a friend who you think could benefit from this! Sharing is caring! :)

story:
Who are we?

The Victoria Children’s Choir is an extraordinary musical ensemble based in Victoria, British Columbia.  On June 29th, our singers will embark on their SEA to SEA Tour - a two-week educational and cultural adventure through the Maritime Provinces. As young ambassadors of our beautiful west coast, they will bring the youth of Canada together for the Canada 150 celebrations this summer.  Throughout the tour, thirty-five choristers will share the gift of song with people in many east-coast communities.  The choir is especially honoured by the invitation from the Mayor of Charlottetown to perform at the birthplace of confederation during their official Canada Day celebrations on July 1st.  

What We Need 

Absolutely every little bit of support counts. 

Our goal with this campaign is to reach at least $5,000, with a stretch goal of $10,000, which is the total amount needed to cover bursaries.  It is our goal to ensure no chorister need be denied participation on account of financial limitations. 

*How does $5,000 become possible?

105 contributors at $49 = $5,000!

What you get

We want this to be exciting for all of our supporters as well! When you contribute, you will get a variety of fun and personal perks involving the choir and its amazing artistic directors, as well as our most heartfelt gratitude, and a whole lot of good karma!

 

Other ways you can help

We'll say it again; every little bit of support helps. If you're in Victoria, please consider attending one of our upcoming concerts.

We are still looking for corporate sponsors for our tour, and we have some enticing packages for these higher levels of support! If you think your company would be a good fit for this opportunity, please contact us.

This is not just a fundraising campaign for us - it is also a community building campaign. Wherever you are, we'd love some help spreading the word. Please tell your friends and colleagues about this project, share the link to this page, and join us on Facebook.
story_txt:
Who are we?
The Victoria Children’s Choir is an extraordinary musical ensemble based in Victoria, British Columbia.  On June 29th, our singers will embark on their SEA to SEA Tour - a two-week educational and cultural adventure through the Maritime Provinces. As young ambassadors of our beautiful west coast, they will bring the youth of Canada together for the Canada 150 celebrations this summer.  Throughout the tour, thirty-five choristers will share the gift of song with people in many east-coast communities.  The choir is especially honoured by the invitation from the Mayor of Charlottetown to perform at the birthplace of confederation during their official Canada Day celebrations on July 1st.  


What We Need 
Absolutely every little bit of support counts. 
Our goal with this campaign is to reach at least $5,000, with a stretch goal of $10,000, which is the total amount needed to cover bursaries.  It is our goal to ensure no chorister need be denied participation on account of financial limitations. 
*How does $5,000 become possible?
105 contributors at $49 = $5,000!

What you get
We want this to be exciting for all of our supporters as well! When you contribute, you will get a variety of fun and personal perks involving the choir and its amazing artistic directors, as well as our most heartfelt gratitude, and a whole lot of good karma!
 

Other ways you can help
We'll say it again; every little bit of support helps. If you're in Victoria, please consider attending one of our upcoming concerts.
We are still looking for corporate sponsors for our tour, and we have some enticing packages for these higher levels of support! If you think your company would be a good fit for this opportunity, please contact us.
This is not just a fundraising campaign for us - it is also a community building campaign. Wherever you are, we'd love some help spreading the word. Please tell your friends and colleagues about this project, share the link to this page, and join us on Facebook.

story:
About the campaign

My name is Carl Testa. I'm a composer, bassist, and electronic musician. I've organized The Uncertainty Music Series (an improvised, electronic, and experimental music series in New Haven, CT) since 2007. In September, after 10 years of concerts I'm closing down the series.To celebrate I'm organizing a two-day festival of concerts at Firehouse 12.

The Uncertainty Music Series Farewell Festival Lineup

Saturday 23 September 2017 8:30pm Jeremiah Cymerman's SYSTEMA MUNDITOTIUS with Matt Bauder, Patrik Holmes, Aaron Novik plus a set by a collaborative ensemble featuring Anne Rhodes, Chris Cretella, Forbes Graham, James Ilgenfritz, and Adam Matlock.

Sunday 24 September 2017 7:30pm Electronic Music by Val Inc. plus a set by a collaborative ensemble featuring Erica Dicker, Louis Guarino Jr., Junko Fujiwara, Andria Nicodemou, and Carl Testa.

Background

After 10 years of concerts I'm excited to organize a festival featuring an amazing cast of local, regional, and internationally-renowned artists who are coming together to share their work and celebrate the series. The series has always been run on donations with 100% going to the artists. With this farewell festival, I want to make sure the artists are paid a small guarantee and not relying on ticket sales. By supporting this campaign, you're making it possible for the festival to happen and hopefully getting some fun perks as a way of saying thanks for your support. Please consider backing and sharing with your friends. 

The Artists

I'm extremely pleased to have an incredible grouping of artists participating in the festival including Matt Bauder, Chris Cretella, Jeremiah Cymerman, Erica Dicker, Junko Fujiwara, Forbes Graham, Louis Guarino Jr., Patrick Holmes, James Ilgenfritz, Val Inc. (Val Jeanty), Adam Matlock, Andria Nicodemou, Aaron Novik, Anne Rhodes, and myself (Carl Testa).

What We Need & What You Get

In order to produce the festival, I'm asking for $5500.  This amount includes artist fees, an audio engineer, box office staff, recording costs, artist accommodations, food, and promotions. If the goal isn't reached, all the funds will still go towards funding the festival. To say thank you for contributing to the campaign I have some nice perks including a digital compilation of audio recordings from 10 years of concerts, a private YouTube playlist of videos from select shows from 10 years of concerts, and the option to get a music lesson from some Uncertainty Music Series affiliated-artists. Your contribution will directly go towards helping me produce a successful final farewell series of concerts. 

For this farewell series, I'm partnering with Firehouse 12, an amazing recording studio and performance space in New Haven, CT. It is one of the finest rooms to record and perform in the USA. I'm so excited to have the chance to send the series off in such a beautiful performance space. I've organized four other concerts at Firehouse 12 in the past and I've served as the production manager for the Firehouse 12 jazz series for over 5 years. I have the experience to produce a successful concert series, I just need the audience support from near and far to make it happen in the best way possible.

Risks & Challenges


The main risk for me is not completing the funding for the campaign. The artists and venue are booked. I've agreed to pay them their guarantees. I'm asking for your help and participation in making these concert happen and supporting this goodbye to the series. The digital compilation and YouTube playlist have not been finalized yet, so I'm afraid you won't know what artists are included on these audio and video compilations. However, the tracks will be selected from the 10 years of past Uncertainty Music Series concerts (see here: http://uncertaintymusic.com/past.htm) In the next few months I'll be approaching artists and asking for their permission to be included in the compilations. Some of the artists might say no, or I might not be able to get in touch with them. So that stands as a risk as to exactly how the perks will play out. I will do my very best to have both compilations ready by the end of October 2017.

I've organized over 150 concerts, I've released 3 albums under my own name, and a dozen more as either a musician or production manager. I have the experience to organize these concerts and fund a successful campaign. Please join and support the campaign and if you can't contribute, please consider sharing with your friends (wherever they live).

*Note: if you'd prefer to make a tax-deductible donation you can donate to The Tri-Centric Foundation and include a note stating the donation is for The Uncertainty Music Series.

story:
We Need Help!

Odd Box has been releasing the best noisy (and not so noisy) indiepop and diy punk for nearly 9 years now. Over the years we have built up some debt and we have slowly been paying this off - we need to raise some money to finally clear the debt and allow Odd Box to continue. Without this funding our next 3 or 4 releases will be our last.

Crowdfunding?

  • We need to raise £5000 to pay off all current Odd Box debts and allow us to fund 1 of the the currently planned releases.
  • We are offering unique T-shirts, tote bags, a mug, stickers, badges as well as an exclusive story of Odd Box fanzine: All Killer, No Filler

I have always been reluctant to crowd fund to help run the label but I see no alternative to help the label survive. I did think about doing a big sale to bring in the funds but I felt the flexibility of running a campaign and offering nice exclusives was the way to go on this occasion.

I know many are uncomfortable with crowd funding as a model and I totally understand that and if this is a funding method you don't agree with it or it doesn't sit easy with you please don't fund us this way. Over 9 years the label has paid it's own way for over 120 releases we're just finding the current conditions very tough and without clearing our debt Odd Box will not be able to continue doing what we have been doing - finding exciting new bands and giving them a helping hand.

Thanks for taking the time.

story:
Who is Lauryn?

Lauryn Hardiman is a singer/songwriter from Norman, Oklahoma. Music has always been a huge part of Lauryn's life. She is a 4-time Norman Music Festival performer and performs all over the Oklahoma City metroplex. Lauryn released her debut ep, 'Dreaming of Somewhere' on April 12th, 2015. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot donate at this time, it would mean a lot to us if you could please share this campaign link to your friends and family!

 

Thank you for checking out the road to Lauryn's second ep. We're so excited for you to be a part of our team!!

With love, 

Lauryn Hardiman & team.

story:
With this set of songs, I'm aiming to do two things, to challenge and to please. 

First, is to challenge common political beliefs by reflecting on the current political situation and showing the ugliness of the war and how capitalism needs it to survive. Also to show my view on individualism and its destructive role for the society as a whole. "Brutal Machine" and "Ideology".

Second, is to please the listener and to pay tribute to the style of the Big Band writing represented by such arrangers as Sammy Nestico and performers as Frank Sinatra or Nancy Wilson which I adore. "Rainbow" and "The Sea".

The main part of the project is funded by the Art and Humanities Council of Montgomery County MD and my own funds. But I will need additional funding to cover the mixing and mastering, plus to pay to the performers of two songs "Brutal Machine" and "Ideology", vocal tracks for which have not been recorded yet.

If I don't reach my entire goal, whatever I would get will go towards mixing and mastering as it is essential for the record to be finished.

The impact that I'm trying to make is best described by Bertolt Brecht:

“The worst illiterate is the political illiterate, he doesn’t hear, doesn’t speak, nor participates in the political events. He doesn’t know the cost of life, the price of the bean, of the fish, of the flour, of the rent, of the shoes and of the medicine, all depends on political decisions. The political illiterate is so stupid that he is proud and swells his chest saying that he hates politics. The imbecile doesn’t know that, from his political ignorance is born the prostitute, the abandoned child, and the worst thieves of all, the bad politician, corrupted and flunky of the national and multinational companies.”

With this record, I'm also calling my fellow musicians to use their art to stand up against the war and inequality and be on the worker's side in the political ideology.

For this campaign, I decided to don't make any CDs as I see them as not very useful.

If you 

 

Below are all the lyrics, written by Douglas Kearney.

 

"Brutal Machine"

The War Machine grinds bodies into money.

Money feeds the capital’s ravenous hunger.

The hunger for power and the tool to inflict it.

The tool is the bloody War Machine.

 

War is

A market where lives are bartered

Blood pours from wealthy wallets

But they call it dollars

The same way they call murdering

poor people “honor.”

 

Who owns the boats, the jets, the bombs and guns?

Who sells death to collect the funds?

[THE RULING CLASS!!!]  

declares wars and sends the people to fight it,

with the weapons that our labor and taxes provided.

Perpetual war

There’s a way we can to stop it,  

Refuse to kill, to kill or die for profit.

Die for profit, die for profit, die for profit, die for profit, die for profit.

Repeat

We can stop the machine’s brutal grinding.

We can starve the state’s endless greed.

We can cut the power from their pockets.

We can choose for whom we’ll bleed.

 

"Ideology"

Chained

to

Our desire for wealth

To make

us higher, we

chant to ourselves,

Inequality’s fate.

“One

crawls

through the mud so that

“one

Rides

on the horse.”

We let the lie live,

Hoping we’ll hold the reins.

Those

Who

Want

To trample you claim

That

We're

just animals

wallowing in our animal lust.

They

want

Our Humanity

sold for Selfish

comfort That's Nothing

but a handful of dust.

 

No more lies and we

change our lives, cause the

future has come., the future is here.

When we choose to fight all our greed

and our selfish pieties,

humanity’s won.

 

Speak the truth

And we wake our minds

‘cause the truth

belongs to us all.

When we fight

For the common good

Selfishness fails

Humanity’s won!

 

"Rainbow"

 

Multicolored ribbon bending in the air.

Lookie-loos are smitten like it’s something rare.

I ignore that scene, I know what “wonder” means.

Wonder is that I have you.

 

Optical illusion, it’s not magical.

Just a trick of fluid and refraction’s all.

But your touch I feel, I know my love is real—

It's like magic that came true

 

When a rainstorm comes and turns the day to night,

You’re the ray of sun that makes the gray go bright.

And what once was glum now fills me with delight.

every color of delight!

When the white-hot sun beats down with vicious heat

And the sidewalk feels like fire on my feet

You’re the nice, soft rain that makes the air so sweet.

Beautiful and oh so sweet.

 

When they seek, they hope for gold and leprechauns,

That’s antique, the chase just leads them on and on.

But I’ve found my treasure cause it's meant to be.

Rainbow just for you and me.

 

"The Sea"

I know a way

that takes me

out of this room

and makes me

feel as vast as the sea beyond the sand.

Sun on my skin, wind blows in,

my windows and blinds swung open,

as seagulls circle like a ceiling fan.

 

The whispering waves

start roaring,

till under the door,

they pour in,

to wash the floor away from where I stand.

Holding my breath, I dive in.

Deeper and yet I’m flying

Free from being stranded back on land.

 

You might think this is a dream—it’s better.

Plant my feet firm on the ground? No, never!

You can’t stop a spirit wild as a tempest

I’ll be sailing in the bluest distance.

 

It’s farther than you’d

imagine.

More wondrous than you

could fathom.

Its strength could wear a mountain to a stone.

Bright as a jewel It shimmers,

Peaceful and cool,It glimmers.

And when I swim inside I’m finally home!

 

You might think this is a dream—it’s better.

Plant my feet firm on the ground? No, never!

You can’t stop a spirit wild as a tempest

I’ll be sailing in the bluest distance.

 

Don’t you tell me it’s a dream—it’s better.

Keep my feet firm on the ground? I’ll never!

You can’t dam a spirit wild as a tempest,

I’ll be sailing in the blue—

I’d sail into the blue—

I want to sail the bluest distance.

 

Douglas Kearney 2018

story:
Dear amazing people,

My name is Malika Tirolien and i thank you already for taking the time to read this! I am a singer songwriter from Guadeloupe (an archipelago in the Caribbean), based in Montreal, Canada.

I am a member of Kalmunity Vibe collective, the biggest collective of artists in Canada, a member of Michael League's new band BOKANTÉ, and i also have my solo project.

This campaign concerns the latter. I need your support so i can finalize my new solo album. It is a 11 songs album with 10 original songs of mine that are very close to my heart and one arrangement of a poem from my dear late grandfather Guy Tirolien. The whole album was recorded at the Highbreed studio in New York with 3 time Grammy winner producer/musician Michael League of Snarky Puppy himself and other incredible musicians. I am SO excited for this!!!

The Concept

I wanted to make a 4 album series, a tetralogy with each album representing one of the four elements. The first one, "Sur La Voie Ensoleillée" ("On The Sunny Road") is EARTH, grounded, roots, mostly live, mixing my essence with my influences. The new album would be AIR, spiritual, astral and mostly produced to reflect the abstract aspect of its concept. 

The Goal, with your Support

To be able to finalize the new album, i need to raise $15000 (USD) to cover the costs for:

  • The musical producer’s fee (Michael League)

  • Mixing and mastering of the album

  • Visuals (photography, graphic design, website, posters, ect...)

  • Promotional material (videos teasers, video clips, EPK, ect…)

 

I am personally paying for the studio recording session, the musician’s fees, and all the costs of being in New York City for 2 weeks.

However there are a lot more costs involved with the making of an album.

That is why I need your help.  

 

If you give me your support, i can guarantee i am going to make THE MOST of every penny raised.

With this project, i have so many visual concepts to go with the music and lyrics about utopia, forgiveness, higher self, astral travel and more.

I hope i can go as far as possible in realizing these ideas and representing Guadeloupe and Montreal.

If you can help in any way, by contributing financially and/or sharing this campaign with 10 of your friends, I am sure we can reach my goal of raising 15 000$ (USD).

I know you will be happy with the result of our common effort!

 

Chers merveilleuses personnes,

Je m'appelle Malika Tirolien et je vous remercie de prendre de votre temps pour me lire. Je suis auteur-compositeur-interprête d'origine guadeloupéenne et basée à Montréal. Je suis membre du collectif Kalmunity Vibe, le plus important collectif d'artistes au Canada, membre du groupe BOKANTÉ, le nouveau projet de Michael League, et j'ai également un projet solo.

Cette campagne de financement concerne d'ailleurs ce dernier. J'ai besoin de votre support pour finaliser mon nouvel album. Il s'agit d'un projet contenant 10 compositions originales chères à mon coeur et un arrangement d'un poème de mon cher grand père: feu Guy Tirolien. L'album serait musicalement arrangé par le lauréat de 3 grammy awards Michael League (Snarky Puppy) et enregistré avec l'aide d'une brochette de musiciens extraordinaires. Je suis sur-vol-tée à cette idée!

Le concept

J'avais en tête la production d'une tétralogie: 4 albums chacun représenté par un des 4 éléments.

Le premier album, "Sur La Voie Ensoleillée" représente la TERRE, l'ancrage, les racines, enregistré en live majoritairement, mêlant mes origines et mes influences.

Le nouvel album symboliserait l'AIR, le spirituel, l'astral avec des instrumentations plus digitales pour refléter le côté abstrait du concept.

 

Le But, avec votre aide

Pour pouvoir finaliser le nouvel album, j'ai besoin de récolter 15 000$ (USD) afin de couvrir les frais de:

  • Frais du réalisateur artistique (Michael League)

  • Le Mix et le Mastering de l'album

  • Visuel (photographie, conception graphique, site web, posters, ect…)

  • Materiel promotionnel (extraits videos, clips, presentation video, ect…)

J’ai personnellement payé pour les frais des sessions studio, les cachets des musiciens ainsi que toutes les dépenses occasionnées par le fait d'être à New York durant 2 semaines.

Si vous m'offrez votre support, je peux vous garantir que j'utiliserai chaque centime de dollars réunis de la manière la plus OPTIMALE possible.

J'ai tellement d'idées pour mettre en images la musique et les paroles touchant les thèmes de l'Utopie, du pardon, de l'être Supérieur en chacun de nous, des voyages astraux et plus. J'espère pouvoir aller aussi loin que possible dans la réalisation de ces idées tout en représentant la Guadeloupe et Montréal.

Si vous pouvez aider d'une quelconque manière, en contribuant financièrement et/ou en partageant cette campagne à au moins 10 de vos amis, je crois que nous pourrons atteindre la cagnotte de 15 000$ (USD) et que vous serez heureux du résultat de ce commun effort!

Dear amazing people,My name is Malika Tirolien and i thank you already for taking the time to read this! I am a singer songwriter from Guadeloupe (an archipelago in the Caribbean), based in Montreal, Canada.I am a member of Kalmunity Vibe collective, the biggest collective of artists in Canada, a member of Michael League's new band BOKANTÉ, and i also have my solo project.This campaign concerns the latter. I need your support so i can finalize my new solo album. It is a 11 songs album with 10 original songs of mine that are very close to my heart and one arrangement of a poem from my dear late grandfather Guy Tirolien. The whole album was recorded at the Highbreed studio in New York with 3 time Grammy winner producer/musician Michael League of Snarky Puppy himself and other incredible musicians. I am SO excited for this!!!The ConceptI wanted to make a 4 album series, a tetralogy with each album representing one of the four elements. The first one, "Sur La Voie Ensoleillée" ("On The Sunny Road") is EARTH, grounded, roots, mostly live, mixing my essence with my influences. The new album would be AIR, spiritual, astral and mostly produced to reflect the abstract aspect of its concept. The Goal, with your SupportTo be able to finalize the new album, i need to raise $15000 (USD) to cover the costs for:
The musical producer’s fee (Michael League)
Mixing and mastering of the album
Visuals (photography, graphic design, website, posters, ect...)
Promotional material (videos teasers, video clips, EPK, ect…)
 I am personally paying for the studio recording session, the musician’s fees, and all the costs of being in New York City for 2 weeks.However there are a lot more costs involved with the making of an album.That is why I need your help.   If you give me your support, i can guarantee i am going to make THE MOST of every penny raised.With this project, i have so many visual concepts to go with the music and lyrics about utopia, forgiveness, higher self, astral travel and more.I hope i can go as far as possible in realizing these ideas and representing Guadeloupe and Montreal.If you can help in any way, by contributing financially and/or sharing this campaign with 10 of your friends, I am sure we can reach my goal of raising 15 000$ (USD).I know you will be happy with the result of our common effort! Chers merveilleuses personnes,Je m'appelle Malika Tirolien et je vous remercie de prendre de votre temps pour me lire. story:
https://www.robincisekmusic.com

Robin Cisek is a singer/ songwriter who creates melodic and moody, alternative pop with introspective and vulnerable lyrics. Robin Cisek emerged into her music career after years of struggles with health problems. These experiences have further fueled her growth as a songwriter and encouraged her to write about experiences that are highly relatable but not often talked about. Robin uses her soulful and highly stylized vocals to create mysterious and dramatic narratives that are captivating and powerful. Throughout her music, Robin Cisek wears her heart on her sleeve and openly invites audiences to join her in a surreal world.

Robin’s inspiration comes from her own experiences and her Indigenous heritage. Robin’s heritage takes form in music through her alternative beats and lyrics that challenge the status quo. Robin has been a professional musician for a short time and released her first commercial song at the end of 2017 and then another in 2018. Previous to this, she was awarded many high adjudications for her vocals. Robin Cisek’s first releases were developed with the guidance of Grammy-award-winning producers in NYC and LA. These singles received many praises in addition to being played on radio in Canada and internationally. Robin’s single, “Waiting on You” claimed the #1 spot on an Indigenous International Radio chart and remained on the countdown for 24 weeks.

Robin is working towards creating brand new music that she hopes to release as her first album by the summer of 2021. As you may know, creating art can be very expensive. This campaign was created to help fundraise to ensure that Robin's first full-length album can find success and come into the world without a hitch! 

What I Need & What You Get

The goal of fundraising is to collect money for marketing and promotion for my new album and to recoup the money used to record my music. The creation of this album was entirely funded by me from my previous musical successes and gigs. I am now, reaching out to you, for funding for promotion and marketing! I have many tiers of donation, some have merch, some are services like performing cover songs and some are just donations ranging from very low increments to something on the larger side. I appreciate every donation and action to support my music, big or small!

Why Donate?

By donating, you are ensuring the success of my new album. I have worked extremely hard on writing these songs and making sure that they are the best thing I've created to this day. I have complete faith in what I have created and I know you will love my new music! Previously, my song hit #1 on the Indigenous music countdown. This was accomplished with no public funding and a lot of hard work! If I was able to procure a bit of a marketing budget, I can only imagine what we can accomplish for my new music! Any support or donation you can offer me is so greatly appreciated!

Challenges

I have always had to work extremely hard to make sure my music is successful and I will continue to do so! My music is my passion and I want to share it with the world. With that being said, I want to work for your support and give you something back for your donations. This is why many of my donation tiers offer a service, item or some form of thank you! I have created personalized perks at a range of prices from $4 all the way to $500 so you can be a part of my project and find a perk that fits your budget and interests you the most!

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Get the word out about my new music, my previously released music, and my work as a musician
  • Share this campaign
  • Follow me on social media (facebook, Instagram, tiktok)
  • join my mailing list by contacting me on social media or by email
  • Pre-save my new music (when the time comes) and listen to the music I've released previously

Thank you so much for your support! 

 

IMPORTANT DATES:
February 11th, 2021

February 12st, 2021

May 21st, 2021

June 18th, 2021

story:
Hello everyone, we are the Northwestern University Trombone Choir, Winners of the 2017 Emory Remington Trombone Choir Competition! :) 

As students at the Northwestern, we are humbly asking for your support to travel to the International Trombone Festival at the University of Redlands in June of 2017. Unfortunately, funding is scarce and we need the support of the public to attend this educational event.  

The International Trombone Festival is an annual gathering of the leading professionals within the trombone world. The festival is comprised of concerts/recitals, masterclasses, exhibits, and individual competitions. Participants and performers travel from around the globe to attend this event. Individually, we will learn so much from hearing the top professionals in our field teach and perform throughout the festival.

To make this trip possible our Choir needs:

Flights                         $6512.00 (15 students)

Mass Transportation to Festival     $586

Grand total                 $8,200

This money is going directly to fund our travel and we have all agreed to pay for our  housing out of our pocket. We just want to perform a great concert after winning this competition! 

We don't have much to give for your donation, but here is what we can offer you for your generous support.

If we do not reach our goal, all contributions will be divided up between members of our choir to help with our travel expenses.

If you can't donate today, please share our campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram pages. 

Please check out our Perks page for items you will receive for your donations. All donations above $10 come with social media recognition and thank you note. 

Thank you so much. :)

 

The Northwestern University Trombone Choir

story:
Preview!  (This song will be on the EP!)

 

HISTORY PART I

 

HISTORY PART II

 


Recording Process Explained



Hi!  Thanks for stopping by!

My name is Nikia and I am about to record a 6-song EP in Nashville, TN.  Take a look below to read more and watch videos about who I am, why this EP means so much to me, how you can help and what's in it for you.  xoxo.

W H Y    I T    M A T T E R S

I'll tell you more about myself, what's involved for this campaign and the perks below, but the most important thing I want to share with you is why this all matters to me.  And why it may matter to you. 

 

ABOUT :  

Hi.  I'm a singer-songwriter originally from a small town in Maryland, currently residing in Nashville, TN.  I come from a musical family and grew up playing concert piano and violin, rooted in Bach, Tchaikovsky, Brahms and Beethoven.  I didn't grow up listening to staple, epic songwriters like most of my friends and I don't have an ongoing list of artists and bands who have inspired me from a young age.  I have composers and sonatas and symphonic works.  And I think that's what makes my music and approach to songwriting different than others.

I didn't start songwriting until college, but found that I could weave in musical ideas I was learning about in school to form a three-and-a-half minute pop song.  I tried to mimic the thick string textures from Brahms, the simple, beautiful melodic lines from Mozart, minimalism from Philip Glass and emotional pull of Tchaikovsky.  I wrote my first song (that I felt proud of), "The Seams" and released it on YouTube and then on Facebook.  I was terrified and I felt vulnerable, but friends and family began to react in such a way that I thought, "Wow.  Maybe I really can do this."  And more importantly, "...maybe I should."

I wrote song after song after song, and finally took the plunge to record my first full-length album, "Taller Than Trees" which released in 2014.  It had radio airplay on Baltimore's 98 Rock and I had a successful release show at the 8x10 with a line out the door in support.  Soon after, I hopped in my car and relocated to Nashville.

N A S H V I L L E

Life has its ups and downs.  Nashville started as a two-year chapter of downs.  But, what I've learned is that beautiful things can be unearthed from the darkest of moments and you can grow, exponentially, when you have no other place to go than straight up.  Nashville symbolizes so much for me: heartache and disappointment paired with extreme growth and acceptance.  A beautiful contrast and balance.  Feelings I can barely begin to describe in words. 

I've spent the last year writing songs from the deepest parts of my being, digging deeper to find the things I'm too scared to say out loud and the things I'm too proud to admit.  And now, with your help, I'm ready to scream those things from the rooftop and share them with the world.

W H A T   C O M E S   N E X T ?

The hustle.  I have my songs, but now comes the execution and the part where you can help me do this.  As much as I wish it were as easy as hitting the "record" button, the process is much more complex and demanding of time, creative energy and money.  If you're not familiar with the process of recording and releasing music, here's a quick snapshot:

  • Organizing band members
  • Rehearsing 
  • Production
  • Booking Studio Time for:
  • Tracking [This is the part we're all familiar with]
  • Tracking
  • And More Tracking
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • ​Manufacturing
  • Publishing
  • Distributing

Then comes the next stage of hustle with marketing, planning a release show and eventually...TOUR!

THE GOODS

Don't worry.  I've got you covered.

As a thank you for helping make this happen, I've come up with a few different ways to show my gratitude which you can browse through.  Over the next 30 days I'll be releasing new perks, too!  So check back often for other fun goodies!  Contributors, however, will be the ONLY people who can:

  • Pre-order the EP
  • Access limited edition merch
  • Have something personally crafted by moi!

Thank you for considering this project!  And be sure to take a look around.  If you have a special request you don't see listed, don't hesitate to contact me.  Or, if you cannot make a contribution, there are other ways to help support and be a part of this I would love to share with you!

And More Tracking
Mixing
Mastering
​Manufacturing
Publishing
Distributing
Then comes the next stage of hustle with marketing, planning a release show and eventually...TOUR!THE GOODSDon't worry.  I've got you covered.As a thank you for helping make this happen, I've come up with a few different ways to show my gratitude which you can browse through.  Over the next 30 days I'll be releasing new perks, too!  So check back often for other fun goodies!  Contributors, however, will be the ONLY people who can:
Pre-order the EP
Access limited edition merch
Have something personally crafted by moi!
Thank you for considering this project!  And be sure to take a look around.  If you have a special request you don't see listed, don't hesitate to contact me.  Or, if you cannot make a contribution, there are other ways to help support and be a part of this I would love to share with you!

story:
Short Summary

  • Wind and the Why started as a duo in 2016 (Emily Casey and Therese Anderberg) and is now a four piece band with Danny Goodman and Justin Aaronson.
  • Emily and Therese write songs that explore belonging, purpose, transitions and the big questions (that we don't have answers to) and we want to share them with you!
  • After 2 years of writing, performing, and recording demos (with the amazing Joe Casey in Nashville!) we're ready to release our first 5-song EP with producer James Frazee.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our fundraising goal is $8,500. This covers:
    • 5 days of studio time
    • Working with producer James Frazee
    • Mixing and mastering 5 songs
    • Distribution
  • We've got perks! Cover songs of your choice, album listening parties, shows at a location of your choice- the fun goes on!

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is tight- we get it! Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Share, share, share this page on Facebook/Instagram/Twitter! Every share helps!
  • Word of mouth! Tell your friends!
  • Like our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/windandthewhy 
  • Follow us on Instagram: www.instagram.com/windandthewhy

Last but not least...THANK YOU! Thanks for taking the time to read this and for supporting our music!

story:
My Story

R&B/Soul/Pop diva, Asia Monique and Imagery of a Dream Productions have teamed up to give the music industry the ZING that it's been missing. With the release of her debut EP slated for August, Asia hopes to invite all her fans and soon to be fans to "The Zing Room" by way of her brand new single "Stay On Him." Asia says she hopes the video will "show everybody exactly what the zing is." Zing is a movement that promotes self love, empowerment and fearlessness. Join the movement while there's still time!


The Impact

 This is brand new territory for Asia so, it is important that she shows up as professional as possible. Making sure that the members of her crew are fed, comfortable and well equipped for long hours is very important to her. The money raised from this campaign will provide the bare necessities for the "Stay On Him Video" shoot. 


What We Need & What You Get

$500 is the ultimate goal. Help Asia Monique and Imagery of a Dream Productions make "Stay On Him" a great success! 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give a monetary donation don't be discouraged! Help Asia Monique reach her goal by posting her campaign link to your personal social networking site (Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr..etc). For all the latest news including performances, giveaways and new releases follow her on Twitter @Zing_ItsAsiaMoe.

story:
Who is Black Sunset? What’s the story?

Jeremy Vancaulart is a self-taught, independent musician. He’s been creating music since he was young, listening to bands such as Nine Inch Nails, The Crystal Method, The Prodigy, and Massive Attack. Jeremy’s passion led him through high school – he played in various rock, and industrial, bands as a singer, but always knew in the back of his mind that he had yet to find a genre that really tapped into his talent.

In his late teens, Jeremy discovered electronic music. He started producing his own music, realizing that he had a knack for evoking incredible emotion with a computer. As the genre gained momentum in the mainstream world, Jeremy continued producing and gaining confidence making electronic music. The response he received from friends and fans was increasingly positive – Jeremy found his calling.

His friend was tragically murdered on October 18 2004. This drove Jeremy to produce his first independent CD. Even though the CD was amateur he realized the true power and impact of music. Producing music became a therapeutic process for him as well as his listeners. His alternative industrial act was featured in the local news, received radio play in Japan, and was sold locally.  The following singles Jeremy produced were sold digitally around the globe.

Although Jeremy had achieved small success in the local music industry, it was still not enough to keep him financially stable. He attended Sheridan College for media, film, and television. He graduated with honours majoring in post-production sound editing and mixing. Jeremy tried to pursue a career working on feature films and television shows, all the while knowing it was not where is heart was.

Jeremy has done all he can do to continue making music while paying the bills – he was paid to drive a truck picking up donations for the Canadian Diabetes Association, and got a part-time job working as an AV technician in Toronto. Still, this was not enough.

With an entrepreneurial spirit, Jeremy has chosen a new path. He has created a digital independent record label, Black Sunset Music, and needs financial support through the startup phase. His undeniable love and passion for developing musicians coupled with his essential need to produce his own music led him to Black Sunset Music. 

What Is Black Sunset Music?           

Black Sunset Music is an independent, digital record label that aims to promote and release quality electronic dance music (EDM). With a focus on trance, progressive, and chill music, Black Sunset Music will help give musicians, like Jeremy, the support and resources needed to break into the electronic music industry. Black Sunset Music is located in Toronto, Canada and work mainly with Canadian musicians.

The Goal

Black Sunset Music will bring you music that makes you really ‘feel’. There is a misconception in some people’s minds: over-production means less emotive music. Black Sunset Music will help prove that this is not the case.

Breaking out of the mainstream mold is difficult, and Black Sunset Music aims to show the world true electronic talent by producing exceptional EDM. Black Sunset Music will help promote truly talented artists that deserve to be recognized and will help share the love and beauty of electronic dance music.

Financial Rundown

 Goal: $8000

What will this money go towards?

Graphic Design ($500)

  • EP and single cover art design.
  • Overall branding material, including digital assets and social media.

Photography ($1000)

  • High-grade photos that capture the featured artists and producers.

Merchandise ($500)

  • Shirts for staff, artists, street teams, and fans.

Administration Fees ($500)

  • Setup and legal fees.

Mastering ($1000)

  • Cost of mastering audio tracks the first 4 months worth of releases.

Advertising ($2000)

  • Cost of advertising during the start up.

Staff ($1940)

  • Cost of staff for 4 months.

Indiegogo fees ($560)

  • Indiegogo needs to make a living too!

Extra money earned over the $8000 target will be applied evenly to the various areas needed.

Your Impact

Jeremy is talented, driven and motivated, and he needs your help. Your financial support will allow him to achieve his life goal of pursuing a career as a musician and producer, and will help give independent dance music the recognition it deserves.

Help Jeremy follow his dreams and create something really great. Your support will not go unnoticed – every little bit helps. Black Sunset Music is the start of a new life for Jeremy, a voice for independent electronic musicians, and a new force behind independent dance music. Your contribution makes you a part of something wonderful. 

Get Involved

If for whatever reason you're out of luck, bills are suffocating you, or you just lost your job, you can always make some noise about this campaign through social media. Anything helps.
