story:
Releasing great music doesn't happen for free...

l suppose that's not entirely true: but recording and mixing music that doesn't make people's ears bleed is the real trick.

We're up to our eyeballs in pre-production demo recordings that we're really, really excited about. The key factor here is we want to release our music and we want to do it RIGHT. We're getting the experts involved.

Click here to check some of them out, they're REALLY good!

So what's the goal?

We want to get a shortlist of 6 songs professionally recorded, mixed, mastered and playlisted on local rock radio stations. We're not talking a quick "slap it together after work, before putting the kids to bed" effort in a semi-professional studio: this is the real McCoy, the full monty.

We've worked hard at developing fantastic connections with New Zealand's top recording engineers and music industry leaders to figure out how to make our money work as hard as it can. We want the best value possible with the best people available without compromising on a single iota of quality to get a result we can get behind and be really proud of.

How can you help?

We've set up a pre-ordering system on the right hand side of this page, everything from $1 digital downloads, to limited edition CDs. 

If you aren't able to place an order or donate financially, we completely understand - there are other way you can support the SansArcade phenomenon:

  • MOST IMPORTANTLY help us spread the word. Use the indie-gogo 'share' tools above for your facebook and twitter. We need help getting the word out and it'll be much easier with your help!
  • Follow us on Twitter and/or Facebook
  • Show a friend our website;
  • Play a friend some of our music.

Helping us spread the word on Facebook, Twitter and by telling your friends about us helps more than you could imagine. Please share the link and get the word out!

Where does the money go?

We're seeking support with covering the costs of the recording, mixing & mastering of the EP to get our music out to new people. The basic costs are outlined below and we're seeking $5000 through crowdfunding, this won't cover everything but will at least cover the majority of the recording costs.

  • Primary recording in one of NZs most famous high quality studios is going to cost around $2500 at a conservative estimate.
  • Secondary recording, editing and mixing will run us $4000
  • Mastering for 6 songs has been quoted at around $1000

As you can see already, the project will be just short of 8K and we are already doing everything we can to self-fund the rest.

So who are we?

We're an Auckland band who's new on the scene but between the four of us we've been touring and playing shows all over New Zealand for over a decade, including some of the country's largest festivals - some of us have even made it across the Tasman to book and play shows up and down the east coast of Australia.

We've been locked away - safe from prying eyes - practising, writing and figuring out what really makes us tick as musicians. Leaning on our influences, and standing tall on the shoulders of our musical fore-fathers we've found a balance in style and approach that is exactly what New Zealand rock is lacking... so why not give people what they never knew they needed?

For a one-stop-shop of all our social networking feeds check out www.sansarcade.com.

story:
Personal Journey

My name is Rose Bilal.  In addition to being a jazz singer, I'm a visual artist, a writer, motivational speaker, and actor.  I love being able to do all of those things!     The talents I've been given has brought so much happiness to my life, and to the lives of the many people I've have the privilege of entertaining.   This campaign is important to me because it gives me a tool that provides me with a bigger voice to spread the healing sounds of music to a wider listening audience, and to help keep alive the music that has played a major role in the creation of our culture.    

My Story

In the 1960’s when I was singing with my Rhythm & Blues group I thought, “it can’t possibly get any better than this”.  Here I am, traveling the globe with a dynamite singing group, making a ton of money, and hanging out with the stars!  For me, that was equivalent to having died and gone to heaven.  Especially since before that time, my life was a long way from being anything special.

As I explain in my book, “Don't Blame the Road”, a memoir I've written about my life, “It was almost as if overnight I'd gone from being incarcerated, to being friends with people who were on television, in the news, and had millions of people rushing out to buy their records.  I was constantly pinching myself as I marveled at how things had turned around in my life.    

As I look back I can't help but marvel at how the simplest things can end up making the biggest difference.

It wasn't until the 90’s when the wonderful, intricate, sounds of jazz music found its way into my ears.   I knew I was hearing something unique, and that it would somehow have a profound effect on my life.

For me it was hearing a voice on the radio, coming out of a woman I thought must've been an angel.   World renowned jazz vocalist, Sarah Vaughan made so many unbelievable twists, turns, highs, and lows in all the songs I'd heard her sing that it instantly changed my taste in music.

Being a singer, I thought I knew about singing, and music.  That is, until I heard jazz music.

I had no idea there was such a huge difference in the rhythm and timing of jazz music, versus Rhythm & Blues.  Having been a rhythm & blues singer since early childhood, and not having any formal training, made my transition to jazz music a very trying, but extremely rewarding experience.   I had an unprecedented drive to learn this new music.  I worked day & night listening to all the female jazz singers whose records or CD’s I could find.  Singers like, Sarah, Ella, Carmen McRae, Nancy Wilson, etc.  I would go to all the night clubs where jazz was being played and listen to the singers, and when my nerves allowed, I’d get up and sing.

Early on I was introduced to some world class musicians who recognized in me something I'd been too insecure to admit; I had talent.  These guys were more than willing to take me under their wings, and unselfishly give me their time, guidance, and expert musical advice - which I've used like a Bible - that has helped me tremendously in my growth as a jazz vocalist.  I believe it was during this time my dream of writing and producing my own cabaret show was born.

The Rewards

As time passes, I'm honored, and humbled, to hear, and see the efforts of all my hard work paying off with the applause, and words of encouragement from all the many fans and supporters who has followed my career over the years

It is for them and the love I have for what I do that propels me forward, and compels me to want to continue spreading the healing sounds of music throughout the world. 

There are no words for me to describe the complete "joy" I feel inside whenever I witness Senior Citizens who stand up from their wheel chairs, and dance to the old school jazz music they immediately recognize, but can no longer hear played on the radio.  Or, when I see young people, and teenagers running up to me after my performance, to tell me in their “I can't believe it” voice, how much they loved hearing the songs I'd sung.

 I'm also glowing from the inside out at the thought of receiving your financial support for a venue I know you'll be proud to be a part of.

How To Help

Your financial support will provide me with necessary funding to utilize the talents of professional musicians, writers, singers, musical director, choreographer, recording, sound, lights, costumes, and also sound, video, and other things necessary to produce a dynamic show.

 Jazz, Swing, n’ Another Thing is a cabaret show guaranteed to touch the souls, and change to lives of all music lovers I’ll have the privilege of entertaining as I go about my mission of changing the world one song at a time!

 

JAZZ SWING N' ANOTHER THING

 

40 minutes to 1 hour "Vegas-Style" Cabaret Show

 

 

BUDGET (How The Money Will Be Utilized)

23 musical charts for 10 piece Band @ $300 a chart

(all parts for all instruments)...................................$6,900.00

Marketing
(web site, graphic design, brochures, etc.)...................$5,000.00

10 hours of rehearsal for 10 pc. Band @ $50.00ea.........$5,000.00

Director/Consultant for 30 hours @ $85.00 per hr..........$2,550.00

Studio Time & On Location Live Recording

for 30 hours @85.00 per hr......................................$2,550.00

Choreograher for 20 hours @ $85.00 per hr.................$1,700.00

8 Musicians for Live Performance

for 4 hours @ $150.00 ea.......................................$1,200.00

Portable Set & Props (Design & Labor)......................$2,000.00

Lighting & Lighting Design for flat rate of.................. $800.00

3 Back-Up Singers for 5 hour rehearsal @ $50.00 ea......$750.00

3 Back-Up Singers for 4 hour
live performance @ $150.00 ea.................................$ 450.00

Costumes (2 Gowns, Top Hat, Boa, etc.)....................$500.00

Theatrical Make-Up Artist for 4 hours @ $100 per hr.......$400.00

 

TOTAL PRODUCTION COST................................$29,800.00

 

Songs For Cabaret Show

 

1.  I Don't Remember Ever Growing Up

2.  Hit The Road Jack

3.  Come Back To Me

4.  Here's To Life

5.  The Lady Is A Tramp 

6. Everybody Eats When They Come To My House

7. At Last

8.  Almost Like Being In Love 

9.  I Will Survive

10. Give Me The Simple Life

11. I Love Being Here With You

12. I've Got The World On A String

13. We're In This Love Together

14. I'm Gonna Lock My Heart & Throw Away The Key

15. Them There Eyes

16. You Don't Know What Love Is

17. Bill Bailey

18. That Old Black Magic

19. I'm Just Foolin' Myself

20. I'm Going To Chicago

21. You Stepped Out Of A Dream

22. Don't Let The Sun Catch You Cryin' 

23. Let's Stay Together

Early on I was introduced to some world class musicians who recognized in me something I'd been too insecure to admit; I had talent.  These guys were more than willing to take me under their wings, and unselfishly give me their time, guidance, and expert musical advice - which I've used like a Bible - that has helped me tremendously in my growth as a jazz vocalist.  I believe it was during this time my dream of writing and producing my own cabaret show was born.
The Rewards
As time passes, I'm honored, and humbled, to hear, and see the efforts of all my hard work paying off with the applause, and words of encouragement from all the many fans and supporters who has followed my career over the years
It is for them and the love I have for what I do that propels me forward, and compels me to want to continue spreading the healing sounds of music throughout the world. 
There are no words for me to describe the complete "joy" I feel inside whenever I witness Senior Citizens who stand up from their wheel chairs, and dance to the old school jazz music they immediately recognize, but can no longer hear played on the radio.  Or, when I see young people, and teenagers running up to me after my performance, to tell me in their “I can't believe it” voice, how much they loved hearing the songs I'd sung.
 I'm also glowing from the inside out at the thought of receiving your financial support for a venue I know you'll be proud to be a part of.
How To Help
Your financial support will provide me with necessary funding to utilize the talents of professional musicians, writers, singers, musical director, choreographer, recording, sound, lights, costumes, and also sound, video, and other things necessary to produce a dynamic show.
 Jazz, Swing, n’ Another Thing is a cabaret show guaranteed to touch the souls, and change to lives of all music lovers I’ll have the privilege of entertaining as I go about my mission of changing the world one song at a time!
 
JAZZ SWING N' ANOTHER THING
 
40 minutes to 1 hour "Vegas-Style" Cabaret Show
 
 
BUDGET (How The Money Will Be Utilized)
23 musical charts for 10 piece Band @ $300 a chart
(all parts for all instruments)...................................$6,900.00
Marketing(web site, graphic design, brochures, etc.)...................$5,000.00
10 hours of rehearsal for 10 pc. Band @ $50.00ea.........$5,000.00
Director/Consultant for 30 hours @ $85.00 per hr..........$2,550.00
Studio Time & On Location Live Recording
for 30 hours @85.00 per hr......................................$2,550.00
Choreograher for 20 hours @ $85.00 per hr.................$1,700.00
8 Musicians for Live Performance
for 4 hours @ $150.00 ea.......................................$1,200.00
Portable Set & Props (Design & Labor)......................$2,000.00
Lighting & Lighting Design for flat rate of.................. $800.00
3 Back-Up Singers for 5 hour rehearsal @ $50.00 ea......$750.00
3 Back-Up Singers for 4 hourlive performance @ $150.00 ea.................................$ 450.00
Costumes (2 Gowns, Top Hat, Boa, etc.)....................$500.00
Theatrical Make-Up Artist for 4 hours @ $100 per hr.......$400.00
 
TOTAL PRODUCTION COST................................$29,800.00
 
Songs For Cabaret Show
 
1.  I Don't Remember Ever Growing Up
2.  Hit The Road Jack
3.  Come Back To Me
4.  Here's To Life
5.  The Lady Is A Tramp 
6. Everybody Eats When They Come To My House
7. At Last
8.  Almost Like Being In Love 
9.  I Will Survive
10. Give Me The Simple Life
11. I Love Being Here With You
12. I've Got The World On A String
13. We're In This Love Together
14. I'm Gonna Lock My Heart & Throw Away The Key
15. Them There Eyes
16. You Don't Know What Love Is
17. Bill Bailey
18. That Old Black Magic
19. I'm Just Foolin' Myself
20. I'm Going To Chicago
21. You Stepped Out Of A Dream
22. Don't Let The Sun Catch You Cryin' 
23. Let's Stay Together

story:
It has been said that bad things happen to good people. In this case, however, a terrible thing has happened to a fantastic person. Pat has been a trusted source of information, solutions and anecdotes in our community for many years. Recently, Pat was diagnosed with brain cancer and has undergone months of treatment. While it seemed the cancer was receding, so too, did Pat's hearing. Unlike his hearing, the cancer has come back. Throughout, Pat has adopted, and maintained a positive outlook. He also insists on continuing to work; unfortunately, working has become more difficult due to his hearing loss.

We all know the economy is tough and a lot of people will fall through cracks due to policies, exclusions, and red tape. Battling cancer is not only physically exhausting, but financially as well. Please help in our mission to ensure Pat receives his hearing aids and is able to continue the things that bring him joy...helping his customers and listening to jazz. 

Afterall, Pat without music is like a fish out of water.

story:
My name is Kevin Gant,  a GuitarPoet living in Austin, Texas

For the last year and a half, I've been screening "Jay Duplass's Documentary "Kevin" at Film Festivals all over the U.S. and Canada. Film Festival Audiences have given me so much Love(!) and there's absolutely nothing else I prefer to do with my life, other than continuing to tour the Globe, performing for Folks along the way!

I want the freedom to write, record, and to continue Screening "Kevin", performing live, in Theatres, Universities, Coffee Houses, Living Rooms, Art Galleries, EVERYWHERE!

I'm asking for 1 Milliion Dollars, simply because I perceive the Internet to be unlimited, so why limit the Internet's Potential!

I will be truly Grateful for $100, $1,000, $5,000, $10,000, whatever amount I'm blessed to receive from all of you generous folks out there! Wouldn't it be Great, though, to fully fund at 1 Million?

"6 Strings&Holywood!"

Fully fund my Indiegogo Campaign, and I will Record Albums and Shoot Movies, FOREVER!

I would definitely call on many of the talented film folks, I've met over the past year and a half, at the 40+Film Festivals I've attended, and we would absolutely be shooting Feature Films; Afer all, that's what IndieGoGo is for, Putting Filmakers, Artists, Songwriters, Musicians, Dancers, and Actors to work, so.....LET'S DO THIS THING!

 

P.S. I Believe in Miracles!

story:
Our Story

Seventh Circle is technically a solo project by Adam Pederson.  Other members who will be featured on this album are Kevin Wiler (guitars) and Pete Allan (drums).  I will also be hiring a bass player as well as additional vocalists for a choir and misc vocals throughout the album.  The first Seventh Circle album (THE STRUGGLE) was released in 2008 and was co-produced with Eric Clayton of the band Saviour Machine.  This time around, I won't be so lucky to have him work on it so I will need an engineer and producer for certain aspects of recording, mainly vocals and drums.  Human, Part One is the first part of a two part concept album which explores the many things happening in our world today. It's mainly about what the digital age has done to our society and where it's all going from here.  Part One deals with the many struggles and turmoils we are facing today where Part Two will delve deeper into what may become of us in the near future.  The music tells just as much of a story as the lyrics will, using many organic and electronic elements side by side to symbolize the fusion of Technology and Human interaction.  I spent 28 months writing this album and I believe it deserves to be done right, utilizing the best possible resources I can and working with some of the best musicians I know.  This album is extremely important to me and I can't imagine releasing it any other way.  Your help to bring this vision to light will be greatly appreciated and I promise to deliver the best album I possible can.  Thank you for taking the time to visit this page and remember, every little bit helps... there is no donation to big or too small.  


Feel free to check out our previous releases here:  http://seventhcircle.bandcamp.com


Thank you!

Adam Pederson

Seventh Circle


The Impact

Without sounding too pretentious... I am a HUGE music lover and I believe that a great record can truly change someones life... many have changed mine... it is my sincere hope that my music can reach people and inspire them to create and to do amazing things... A "Pay it Forward" concept if you will.  I'm not saying my music will change the world, please understand that... I just want it to open peoples eyes and bring joy and inspiration to those who hear it.  At the very least... I want it to be heard by those who can enjoy it for what it is... my heart and my soul.


What We Need & What You Get

The Following is a breakdown of where the funds will be spent:


STUDIO MONITORS FOR MIXING  $        1,000.00
ADDITIONAL MUSICIANS FEES  $        1,000.00
COPYRIGHT / iTunes / Amazon  $           100.00
MANUFACTURING CDS  $        1,000.00
MISC MERCHANDISE (T-SHIRTS, STICKERS, ETC)  $        1,000.00
ENGINEER / PRODUCER  $        1,000.00
PROFESSIONAL MASTERING  $           900.00

If all the money is not raised, I will distribute what is raised to the most important aspects of the recording, making sure to utilize it the best way I can.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please post links to my campaign to Facebook, Twitter, Message Boards or any other media outlets you see fit.  Remember to use the "share tools" provided by IndieGoGo.

story:
The Couple

We, Raymond and Kim, are best friends, songwriters and a happily married couple whom has been graced to have a music ministry of our own inspired genre of 'Christian Love'. Our upcoming full CD project 'Love Defined' will incorporate songs illustrating a love relationship with God and in marriage with a little bit of jazz and poetry. We have a passion for singing together in assurance of traveling worldwide. The goal is to raise funds for the materials needed for a successful launch and career in music.


The Impact

We believe God has given us such a unique sound, flavor, style and chemistry of our own that immediately captures the hearts of listeners. We believe that spreading the message of God's abundant love and favor toward everyone through our music will have a major impact in their lives. If funds are not met, we will continue to believe things will work out for our good. There will not be any consequences on us nor others, because giving up is not an option. This is our passion!


What We Need & What You Get

The $25,000 will take care of the following: Paying our producer(s) for engineering, mixing and mastering our CD projects. The purchasing of the CDs, through Disc Makers. Marketing/Promotion through radio ads, internet radio, television ads and newspaper media outlets. Submission fees through gig sites (Sonicbids, Reverbnation, TAXI and NACA) and social networks, such as Facebook, to purchase adds. Sound equipment consisting of microphones, mic stands, speakers, monitors and a PA System. Establishing our own Band with background singers. New wardrobe specifically for concert performances and special appearances. Lastly, renting venues to do FREE concerts for promotional purposes. If we do not attain all the funds needed for this project, whatever the least amount we receive will be spent purchasing a few things on this list. However, it will still be a step closer toward our goal! Perks available: Shout-out on our Website, Facebook and Twitter pages. Download any song of your choice before our CD is released, CDs, t-shirts, mugs, magnets, hats, autographed photos, DINNER on us, and much much more!!


Other Ways You Can Help

Here are some of the other ways to help us: Share our campaign with your family and friends via word-of-mouth, Email, Facebook, Reverbnation, MySpace, Twitter and/or YouTube. Again, thank you so much in advance for your support, love and help in making our dreams become a reality! Grace & Peace to you!!!!!

story:
Hi everyone,
My name is Juli Burke and I have a radio program that highlights independent musicians and writers called "the Local Buzz".  It is heard on WBZH 1370 radio and wbzh.net four days a week.  I would like to increase the number of hours the station dedicates to these artists and in order to do it I need to pay for additional air time.  My goal is to create a promotional and marketing source for all indies to communicate to the rest of the world what they have.  In order to air 20 hours a week for 1 year I would need $208,000.00.  I am setting my goal for $100,000.00 to collect in 30 days so I can begin to work on some great promotional ideas that radio and the internet can deliver so these artists can become household names.  If you think that these people should get the recognition they deserve then I urge you to tell your friends and family to invest in the future of freedom of expression through music from your friends and neighbors in your own community.  Lets give them a platform to soar to popularity and continue to release great music.

story:
UPDATE!! - we're now going for $2,000!

Everyone has been sooooo generous, and we're in shock.

We'd like to be able to take any additional funds we get and have professional CD's made for sale at shows, record stores (if there are any left) and online at Amazon and CD Baby.

Spread the word and let's do this!


------ now back to our regularly scheduled programming ------


Our Story

We're Kate and Corey. We've been playing together for 9 months, and in that time have gone from making 300 dollars a month playing on the street to playing some of the most coveted shows in the WNY area (We're even playing the VIP tent for the Rascal Flatts and Brad Paisley shows at Darien Lake this Summer!)

Last year we quit our jobs, grabbed our guitars and headed out into the big scary world of full-time musicianship. We love it!

Our goal is to record an album, release it digitally at first, and then release physical CD's to sell at shows. 

If you are a subscriber to 'Kate and Corey Backstage' then you're probably already aware that we tried recording once already…and it didn't really work out (we won't get into all the details but it was unexpected and super rotten).  ANYWHO, after we discovered that those recordings would never be heard, we immediately started looking for solutions to find a way to get music to you guys (after all, we're full time musicians, so money isn't something we have much of) Crowd-funding/fan-contribution is where we landed. 

Before we just dove in, we decided to email our friends, family and subscribers explaining our predicament (as you just read above) and asked them 'would you be willing to participate?' if we decided to do a contributors project.  We were overwhelmed  with the amount of positive feedback and support that we got! Literally, one of the best feelings we ever felt. 

So now that we know there are lifesavers like yourself out there, we need your help.

But we're not going to just take a contribution and say "thanks". You get lots of different cool things in exchange for your contribution, and we'll use that money to make beautiful music and increase our fan base, so we all have new friends to hang out with at concerts and parties.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need:

  • We're shooting for $1,000. We could use more, but that's a comfortable goal for us. 
  • All the money we raise will go directly to recording studio costs.
  • If there is anything left over after paying for the studio time, the remaining funds will go toward manufacturing and marketing (we've learned how to make dollars stretch pretty far!)

What You Get:

  • We've come up with some pretty unique and exciting perks for you to enjoy after contributing

- House Concerts

- Your Own Theme Song

- We Make You Dinner!

- and a lot more

  • You also get to know that you've helped a couple of intensly passionate people get a little closer to their dreams. 


Other Ways You Can Help

In this crazy world, we know it's not always possible to part with hard-earned money. If you're not able to contribute financially, or just want to help us even more, you can:

  • Share this campaign on Facebook, twitter and wherever else you hang out
  • Send an email to your friends to get them on board
  • Bake us cookies?

Thanks in advance for helping us get started on the crazy journey ahead!

story:
Jenny and Our Needs

Jenny is a band that gets it.

Let us be transparent, honest and straight forward with you on why we need your help to raise $5000.

We have an opportunity afforded to few and we just can’t miss it. Joey Keithley of DOA and soon the provincial NDP party, has offered us the opportunity to release our record on his label, Sudden Death Records. For those of you who don’t know Joey, he is a punk rock legend and one of the few to survive and thrive in the Canadian Music industry. Just like in hockey, we believe strongly in having the right coach to get us to where we are going. Joey is that coach and we are excited to be part of the winning team.

           On the heels of our Sudden Death Records deal came Steve Kravac. Steve has produced and engineered bands such as Blink 182, Bad Religion, MXPX and many, many more. He is also a RIAA gold-certified producer, and a damn fine fellow. Steve has given us the amazing opportunity to come to his brand new studio on the outskirts of LA (Hell's Half Acre) and have him record, produce and mix our new album.
    Steve has also put us in front of Michael Hateley who is an award-winning audio mastering engineer. Past and present clients of Michael’s include artists such as Neil Young, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Eric Clapton, The Flaming Lips, Green Day, and many more. His work as a Mastering Engineer has sold over 50 million records worldwide.
           I know what you’re thinking, "why don’t you just ask the label to pay for your recording?" Well the simple answer is that a label is like a bank. Do you love your bank? Do you love paying massive amounts of interest on student loans or mortgages over an unknown number of years!? Well neither do we. We can’t make it on our own and we feel that $5000 is not an unreasonable amount of money to ask for if it can give us a real shot at making it to the main stage of North American music. We love and appreciate anything you can donate.
          
Check out a few reasons why we think we deserve this money.

First, we have amazing songs. We’re not here to reissue the flavor of the week, we’re writing timeless punk, folk and rock songs that have something to say across the entire spectrum of Love & Politics. Our lyrics do not preach but are a reflection of the society around us and our own experiences of life. We believe in asking questions about society, relationships and one’s place in the world. However, all this is delivered to the tune of fearless sing-along anthems. Our content aims towards those who live and die by the pen, the pint, and the curious mind, but there is a place in all hearts for this band.

Second, we live to entertain. Armed with guitars, sticks and amps, we cover nothing up and let our three part harmonies ring like victory bells. No costumes, no gimmicks, nothing to distract from the fact that we play amazing songs with all our hearts and give you all the energy that music, friendship and living has given us.

There are no words to describe our gratitude. We love and appreciate anything and everything you can donate. If we could repay you with the world we would, but alas we are but one of the flock. We have nothing to offer you but our pure love of life, distilled down into music. You are the grease by which our wheels keep us moving and our dreams keep coming true. Thank you from our heart of hearts.



Please share this page wherever you can. Email, FB, print it and mail it - be creative.
story_txt:
Jenny and Our NeedsJenny is a band that gets it. 
Let us be transparent, honest and straight forward with you on why we need your help to raise $5000.
We have an opportunity afforded to few and we just can’t miss it. Joey Keithley of DOA and soon the provincial NDP party, has offered us the opportunity to release our record on his label, Sudden Death Records. For those of you who don’t know Joey, he is a punk rock legend and one of the few to survive and thrive in the Canadian Music industry. Just like in hockey, we believe strongly in having the right coach to get us to where we are going. Joey is that coach and we are excited to be part of the winning team.
            On the heels of our Sudden Death Records deal came Steve Kravac. Steve has produced and engineered bands such as Blink 182, Bad Religion, MXPX and many, many more. He is also a RIAA gold-certified producer, and a damn fine fellow. Steve has given us the amazing opportunity to come to his brand new studio on the outskirts of LA (Hell's Half Acre) and have him record, produce and mix our new album.    Steve has also put us in front of Michael Hateley who is an award-winning audio mastering engineer. Past and present clients of Michael’s include artists such as Neil Young, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Eric Clapton, The Flaming Lips, Green Day, and many more. His work as a Mastering Engineer has sold over 50 million records worldwide.            I know what you’re thinking, "why don’t you just ask the label to pay for your recording?" Well the simple answer is that a label is like a bank. Do you love your bank? Do you love paying massive amounts of interest on student loans or mortgages over an unknown number of years!? Well neither do we. We can’t make it on our own and we feel that $5000 is not an unreasonable amount of money to ask for if it can give us a real shot at making it to the main stage of North American music. We love and appreciate anything you can donate.            Check out a few reasons why we think we deserve this money.
First, we have amazing songs. We’re not here to reissue the flavor of the week, we’re writing timeless punk, folk and rock songs that have something to say across the entire spectrum of Love & Politics. Our lyrics do not preach but are a reflection of the society around us and our own experiences of life. We believe in asking questions about society, relationships and one’s place in the world. However, all this is delivered to the tune of fearless sing-along anthems. Our content aims towards those who live and die by the pen, the pint, and the curious mind, but there is a place in all hearts for this band.
Second, we live to entertain. Armed with guitars, sticks and amps, we cover nothing up and let our three part harmonies ring like victory bells. No costumes, no gimmicks, nothing to distract from the fact that we play amazing songs with all our hearts and give you all the energy that music, friendship and living has given us.
There are no words to describe our gratitude. We love and appreciate anything and everything you can donate. If we could repay you with the world we would, but alas we are but one of the flock. We have nothing to offer you but our pure love of life, distilled down into music. You are the grease by which our wheels keep us moving and our dreams keep coming true. Thank you from our heart of hearts.
Please share this page wherever you can. Email, FB, print it and mail it - be creative.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Martha Cargo, and I am a freelance flutist in New York City. I had a zany idea about a year ago to commission 8 young composers (my "crazy eights," referencing a favorite childhood card game), and to not only perform 8 works in one performance in New York but to also bring half the program as a preview to my hometown of Columbia, Maryland.

Drake Ralph Andersen, my good friend and electronics wizard, will be flying in to run sound for the performance (Sunday, August 26th, 2012, at The Other Barn in the Village of Oakland Mills), which will feature premieres of solo flute works by Anne Goldberg, Mike Perdue, Jonah Rosenberg, and Drake himself: Drake is designing a unique responsive audio environment We are renting 6 speakers to fill the cavernous Other Barn space, and we will be getting a high-quality audio recording of the performance. 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:$500 to cover Drake's travel expenses, as well as the rental of the audio equipment for the electronics.

  • For a $10 donation, you will receive an mp3 download of a premiere of your choice from the performance;
  • For a $50 donation, you will receive a signed CD of the complete performance (composers and soloist!)
  • For a $100 donation, you will receive an insider's guide to a performer's life from Martha herself - exclusive access to a videoblog that chronicles her misfit adventures in the Big Apple!

The funds raised will go, 50-50, to renting the electronics and paying for Drake's travel. This show will happen with your support. 

The Impact

Not many professional musicians emerge victorious from our community. It feels right to bring my work home after a decade. This performance is part of my ongoing mission to promote and encourage new repertoire. As John Cage wisely wrote, "Contemporary music is not the music of the future nor the music of the past but simply music present with us: this moment, now, this now moment."

I have successfully raised funds with choreographer/composer Anne Goldberg towards our tuition as Emerging Artists in Residence at the Field; last fall, the group now known as Ensemble Sans Maître successfully funded our performance of Boulez's inimitable chamber work Le marteau sans maître. I am eternally grateful for the continued support of my family, friends, colleagues, and mentors in this ever-evolving hustle of a career that I have carved out for myself.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out and make some noise to help make this performance possible! Share on Twitter, Facebook, and every other source of social marketing that you can dream of!

story:
HELP ME MAKE THE MOST SENSATIONAL VIDEO OF THE 2012 CAMPAIGN SEASON!

In the satirical music video "Shake It Like an Etch-a-$ketch", Bree Newsome, the multi-award winning director of "WAKE" imagines Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney as a rapper who lays out his plan for America in a hilarious song that hits on every hot button topic of this year's presidential election! Play above video to hear the song!


HOW FUNDS WILL BE USED

I, Bree Newsome, have saved $1,000 of my own money for this project and now I'm asking friends, family, fans & kind strangers to help me acquire the remaining funding I need to turn the song I wrote into a music video. Money raised will be used to cover the costs of renting studio space, equipment, lights, props and costumes as well as for the purchase of make-up (and don't forget the accurate recreation of Mitt Romney's trademark hairdo!)

DONOR INCENTIVES

  • $5 or more -  Your name listed in the credits under the "Special Thanks" section and a hug & kiss from the director!
  • $10 or more -  All of the above, PLUS an invitation to act as background talent in the video!
  • $25 or more - All of the above, PLUS a mini poster of the "Shake It Like a Etch-a-Sketch" album cover signed by the director!
  • $50 or more - All of the above, PLUS a copy of the poster for "Wake", Bree Newsome's award-winning short film, signed by the director!
  • $120 or more - All of the above, PLUS a DVD copy of Bree Newsome's award-winning short film "Wake", signed by the director!
  • $250 or more - All of the above PLUS a signed copy of "Shake It Like an Etch-A-$ketch" on CD!
  • $500 or more - All of the above PLUS an invitation to a private screening of the video before its world release in NYC! (Those unable to attend private screening in NYC will receive early private access to the video online before its release to the public.)
  • $1000 or more - All of the above PLUS a signed copy of "Shake It Like a Etch-a-Sketch" music video on DVD, including a bonus feature section with a personalized thank you message!
  • $2000 or more - All of the above PLUS an invitation to a private dinner with the director during the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, NC this September!


PRODUCTION STATUS
"Shake It Like an Etch-A-$ketch" is currently in pre-production. I have cast an actor to portray Mitt Romney in the music video as well as background talent (extras). I'm now in the process of recording the final version of the song with a Mitt Romney voice impersonator and rehearsing the performance for the music video.

QUESTIONS? COMMENTS?
Feel free to contact Bree Newsome at bree.newsome@gmail.com

THANK YOU!
I'd like to give a huge thanks to you for taking time to visit this page and an even bigger thanks for your continued love and support! Remember, no donation is too small-- or too big! :) and any help is greatly appreciated! Also, please SPREAD THE WORD about this project & share the link to this page. My goal is not just to fund the project but to also have the final product seen by as many people as possible on YouTube. So now is a great time to start building buzz! Thanks again!

story:
WHO WE ARE

Rhythmo stands for Reaching & Helping Youth Through our Heritage in Music Organization. Rhythmo is dedicated to the preservation of Mariachi music as a folkloric art form.  Since its inception in 1996, Rhythmo has provided affordable music education to hundreds of children.  It is the longest running mariachi program for children of its kind in Orange County and has been featured in numerous articles and news stories in the OC Register, The Los Angeles Times, as well as ABC, NBC, Univision, and Telemundo.

 

THE FOUNDER

Maestro Gabriel Zavala founded Rhythmo Mariachi Academy.  He is one of Orange County’s most celebrated veterans of Mariachi music.  The man is a walking encyclopedia of Mexican-American history.  Zavala is originally from Guanajuato Mexico.  He began his mariachi career with his 7 brothers as “Los Hermanos Zavala” in the early 1960’s. Together they blazed trails for generations to come in ever-conservative Orange County. Twenty years later “Los Hermanos Zavala” disbanded but their passion and legacy lives on through Maestro Zavala’s Rhythmo Mariachi Academy.

 

WHAT WE NEED

Since 1996, Rhythmo Mariachi Academy has been taking students to the Tucson International Mariachi Conference.  The TIMC is a weeklong music workshop taught by the worlds premiere Mariachi groups.  Children from all over the country gather to learn from the most relevant mariachi musicians in the world.  For those not familiar with this genre, imagine being able to learn guitar and singing techniques from John Lennon, Paul Mc Cartney, etc.

 

Regretably, Rhythmo Mariachi Academy was not able to attend the conference last year.  The economic crisis has been especially hard on non-profit organizations such as Rhythmo Inc.  We are simply not able to afford the $10k needed to transport, house, feed, register up to 60 students. The mariachi kids are looking to YOU.

 

WHAT WE WILL DO

The money raised through Indie Go Go will go directly to pay for:

 

1               charter a bus from Anaheim, Ca. to Tucson Arizona (roundtrip)

2               pay for housing for up to 60 students (hotels)

3               pay the registration fees of $100 for each student.

4               Feed up to 60 students for 5 days.

5               Van rental once in Tucson for transportation from hotel to Conference every day.

In the event that we do not meet our goal, we will keep the money in a fund for next year or for one of Rhythmo’s many projects such a trip to San Diego, Catalina Island Etc.

THE IMPACT

Year after year we hear the same story.  Kids come to our program a little shy. -Unsure about the funny suit -Unsure about the music. Unsure about themselves.!  They learn the songs. They learn the instrument.  But its not until they make the “pilgrimage” to Tucson that they feel they are a part of something much bigger than their neighborhood.  Their entire demeanor changes and they come home eager to break out their violin, trumpet or guitar and start practicing so they can one day be as good as the master mariachi musicians they have admired and now personally know.  It strengthens their resolve to be somebody and feel good about themselves directly affecting the environment around them.  Many of our students have gone on to be professional musicians. At least two have gone on to be High School band directors.

THE PITCH

We have seen the far reach that Indie Go Go has in funding multi-million dollar projects.  Rhythmo only needs 10, 000 people to donate one dollar each to get these very deserving and talented kids of Rhythmo Mariachi Academy to Tucson.

HELP US GET THE WORD OUT!  Share this campaign with as many people as you can.  Please like it on facebook. Retweet on Twitter. EtC. 

 

For more info on Rhythmo Mariachi Academy please call 714-772-1185 or email OCmariachikids@gmail.com

 

Rhythmo Inc. is a 501 (C)(3) non profit public charity EIN 33-0951278

 

TESTIMONIALS

 

Cristina Ceja

Orchestral Musician/ Masters in Viola Solo Performance

from the Hochschüle für Musik und Tanz, Köln,

Rhythmo gave me my first initial experience with music.  Not only was it the first place where I was able to learn and play the violin, but it also gave me my first ensemble experience where I learned at an early age, the importance of  listening, playing, and singing together in a group.  As an active performer today, I am especially grateful for the performance experience that I received from Rhythmo Mariachi Academy, which showed me the importance of having great energy and stage presence in every concert i give.

 

The one quote that still sticks to me today is from Tio Gaby, (Maestro Zavala).  I was just getting started and could barely  hold the violin, but the principal direction that Tio Gaby gave me was, “Listen and watch.”  Thats all it really took, yet I am still learning that today.

 

I think that programs like Rhytmo are very important because it makes music accessible to all.  It encourages the youth as well as adults to appreciate and value culture, art and music. It gives anyone  the experience of creating something beautiful and  rich, while sharing it with the a wide range of audiences.

 

 

Kenya Garay

  UCLA Undergraduate Student of Ethnomusicology

 

I first heard of RHYTHMO through my mom in May of 2003.  She read an article about the program in the OC Register and asked if I wanted to join and play violin in RHYTHMO as well as being part of my middle school orchestra.  I gladly accepted not knowing I was going to stick with mariachi music for the rest of my life.

 

With the RHYTHMO Mariachi Academy, I now view mariachi music in a different mindset.  Mariachi music used to be just music my parents listened to from time to time.  Now it is practically the only music I play when I’m in my car.  Today, I expanded that passion into not only exploring more into the mariachi genre, but I am studying more about music of other cultures with my Ethnomusicology classes at UCLA.

 

I think the best experience I’ve ever had in the time I was with RHYTHMO was when I went to the Tucson International Mariachi Conference for the first time.  It opened my eyes to believing that there are youth out there in the United States that do exactly what I do.  Coming from a predominately Asian and White community, I was never exposed to sharing a common culture with anyone.  When I was at this conference I felt so connected with everyone there and loved that first networking experience and meeting new people.

 

It is important for programs like RHYTHMO to exist for the purpose of passing traditions on to younger generations.  It is also important because society needs to be informed that the United States is a melting pot and people come from all different backgrounds.  This is the reason why mariachi ensembles do not just exist in Mexico, they exist all over the world (even Japan!).

story:
Summary

We are Sophistafunk, an analog-soul trio from Syracuse, NY.  Adam plays the keyboards and sings; Emanuel plays the drums, sampler, and sings backup; and Jack is the MC, bringing inspirational and positive lyrics to the deep pocket grooves produced live on stage.  We represent Syracuse, NY and all young hard-working musicians.  Each year we perform more than 200 shows all over the US, and we will continue to do so with your help!

This campaign is crucial to our success because of several factors.  First off, we hope that the release of our new EP will engage our current fans with fresh music, as well as attract new listeners to our style of funk music.  Next, we found that in 2011 ALONE we spent upwards of $18,000 on fuel!  That's a ton of money going to the oil companies rather than our own livelihood.  Lastly, we want to take Sophistafunk to the next level by becoming an INTERNATIONALLY touring band.  This is a huge step for us, and we are confident that the people of the United Kingdom will appreciate what we have to offer.

You as contributors will help us achieve the unimaginable.  Most bands request $20k for a new van ALONE, but with this money we will pay for the recording, mixing, mastering, artwork, CD manufacturing, AND vinyl manufacturing of our new EP, "Freedom Is".  The funding will also afford us the diesel conversion van AND the installation of a kit to allow it to run on vegetable oil, saving us at least $15,000 per year in fuel costs!  We will also be able to pay for the 5'x8' trailer which will making touring safer and more comfortable.  And just to top it off, this $20k will even pay for round trip flights for the three of us to go to the UK and spread our music WORLDWIDE!

What We Need & What You Get

- New EP - $7,000

Once again we are working with our brother Jocko at MoreSound Studios in Syracuse, NY.  Jocko has been amazing to work with.  Effecient, creative, crazy-fun, and also an auxilliary percussion player on our albums!  Your contribution will pay for the recording, mixing, and mastering of our new EP titled "Freedom Is".

We will print 1,000 4-panel digipacks (CDs) of this new EP, as well as 500 180-gram 12" vinyl records.  Both with full-color artwork by our friend Jon Daly, who has also done the artwork for our debut EP, and our full-length "Twentyeleven".

----->  Perks include digital copies of the album, CDs, vinyl records, combo-packages

----->  LIMITED Perks include SIGNED copies of the CDs and vinyl!

- Diesel Tour Van - $3,800

The money we raise will pay for the purchase of Pat Sajak, our 1995 GMC Duravan 2500 DIESEL.  This van is amazing, sturdy, without rust, clean, and affordable.  Since it is diesel, it is the perfect candidate for the veggie-oil conversion, we'll get more into that in a second.

----->  LIMITED Perks include a once-in-a-lifetime tour with us in the fabulous Pat Sajak on any one of our 5-10 day tours in 2013/14.

- Vegetable Oil Conversion - $5,000

You may not know this, but ALL deisel engines are capable of running on vegetable oil!  Sam over at Full Circle Fuels is going to customize Pat Sajak (our van) to run on USED fryer oil. That's right! We can literally tour the United States in a van that runs on the same thing you deep fry your chicken in. To make it even more incredible, Adam (keyboards) owns Funk 'n Waffles, which is a waffle restaurant featured on Diner's Drive-ins and Dives on the Food Network. Funk 'n Waffles can provide enough "grease" for us to run our van for plenty of miles, let alone all the other restaurants and venues we play that can provide us with their waste-oil as well! 

Sam will install two additional fuel tanks for us to full with used vegetable oil.  Each tank will be filtered, and one will be brought to temp before the filtered oil goes into the engine compartment. We will get the same milage as regular diesel, and we will save at least $15,000 in fuel costs every year!!!

----->  LIMITED Perks include 10-50 orders of Chicken & Waffles @ Funk 'n Waffles.  Help us get the "grease" we need by buying multi-packs of that delicious meal you can't get anywhere else!

- 5'x8' Enclosed Trailer - $1,200

Our 5'x8' enclosed trailer is a crucial element in our touring rig.  First off, its about safety, and by keeping all our equipment in a trailer rather than in the van itself, the trailer ensures that if we ever get in a crash, we won't be injured by our own equipment!  Next, the trailer saves the van from unnecessary hauling of our gear on the shocks, struts, and chassy.  With the trailer, we also have enough room to grow as a band, allowing us space to put a full lighting rig and a larger PA if necessary.

----->  LIMITED Perks include a complimentary large furniture or similar moving job utilizing the spacious 5'x8' trailer you helped us purchase. We will travel up to 250 miles to move a piano, couch, anything you need that'll fit inside this beautiful trailer.

- UK Tour - $3,000

Our good friend Joe Driscoll has been living out in the UK for several years, bringing the hot and heavy Syracuse funk to the ears of the United Kingdom for some time. In August of this summer we plan to take our new EP WORLDWIDE by joining Joe & Sekou as they tour the UK on the way to Shambala Festival.  We will be performing with them the whole way and at the festival itself. This last $3k will go to the three round-trip flights from JFK to Heathrow airport in London.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If we don't reach our goal, we will use the majority of the funds to pay for the production of the CD and Vinyl as well as the studio time.  If there's enough to cover the expense of purchasing the van and trailer we will apply it there.  We hope to cover everything, which is why we are being very thrifty with this $20,000.  You can look around and see that many bands spend $20k on one album alone, or one van alone.  But our fundraiser will cover a van, trailer, conversion to vegetable oil, studio time, CDs, vinyl, and a trip to the UK.  You will not find this value in any other BAND-oriented fundraiser!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribule even $5, you can still help us by spreading the word about this campaign.  Getting the word out is everything.  Email and Facebook are both great ways to spread the word, and anything helps!

THANK YOU !!!

-Sophistafunk
story_txt:
Summary
We are Sophistafunk, an analog-soul trio from Syracuse, NY.  Adam plays the keyboards and sings; Emanuel plays the drums, sampler, and sings backup; and Jack is the MC, bringing inspirational and positive lyrics to the deep pocket grooves produced live on stage.  We represent Syracuse, NY and all young hard-working musicians.  Each year we perform more than 200 shows all over the US, and we will continue to do so with your help!
This campaign is crucial to our success because of several factors.  First off, we hope that the release of our new EP will engage our current fans with fresh music, as well as attract new listeners to our style of funk music.  Next, we found that in 2011 ALONE we spent upwards of $18,000 on fuel!  That's a ton of money going to the oil companies rather than our own livelihood.  Lastly, we want to take Sophistafunk to the next level by becoming an INTERNATIONALLY touring band.  This is a huge step for us, and we are confident that the people of the United Kingdom will appreciate what we have to offer.
You as contributors will help us achieve the unimaginable.  Most bands request $20k for a new van ALONE, but with this money we will pay for the recording, mixing, mastering, artwork, CD manufacturing, AND vinyl manufacturing of our new EP, "Freedom Is".  The funding will also afford us the diesel conversion van AND the installation of a kit to allow it to run on vegetable oil, saving us at least $15,000 per year in fuel costs!  We will also be able to pay for the 5'x8' trailer which will making touring safer and more comfortable.  And just to top it off, this $20k will even pay for round trip flights for the three of us to go to the UK and spread our music WORLDWIDE!


What We Need & What You Get
- New EP - $7,000
Once again we are working with our brother Jocko at MoreSound Studios in Syracuse, NY.  Jocko has been amazing to work with.  Effecient, creative, crazy-fun, and also an auxilliary percussion player on our albums!  Your contribution will pay for the recording, mixing, and mastering of our new EP titled "Freedom Is".
We will print 1,000 4-panel digipacks (CDs) of this new EP, as well as 500 180-gram 12" vinyl records.  Both with full-color artwork by our friend Jon Daly, who has also done the artwork for our debut EP, and our full-length "Twentyeleven".

story:
Short Summary

Help Me to Inspire Hope Through Music

Instead of having a huge party and family and friends come from all around to celebrate me on my birthday, I want to make this birthday count for SOMETHING GREATER than myself. My plan is to celebrate this gift of another year by doing a live recording and sharing this wonderful night of music with the world. 

The focus for my live recording is HOPE!  My desire is to partner with you to create an album that gives hope to the hopeless and inspires people to live better lives.

Every song on this new album will feature a message of HOPE. 

HOPE that will cause each listener to believe that if they refuse to quit, they win!  If they trust God and believe that they will have better days, He will cause them to triumph in every area of life! 

What We Need and What You Get

We are now in the process of preparing for recording this ONE AMAZING night of music. With your help this live recording can be accomplished.

We need your LOVE.  We need your PRAYERS. We need YOU TO PARTNER WITH US BY SUPPORTING THIS PROJECT FINANCIALLY.

Our goal is $40K in 45 days.  The pledges that we receive will be used for expenses incurred in connection with the live recording.  Anything received in excess of our goal will be used for mixing, mastering, marketing and all of the other requirements that go into bringing an album to market.

Everyone can participate. No pledge is too small.  At each level of pledging, we have prepared a special reward just for you!

Thank you for your love. Thank you for your prayers. Thank you for your support. I know that we can meet and even exceed our goal. 

The plan is SIMPLE.

I partner with you. You partner with me. WE BRING HOPE TO THE HOPELESS!

Let's do this together!

PS. Help me get the word out by sharing information about my campaign with your family, friends, coworkers, neighbors, everyone. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Music has always been important to each one of us. Through it we've been changed for the better. Music has given us safety, hope, and inspiration, and recently we've been handed a beautiful chance to extend that safety, hope, and inspiration to others through our own music. We're asking for your help in putting out an album that is shaping up to be the product of all of our struggles, abilities, and love.

Why are we asking for your help? Simply put, recording is expensive. Printing merch is expensive. Gas is expensive. We need a boost to overcome some of the production costs involved in making a full length record from start to finish.

Disguise the Silence has had a great year so far, and it has all been thanks to the love and support of our local music scene. We aim to do justice to the love you've shown.

What We Need & What You Get

We're shooting for a goal of 2,000 dollars.

This should help us cover the costs of printing and distributing CDs and merch related to the CD release, and perhaps some travel and production expenses for the CD release show(s). We're taking on the costs of recording ourselves, as we know that sometimes asking a little is still asking a lot, and we want to make our goal so that we can honor those that donate with a successful release. 

We also want to give as much back to you as you've given us.

This means we'll be placing heavy emphasis on getting you involved with the process of making the album, whether that be by simply giving those that can't contribute much an early digital release all the way through bringing you into the studio with us or playing a private show for you. We'll also be printing CDs, exclusive t-shirts, and making all sorts of other goodies available to you (free tickets, demos, and so much more). 

If we find ourselves falling short of our goal, indiegogo's flexfunding will allow us to keep what we raise, which we will still put towards the album and release party. We will do our absolute best to make sure every contributor receives the perks that fall into their bracket of contribution.

The Impact

The beauty of the independent music scene is that its growing! We as a band don't have to wait around for our one in a million shot at a major record deal. Still the only way bands become successful independently is through community effort. 

By contributing to the creation of this record, it is effectively yours. The music is yours, the message is yours, the love that we wrap it in is yours. Disguise the Silence has never shied away from an opportunity to be outspoken about our passions, our struggles, and most importantly about building each other up through love and encouragement. We will do our best to continue down this path, and we'd be honored to have you as a part of it! 

We will continue to play benefit shows. We want you at them. We will continue to write music challenging the structure of our society in hopes of making it better. Your thoughts are valuable to us. Let's make something beautiful together.

Risks & Challenges

While we have a lot of experience recording collectively as a young band, we've never attempted an endeavor this big before.

As it currently stands we're shooting to release a full-length record of about twelve songs, collectively broken up into four sections that are each themed differently. We're not set on making a concept album, as over the process of writing and deciding what ideas to keep as a band, we'd like to stay open to the opportunity to change things for the better. That said our writing is shaping itself thematically as of now and we're eager to try and take the risk of making a cohesive album that functions as a singular dialogue rather than just a collection of random songs. 

This album is going to take a couple months minimum to make, which will most certainly be emotionally and financially stressful, but the four of us feel ready and couldn't be more excited to try.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is hard. We understand that completely, which is why we'd still love to have you involved if you can't spare any cash. 

Please share our campaign, our music, our videos, and our show dates on all of your social networks. Word of mouth is extremely important in helping a band get on its feet without the use of the manipulative and finely tuned marketing machines like those available to major record labels. 

Please consider talking to your friends about pitching together to help as well! If two friends can donate $5 each, it would still mean the world to us, and we'd have no issues with sending you a digital copy of the album when its finished so you can burn it for each-other. 

If you've read this far, thank you so much for your time and we look forward to working with you! 

Love, 

Zach, Michael, Jake, and Dan

story:
WE'VE BEEN FUNDED!!

We reached our minimum funding goal, this is happening!! Thanks to everyone who made this possible, we love you all!

Hey There!

Hi! I’m Shem, and you’ve probably already seen that i’m trying to make my dreams of a physical release of my music come true! First, let me tell you a little bit about myself:

I started experimenting with music in about 2008 with the introductions and prolificness of musicians like Deadmau5, Kill the Noise, and Kaskade. I started writing melodies and producing sounds over and over until I achieved the sound I wished to achieve, and that came with hard work and practice. In mid-2014, with the release of my album "Noir" and the well received track "Answer Me", my hard work paid off when I achieved 1.3k followers on SoundCloud, live shows scattered around the state of Oklahoma, and most of all, the betterment of his work. I continue to write music and perform whenever I get the chance, and someday wish to share my art everywhere under our earth's satellite.


There has come a time where I think my music and performance skill has gotten to the point of sharing it in a physical form - and this is where I need a hand.

How You Can Help

In order to complete this project, I’m going to need the funds to support the venture as a whole. If you decide to contribute, this is what you’re going to help us give to the world:


  • CD duplication, which includes burning, printing the design on the CD, and packaging in jackets and mailers

  • Worldwide distribution in stores like iTunes, Amazon, and more

  • Performance expenses and more CDs replication for the future


The Impact

I haven’t really done anything like this before, so this is both a learning experience and a potential blessing to my musical journey. I hope to impact you with multiple genres of music and make you feel about what I’m feeling - that’s my overall goal in all of this.

The Struggle

The fact that this is fixed funding should eliminate the financial risk for both of us - You’ll get your money back indefinitely if we don’t reach our financial goal. The music will always be with us, and that, I believe, should be the true focus.


Other Ways You Can Help


Even the smallest donation helps a lot. Even if you don’t or can't donate, I thank you for the time you’ve spent reading and evaluating my situation.


Spreading the word about this Indiegogo campaign will help me immensely - even visiting my Soundcloud and checking out a couple of the tunes would mean the world to me. Maybe even stop by my Facebook or Twitter, I'm always around and love to talk to my fans. Thanks for stopping by, and I cant wait to see you in the future!!


Regards,

Shem (‘v’)


Oh, and here's a little preview of the album;

story: An hour-long rock radio show and the avenue for the rock life with music offered by a human mind and voice that shares opinions and thinks for himself. The compelling storyline show about the difficult musical journeys in life, the current state of upheaval in the music industry, and the stories of lunacy, hell broken loose, and the frenzied exhilaration. You'll shake your head in disbelief, and you'll definitely laugh. You might even cry. This is the rock life.

The compelling storyline show about the difficult musical journeys in life, the current state of upheaval in the music industry, and the stories of lunacy, hell broken loose, and the frenzied exhilaration. story:
LIL' RED & THE ROOSTER BIO

The contagiously charming international duo Lil’ Red & the Rooster create electric band blues in a roots blues format. Touching and refreshing with a bit of humor, their originals bring the 40’s and 50’s blues and rhythm & blues into the present day. Ohio, USA native Jennifer Milligan, with 35 years of experience, sings as an authentic storyteller while holding down the rhythm with a snare shuffle or washboard scratch. Award winning French blues guitarist Pascal Fouquet shines in this intimate setting where you can hear every nuance of his 40 years’ of experience. They’re warm and inviting and their music is inspired and innovative. Blues with a spirit full of hope and joy may inspire you to get up and boogie!

Short Summary

"It's been French blues man Pascal Fouquet's dream to compete in the Memphis International Blues Challenge and I'm using all of my American "Yes We Can!" ingenuity to make it happen! We would greatly appreciate any support you can give to make this well deserved dream come true for one of France's leading blues guitarists. Its time all his years of experience and hard work are heard in the Home of Blues!" ~Lil' Red

   

BACK STORY

"It all started when I stumbled into a Jazz club in Paris where Pascal was scratchin' on his guitar. It was love at first sight, followed by a complicated and challenging "French Romantic Comedy" scenario.  Our duo was created from a desire to play in my home town on family visits. January 2014, Craig Tuthill & Deborah Rogers from the Columbus Blues Alliance wandered by Java Central, heard us playing and encouraged us to compete in the Columbus Blues Challenge on Sept. 28th. Our challenge began before the challenge. We were already booked to play the Volcanic Blues Festival in the center of France Sept. 25th & 26th, but we decided to go for it! After our gig Friday night we drove 6 hours back home to change our luggage just in time to catch the Saturday morning train to Paris, then boarded the plane to the USA. We arrived in Columbus at 10pm, performed in the Challenge on Sunday at 1:30pm, and won! Whoosh. Breath. Ok ... now Memphis! Go!" ~Lil' Red

What We Need

Plane, train, automobile, hotel and food are expensive on a Blues duo's income. Funding our auto-production CD and an extra USA visit have tapped us dry. We are humbly asking for your support. Be a part of our adventure!

I've estimated our expenses at $3,000, including airfare from France, car rental and gas, 5 nights in a hotel and 3 very modest meals a day.

All money raised will go toward expenses (NOT whiskey!) whether we reach our goal or not. Every little bit helps.

Any additional money raised will go towards promotional materials and our next all originals CD!!!!  Whoo-hoo!

We respect how hard people work for their money and if you are inspired to support us in our artistic efforts we will use it respectfully to support the blues tradition. 

The Impact

Besides being a dream come true, this is an incredible opportunity for us to be seen by the music industry. Making contacts can lead to bookings in festivals all over the world. Pascal's been playing the European blues festival circuit for years. This is an opportunity to broaden to the American Blues scene.

We've chosen a fragile profession. For us, it's not about "making it big", it's about continuing our lives as professional musicians and sharing our music with those who want to listen.

Risks & Challenges

Life is circumstance & consequence balanced with eternal beauty. We'll find our way.

Other Ways You Can Help

We certainly understand that most of our friends are in the same financial situation. Lol! However, there are those whose gift in life is making money and who love to support the arts. If your gift is not gold spinning, you can support us by spreading the word!!! Simply sharing our campaign is a great gift! 


               BIOS

              

               PASCAL FOUQUET

“… guitarist to the end game, nuanced, actually in a state of grace …” Soul Bag Magazine 2001

This blues man got his start playing classical guitar at the age of 11 on a farm in Normandy. Five years later when BB Kingʼs “Blues Is King” reached his ears, his focus changed to Blues. From there he became one of the most recognized Blues guitarists in France! This extraordinary soloist integrates the Blues of the 40's & 50's with contemporary blues to create his own unique sound and style. In his 40 year career, he has won several awards for best soloist, played with Ze Bluetones, The Hoodoomen, Drew Davies Rhythm Combo & The Boogiematics and shared the stage with many recognized American Blues artists like Diunna Greenleaf, Sax Gordon, Sean Costello, Alex Schultz, Kid Ramos, Kenny “Blues Boss” Wayne, Mike Sanchez, Ricky Nye, Sean Carney and Candye Kane. He remains ever true to his favorite guitar masters, T-Bone Walker, Tiny Grimes, & Charlie Christian.

           

            JENNIFER MILLIGAN

“ … diva voice that walks voluptuously from Bessie Smith to Janis Joplin crossing without a hitch tonalities and eras always sounding the most sincere and accurate possible.” Fred Delforge 2014

A veteran of the stage this multi-talented singer/songwriter has touched the hearts of hundreds of thousands internationally on stage, screen and recording. Her magnetic presence, exuberant energy and genuine smile bring a warm authentic charm to the blues scene. With her bed as a stage and hairbrush for microphone, she started singing at the age of 6 accompanied by her motherʼs 45s on her Mickey Mouse turntable.  By the age of 11 her bed was replaced by a stage and by 22 she was touring the country as the lead in the National tour of "Hair" with the acclaimed percussionist from Santana, Michael Benthien. In her professional career she has performed in and or choreographed more productions than years she has lived, sharing the stage with many recognized music artists including Dennis DeYoung (Styxx), Carl Anderson, Ted Neeley, Michelle Horsefield, Gary Carney, Drew Davies, Ricky Nye and Eileen Howard. With every note she wishes to thank Ella, & Etta, with every word Shakespeare & Tom Waits, and with every rhythm T-Bone & Luigi.
story_txt:
LIL' RED & THE ROOSTER BIO
The contagiously charming
international duo Lil’ Red & the Rooster create electric band blues in a roots
blues format. Touching and refreshing with a bit of humor, their originals bring
the 40’s and 50’s blues and rhythm & blues into the present day. Ohio, USA native
Jennifer Milligan, with 35 years of experience, sings as an authentic storyteller
while holding down the rhythm with a snare shuffle or washboard scratch. Award
winning French blues guitarist Pascal Fouquet shines in this intimate setting
where you can hear every nuance of his 40 years’ of experience. They’re warm and
inviting and their music is inspired and innovative. Blues with a spirit full
of hope and joy may inspire you to get up and boogie!


Short Summary


"It's been French blues man Pascal Fouquet's dream to compete in the Memphis International Blues Challenge and I'm using all of my American "Yes We Can!" ingenuity to make it happen! We would greatly appreciate any support you can give to make this well deserved dream come true for one of France's leading blues guitarists. Its time all his years of experience and hard work are heard in the Home of Blues!" ~Lil' Red
   
BACK STORY
"It all started when I stumbled into a Jazz club in Paris where Pascal was scratchin' on his guitar. It was love at first sight, followed by a complicated and challenging "French Romantic Comedy" scenario.  Our duo was created from a desire to play in my home town on family visits. January 2014, Craig Tuthill & Deborah Rogers from the Columbus Blues Alliance wandered by Java Central, heard us playing and encouraged us to compete in the Columbus Blues Challenge on Sept. 28th. Our challenge began before the challenge. We were already booked to play the Volcanic Blues Festival in the center of France Sept. 25th & 26th, but we decided to go for it! After our gig Friday night we drove 6 hours back home to change our luggage just in time to catch the Saturday morning train to Paris, then boarded the plane to the USA. We arrived in Columbus at 10pm, performed in the Challenge on Sunday at 1:30pm, and won! Whoosh. Breath. Ok ... now Memphis! Go!" ~Lil' Red
  

What We Need
 Plane, train, automobile, hotel and food are expensive on a Blues duo's income. Funding our auto-production CD and an extra USA visit have tapped us dry. We are humbly asking for your support. Be a part of our adventure!
I've estimated our expenses at $3,000, including airfare from France, car rental and gas, 5 nights in a hotel and 3 very modest meals a day. 
All money raised will go toward expenses (NOT whiskey!) whether we reach our goal or not. Every little bit helps. 
Any additional money raised will go towards promotional materials and our next all originals CD!!!!  Whoo-hoo! 
We respect how hard people work for their money and if you are inspired to support us in our artistic efforts we will use it respectfully to support the blues tradition. 
 


The ImpactBesides being a dream come true, this is an incredible opportunity for us to be seen by the music industry. Making contacts can lead to bookings in festivals all over the world. Pascal's been playing the European blues festival circuit for years. This is an opportunity to broaden to the American Blues scene. We've chosen a fragile profession. For us, it's not about "making it big", it's about continuing our lives as professional musicians and sharing our music with those who want to listen. 
 
Risks & ChallengesLife is circumstance & consequence balanced with eternal beauty. We'll find our way. 
 


Other Ways You Can HelpWe certainly understand that most of our friends are in the same financial situation. Lol! However, there are those whose gift in life is making money and who love to support the arts. If your gift is not gold spinning, you can support us by spreading the word!!! Simply sharing our campaign is a great gift!

story:
Ars Futura

IS a new music group comprised of mixed wind, string, and keyboard instruments. Our goal is to provide the opportunity for collaboration between composers and Ars Futura performers. We hope to redefine the concert experience of new music to the public, dissolving the boundaries between the performers and audience members. The main goal of Ars Futura is to perform and commission new music. In order for our art form to continue evolving, we believe that we must advocate the invention and performance of new compositions.

Ars Futura is founded and directed by pianist Shuai Wang, who received her doctoral degree from the Cleveland Institute of Music (Piano, CIM). Other musicians in the ensemble include Madeline Lucas (Masters in Flute, CIM), Carlos Javier (Masters in Cello, CIM), Emily Cornelius (Masters in Violin, New England Conservatory) and Hyunsoo Kim (Masters in Piano, CIM).

Ars Futura needs your support for an exciting upcoming project. In January and February, the group will embark on a four-city tour, performing newly-commissioned works by five living composers:

-Keith Fitch, Head of composition, Cleveland Institute of Music, http://keithfitch.com

-Joseph Hallman, Adjunct faculty, Drexel University, Composer-in-Residence,        Rosenbach Museum (Philadelphia) , https://www.facebook.com/HallmanComposer

-Marshall Griffith, Faculty of Theory, Cleveland Institute of Music , http://www.cim.edu/conservatory/bios.php?id=65

-Tim Mauthe, Visiting faculty of composition and theory, College of William and Mary, http://www.mauthemusic.com  

-Eric Charnofsky, 2012 Ohio Music Teachers Association "Composer of the Year", http://music.case.edu/personnel/lecturers/eric-charnofsky

 

This project will allow us to commission three brand-new works by composer Joseph Hallman in Philadelphia, to conduct workshops and perform with the Baltimore Symphony’s ORCHkids program, and to collaborate with the Classical Revolution Baltimore and Classical Revolution Pittsburgh.

 

What We Need 

Please help to make Ars Futura’s first project a success! Funding is urgently needed for commissions, performance venues, and live-recording equipment. Your generous donations also cover musicians’ pay, transportation, and lodging expenses.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • TELL your friends and family about us, and make some noise about our campaign.
