story:
I'm Hugh  I write, record and release music under the name Huetensil.  I'm also lead singer and guitarist for the rock band, Question of Honour.  I've been a musician for over three decades.  Creating music has been something that I've done for most of my life.  It's hard work, fun and challenging.  It's my passion and I'm fairly certain that I'll be doing it right to the end.  :) 

I'm finishing up work on my first full length album as Huetensil.  I'm extremely excited for people to hear it, but I need your help.  In order to ensure that as many people as possible get to hear my new songs, I want to promote them to internet and terrestrial radio.  I've had some success with this in the past.  For me to be effective though, I need some tools that will help me keep track of who's playing my songs.

That's where you come in.  With the help of your contributions, I'll be able to pay for those tools and they will help make me more effective.  Ultimately, this means more people will hear my songs.  Please take a few minutes and contribute whatever you can afford to help meet my goal.  I've included a few incentives for you, so check them out and thank you very much.

 

The Tracking Tools

The money that you contribute will allow me to subscribe to CMJ:  New Music Report, Radio Wave Monitor and/or other similar services.  I still haven't decided which one I'm going to use.  I may get to use a combination, depending on how far beyond the goal we get.

CMJ publishes a weekly magazine that lists the charts for each of the radio stations that report to it along with contact information for those stations.  They cover mostly terrestrial college radio stations in the U.S.

Radio Wave works a little differently.  They have a system which tracks each play of an individual song on each station that they monitor.  Their focus is primarily on internet stations but because many terrestrial commercial stations stream on-line their stats are added to the mix.  They monitor well over 1,800 stations.  They also provide contact information for the stations that they monitor and an avenue for distributing music to those stations.  


Risks & Challenges

There are no guarantees that, with these tools, I'll be able to get even one radio station to air my songs.  However, I've done this several times before and I have never failed to get at least a few.  In fact, every major release that I've been involved with has charted for at least a week on several stations.  I want these tools because stations will often air songs and not tell the artist!

 

Other Ways That You Can Help

I know that not everyone will be able to help financially, but that doesn't mean that you can't help me reach my goal.  You can still help by getting the word out and making some noise about my campaign and my new album:

  • Talk about my music and this campaign with your friends in person and on your social networks.
  • Don't forget to use the IndieGoGo share tools!
  • Tell me about radio stations/shows/podcasts that you listen to that my music might be right for.  Even more help if you know who and how to contact them.  Even, even better if you know them personally and are willing to make an introduction!  :)
  • Tell me about music blogs/papers/zines that you read that might review and/or feature my music.  Even more help if you know who and how to contact them.  Even, even better if you know them personally and are willing to make an introduction!  :)

story:
KEZIA WHO?

Hi Crowdfunders, what's up?

We are Kezia, an Italian band which is trying to raise some funds to print and promote our  first album, “The Dirty Affair”.

   


We like to define our genre "prop-metal", 'cause we like to merge the classical progressive sonorities with the freshness and lighthearted flavour of pop-rock music.

The themes we deal with inside our songs are often ironic, desecrating and even embarrassing, but mainly we try to paint metaphors of life.

WHY INDIEGOGO?

We decided to ask you an aid 'cause we believe it's important to have some feedback about our art and, above all, we're very proud of the idea to directly involve our potential fans into the promotion of our first record. 

This campaign will also allow us to spread our music out of national borders and to meet a lot of brand new friends.

     

   

The funds we'll try to raise will be used for the following outgoings:

                          


ABOUT THE ALBUM...

Here’s the album’s track list with a short theme’s description:

1)  Before I Leave: due to the global economic crisis a sad cat comes to a tragic decision...

2)  Ebola: a hungry man and his turtle...

3)  The Dirty Affair (Between Pelican and Bear): it’s not just another silly love song, it's an ode to a different type of beauty.

4)  Sneakers: the real story of Roy Sullivan, the Ranger with the gift of immortality.

5)  Barabba Son’s Song: Everyone remembers Jesus but nobody talks 'bout Barabba.

6)  Quendo: ...and what if a pub in a small town was a gateway to hell?

7)  Preludio: Just a moment of peace.

8)  Treesome: The recurring nightmare of a young teenager. Just a botany issue?

Up ahead you'll find a youtube link where you could listen a short preview of each song. 

    


This gonna be the album's cover:

PERKS?YES THANKS

If you join our family we'll give in exchange some cool exclusive gadgets...You can even join us for a cozy dinner, obviously cooked by us (don't be scared and trust us, we're italian).



 We're curious to know if you're curious!
 

SUPPORT KEZIA and you won't regret!


Kezia - Facebook Page -

Kezia - Youtube Channel

Kezia - Soundcloud

story:
[Update 2: 5 hours left!!]

[BONUS #2: Bryan, the illustrator who designed the album covers for both EndGame and The Missing, has just told me that he will "TOTALLY DRAW AN AWESOME DRAWING for whoever gets it over $1234"!

That's right, everybody.  So, say the current total is $1233, and you donate JUST ONE DOLLAR, you would totally get some awesome artwork from Bryan.  And to illustrate the quality of his work, I now present to you the unedited album covers*:


EndGame


The Missing

(*Note that I am still working on the final CD artforms, with text and liner notes.)

In summary, if we somehow reach the $1234 goal, two things will happen:

1) I will draw one MPK Adventures webcomic and publish it before 2013
2) The one person who breaks the $1234 goal will receive an awesome drawing from Bryan

Sooo close to $1234 you guys!!!]

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Update 1: 7 hours left!!]

[BONUS #1:  If I reach my goal of $1234, I will draw and publish one MPK Adventures webcomic before 2013!  The last time I drew a webcomic, it was on 2008, and you can view it here:

MPK Adventures | ep.31 - An afternoon lunch

So please tell your friends and help me reach my goal before it's too late!!]

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

O HAI

Hi, I'm George Ryan Perez, singer/songwriter for the Gainesville, FL indie-punk band Murphee K, and I am happy to announce that I'm releasing not just one but 2 music CDs!

Niiiiiice!  Could you plz tell me about the 1st CD you're releasing?

The first CD I am releasing is the one I made with Craig, Peter, and Matt, and it's called The Missing.  It has 7 songs and it was recorded in 2004 (then mixed in Aug 2005) from Goldentone Studios.  If you like catchy punk tunes that make you want to dance and hug your friends, then this CD is for you!  And OK there may be some parts in there that could induce crying spells, so anyway FAIR WARNING.

[I want to take a second here to address Craig, Peter, and Matt.  Guys if you are reading this, thank you.  I wanted to dedicate this to you all because of the work you've put into this, and I wanted to finally give it a proper release.]

Cool story, bro, but what about the 2nd CD?

The second CD I am releasing is the one I made with Chris and Shuhei this summer 2012, and it's called EndGame.  This CD contains 3 songs, each of which tries to improve upon every song from The Missing on every aspect imaginable.  (The key word here is "try".)  A couple of songs are also garnished with samples from video game music, which -- as some of you know -- I am quite fanatic about.

[Chris and Shuhei -- thank you for investing your time and effort into this, you both are top notch.]

Like, whoa, I'd like to be a part of this.  How can I help?

So, ho-kay, let's talk about you.  You, dear reader, could be part of my journey of releasing both CDs simply by contributing to this fundraiser.  (Check out the perks on the side to see what cool things you'd get as a contributer.)  In return, I will judiciously use the funds to do five things:

1) Pay the costs of the cover art designs

2) Order a press run of both CDs

3) Sell the CDs to awesome people like you directly (via the band website) or indirectly through iTunes or other online services

4) Use whatever is left to make T-shirts, stickers, or other merchandise

5) [BONUS] Donate 100% of the proceeds made from the first CD's first press run to a local Gainesville, FL organization

Oooh, what's this donation thingy you're doing?

I just told you!  OK, OK, one more time:  all the proceeds from The Missing's first pressing will be donated to one local Gainesville, FL organization.  This means that once I start selling The Missing (the first CD), 100% of the proceeds that I make from its sales during the first run will go to charity.

As of this writing, I am still working on which organization that is, and I'm leaning towards either the Civic Media Center or the H.O.M.E. Van since I've had dealings with them in the past, but if you have any other suggestions, feel free to contact me.  And if you would like some more clarification regarding this donation, please contact me as well. (Email is the best way to contact me: murpheek at gmail dot com.)

Well sir, this sounds pretty cool!

Why thank you, random gal or guy, and thank you for visiting my campaign and reading this!  And please forward this to anyone who would want to be part of this too!  (The links for forwarding are located right below the video.)

If you'd like to hear samples from The Missing (and maybe EndGame), you can do so by going to the band website.  Lastly, let's stay in touch by visiting the following websites:

murphee-k.com/music.asp (music samples)
facebook.com/pages/Murphee-K/7375406038
myspace.com/murpheek
twitter.com/MurpheeK
twitter.com/gpmpk
story_txt:
[Update 2: 5 hours left!!]
[BONUS #2: Bryan, the illustrator who designed the album covers for both EndGame and The Missing, has just told me that he will "TOTALLY DRAW AN AWESOME DRAWING for whoever gets it over $1234"!That's right, everybody.  So, say the current total is $1233, and you donate JUST ONE DOLLAR, you would totally get some awesome artwork from Bryan.  And to illustrate the quality of his work, I now present to you the unedited album covers*:EndGameThe Missing(*Note that I am still working on the final CD artforms, with text and liner notes.)In summary, if we somehow reach the $1234 goal, two things will happen:1) I will draw one MPK Adventures webcomic and publish it before 20132) The one person who breaks the $1234 goal will receive an awesome drawing from BryanSooo close to $1234 you guys!!!]-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[Update 1: 7 hours left!!]
[BONUS #1:  If I reach my goal of $1234, I will draw and publish one MPK Adventures webcomic before 2013!  The last time I drew a webcomic, it was on 2008, and you can view it here:MPK Adventures | ep.31 - An afternoon lunchSo please tell your friends and help me reach my goal before it's too late!!]
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
O HAI
Hi, I'm George Ryan Perez, singer/songwriter for the Gainesville, FL indie-punk band Murphee K, and I am happy to announce that I'm releasing not just one but 2 music CDs!
Niiiiiice!  Could you plz tell me about the 1st CD you're releasing?
The first CD I am releasing is the one I made with Craig, Peter, and Matt, and it's called The Missing.  It has 7 songs and it was recorded in 2004 (then mixed in Aug 2005) from Goldentone Studios.  If you like catchy punk tunes that make you want to dance and hug your friends, then this CD is for you!  And OK there may be some parts in there that could induce crying spells, so anyway FAIR WARNING.[I want to take a second here to address Craig, Peter, and Matt.  Guys if you are reading this, thank you.  I wanted to dedicate this to you all because of the work you've put into this, and I wanted to finally give it a proper release.]
Cool story, bro, but what about the 2nd CD?
The second CD I am releasing is the one I made with Chris and Shuhei this summer 2012, and it's called EndGame.  This CD contains 3 songs, each of which tries to improve upon every song from The Missing on every aspect imaginable.  (The key word here is "try".)  A couple of songs are also garnished with samples from video game music, which -- as some of you know -- I am quite fanatic about.[Chris and Shuhei -- thank you for investing your time and effort into this, you both are top notch.]
Like, whoa, I'd like to be a part of this.  How can I help?
So, ho-kay, let's talk about you.  You, dear reader, could be part of my journey of releasing both CDs simply by contributing to this fundraiser.  (Check out the perks on the side to see what cool things you'd get as a contributer.)  In return, I will judiciously use the funds to do five things:1) Pay the costs of the cover art designs2) Order a press run of both CDs3) Sell the CDs to awesome people like you directly (via the band website) or indirectly through iTunes or other online services4) Use whatever is left to make T-shirts, stickers, or other merchandise5) [BONUS] Donate 100% of the proceeds made from the first CD's first press run to a local Gainesville, FL organization
Oooh, what's this donation thingy you're doing?
I just told you!  OK, OK, one more time:  all the proceeds from The Missing's first pressing will be donated to one local Gainesville, FL organization.  This means that once I start selling The Missing (the first CD), 100% of the proceeds that I make from its sales during the first run will go to charity.As of this writing, I am still working on which organization that is, and I'm leaning towards either the Civic Media Center or the H.O.M.E. Van since I've had dealings with them in the past, but if you have any other suggestions, feel free to contact me.  And if you would like some more clarification regarding this donation, please contact me as well. (Email is the best way to contact me: murpheek at gmail dot com.)
Well sir, this sounds pretty cool!
Why thank you, random gal or guy, and thank you for visiting my campaign and reading this!  And please forward this to anyone who would want to be part of this too!  (The links for forwarding are located right below the video.)If you'd like to hear samples from The Missing (and maybe EndGame), you can do so by going to the band website.  Lastly, let's stay in touch by visiting the following websites:murphee-k.com/music.asp (music samples)facebook.com/pages/Murphee-K/7375406038myspace.com/murpheektwitter.com/MurpheeKtwitter.com/gpmpk

story:
***Recent Media Coverage***

ABC KVUE - Channel 8 News Story

Meet the Fennell family (John, Kim and son Levi).

Last September they lost 100% of their belongings to the fires in Bastrop.  They had insurance, but the contents of the home and property were not covered. 

Kim lost her job as a bus driver after the fires but John continued to work as a construction superintendent.  They were struggling just to put food on the table. 

Things began looking up when Levi enrolled in college and started working full-time as a vet tech.  Kim and John were making plans to rebuild. 

Tragedy just dealt a final blow.   Kim went to the hospital last week with a “tummy ache”.  Emergency surgery was performed…but it was too late.  Her small intestines had wrapped around her bowels causing complete organ failure.  Kim was just 36 years old.

Angels unite!  Let’s give them some mercy. 

We need the community to rally around our friends John and Levi. They've literally lost everything.  Wife.  Mother.  House.  Pictures.  Personal belongings.  Credit.  Savings.

Kim's Obituary 

Immediate Needs

  • Funeral/Memorial expenses:  est. $3500
  • ICU Medical Bills: $2000+
  • Levi's education
  • Rebuilding

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Help us get the word out! Share with your local media.  Share on facebook (click here to download cover photo you can use).  Use the Indiegogo share tools!   Donate your services.  Lift them up in prayer.  Anything helps!

story:
LILIAN

Hallo, wir sind eine Band aus Berlin - im Oktober 2012 nehmen wir unsere erste Platte auf! Dazu brauchen wir deine Unterstützung.  

Nach diversen Konzerten, Proberaum-Aufnahmen und selber gebastelten CDs ist es endlich soweit, dass wir acht Songs im Tempelton Studio, Wedding, aufnehmen. Wir sind gespannt und freuen uns riesig!

Hi, we´re a Berlin based band and we gonna record our first CD in Templeton-Studio, Berlin-Wedding. With your support it will be fantastic!

 

WAS WIR BRAUCHEN UND WAS DU BEKOMMST

Eine CD-Produktion beinhaltet Studio-Aufnahmen, Nachbearbeitungen, CD-Pressen. 

Genau dafür verwenden wir jeden Cent, den du spendest!

Doch für deine Unterstützung bekommst du auch was zurück: Die unten aufgelisteten "Perks" zeigen dir, was wir anbieten. Sei es eine LILIAN CD, freie Konzert-Eintritte, ein Nachtessen mit der Band oder mehr, du entscheidest!

All the money you donate will be used for the CD production. Below you can see what you get for your money: Digital downloads, CDs, free entry to our shows or even more... you decide!

 

VIELEN DANK FÜR DIE UNTERSTÜTZUNG! 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

Moritz, Benjamin, Alex, Micha und Lilian

story:
Leslie Mauldin, John Mauldin, and Jed Moss - we are Avenue B, and we're making our debut album!  We'd love to have you involved. This musical collaboration developed as a surprise to us, and we're so excited to share it with all of you.

We established our varied careers separately as concert, theatrical and stage performers, but a couple of years ago we found ourselves hired to perform together on the same stage, and a LIGHTBULB went off - this was fun, and there was honest joy being shared with the audience. Being onstage together really worked. Leslie had performed with her brother John, and also with Jed, but this was the first time the three of us had performed together onstage since childhood, and it just felt right. Then, when audience members started asking where they could buy our music, and when/where we'd be singing and playing together next, we realized we really had something to go after. So we did!

Since then, we've been hard at work arranging covers, writing original music, and honing our harmonies; we’ve performed in several states in the Midwest and Northwest U.S. to test our new venture, and received more requests for our music each time! We are ever grateful to those who gave us their thoughts and shared their feelings about how the music moved them, made them smile or laugh, what worked, what didn’t - it encouraged us to jump on this, and use our varied backgrounds together onstage and in the recording studio to share the unexpected joy in collaboration we've found mid-career. 

We'd love to have you be part of this!  Check out our perks - we think you'll like them - and then make your decision about how involved you want to be.

Here's how we'll use the money raised by this campaign:

  • Studio time - this is where we'll record the music!
  • Studio mixing and mastering - this is where they'll make us sound good!
  • Travel expenses - we all live in different cities, and since we sing harmonies, well ...it's kind of important to be together.
  •  CD production and distribution - that's when you get to hear the songs!
  • Webmaster fee - this is how we make our album available for download so... you get to hear the songs!
Wanna help, but short on funds?  Help us get the word out! Share our campaign with all your friends - fb, tweet, and use the handy IndieGoGo share tools - Spread the word in any way you can!
And that's all there is to it.:')

story:
Dear funders,

My name is Gavyn Bailey, I'm a fifteen (almost sixteen) year old singer/songwriter from Orange County California. My dream started at a very young age when I was constantly in the hospital battling kidney failure. My mom likes to say that she was the start of my career since she is the one that supplied all the musical toys for me, and I guess I just got hooked from there. Anyways, I want to make this short and simple. I released my first EP in January of 2013 and it since hit the charts at #4. I was ecstatic,I knew right then this is what I wanted to do for the rest of my life. I'm now working on a full length album. As some of you know, it's very hard for independent musicians to fund a full length album. However, my initial idea for this campaign was for the fans to get involved. The reason my music got far, was because of the fans and I am and will be forever grateful for every single one of them. The reason I continue to have such a strong passion for singing and songwriting is to make a difference in people's lives. Life gets tough and I want to be there when they fall, and be the artist they can always listen to that lifts them up. I've poured my heart out and I want the fans to be involved as much as possible. So with that said, if every fan could donate one dollar, we would meet our goal, or even surpass it! Another crazy idea I had was to make the campaign only two weeks long to challenge myself and to get the fans excited about this album since its happening so soon! Heck, I'm even excited typing this! I want the fans to be able to say, "Hey! I helped make that happen!"

story:
Have You Ever Been "Speechless and in Love?"

Hello everyone!  My name is Landon Wolford and I am a singer-songwriter out of Nixa, MO.  My passion is music, and my dream is to be a professional singer and performer.  I want to travel the world playing music, and touching people's lives with the music I play.  Music is something that I love, as do many people, but have you ever had something that left you tongue-tied?  Something that made you so happy that you couldn't speak?  We all experience those feelings, whether in a relationship or in our everyday lives.  I will be creating an acoustic EP called, "Speechless and in Love."  This EP will touch on the things that leave us "speechless and in love."  The name really does speak for itself.  This EP will consist of 4 songs, mostly about love, but also about life in general.  So, if you're worried about a set of super cheesy songs, have no fear!  But, the reality is I can't do this alone.  I need YOUR help.


Extra!  Extra!  Read all about it!

The Costs

So, as I mentioned before, I can’t complete this EP without your help.  This project won’t be cheap, but I have faith that it can be done.  It will cost $2,400.00 to complete this whole project, and this money will be used to fund two primary things.  These two things are …

  1. Studio Time/Recording - Recording is the first step (and one of the most important steps) in completing this EP.  I mean, without recordings of the songs, this project can’t actually exist.  I will be recording at Studio 2100 in Springfield, MO.  Studio 2100 is an extremely high quality, professional recording studio that produces outstanding music.  These funds will be used to record, mix, and master the songs.  I have recorded there once before, and I am so excited to go back! :)  (28% of budget)

  2. Post Production - Post production is definitely the most expensive part of this whole project.  But, an EP or album just isn’t the same without it.  Post production includes everything from creating the album cover to distributing the music on iTunes, Spotify, Pandora, etc.  I will be working with Disc Makers on all the post production, and I am super excited to work with them.  They can pretty much do anything when it comes to post production, so there are endless possibilities!  (61% of budget)
  3. Fees - A small percentage of the costs comes from certain fees that we have to pay.  These fees include Indiegogo project fees (so we can keep using their amazing services), Pay Pal fees for when we collect the contributions, and copyright fees.  (7% of budget)
  4. Extra/Emergency Funds - It's always super important to have an emergency fund just in case unplanned events take place.  This will account for any unexpected costs that may arise.  This part of our budget is kind of like insurance, being that it will insure that we have enough funding to complete our project.  (4% of budget)

The Rewards

By now you’re probably asking yourself, “Okay, so if I contribute, do I get something in return?”  The answer is … YES!  We offer a set of prizes and incentives (commonly known as perks) for contributing certain amounts of money.  The perks are described in much greater detail in the sidebar to the right.  For example, any person who contributes at least $5.00 will be given a shout out on social media, and a personal message on social media thanking them for their contribution.  But, of course there are many perks that go beyond the shout out and personal message.  These perks span all the way from a digital download of the EP to even being listed in the album credits as an EFP (Executive Financial Producer)!  Sound good?? :)


You Are Valued

As you listen to the finished EP, I want you to be able to enjoy every minute of it!  My #1 goal over the course of creating this project is to make music that moves everyone who listens to it.  I want this EP to be full of songs that you can dance too, belt in the car, and share with all your friends.  You are the people who are going to allow this project to reach its full potential.  Without you guys, I honestly couldn’t complete this project right now.  I want every one of you to know how much I appreciate every contribution, no matter the amount or the type.  EVERYTHING helps, because there is NO small contribution.


Other Ways You Can Help

Contributions aren’t only limited to monetary donations.  There are so many other ways that you can help that will positively impact the success of this project!  Here are a few ways you can help …

  1. Sharing this project on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.  (Use hashtag:  #SpeechlessAndNLoveEP)

  2. Sharing this project with your friends and family.

Remember, every contribution helps! :)


Thank You

I personally want to thank you all for giving your time to view my project.  It really means a lot to me to have the support that you guys give me.  I honestly cannot do it without you.  Lastly, I want to assure you that you won’t be disappointed in this EP.  I am confident that it will leave you, too, “Speechless and in Love.”

~Landon Wolford 



     Follow This Project On …


          https://www.facebook.com/SpeechlessAndInLove

https://twitter.com/orLandoWolford

       http://instagram.com/orlandowolford

story:
Who we are

  • Our founder, Bonnie Tacheron, was traumatized by misogynistic gun violence in 2005. Her PTSD response was triggered by the news of the UCSB shootings on May 23. She decided that rather than giving in to the pain, she needed to rally her friends to do something awesome for all the women in Boston to speak out and support one another.
  • We are a community of musicians, many of whom met through Girls Rock Campaign Boston. We already have a foundation of "Teamwork makes the dream work!" and "Girls need to build each other up rather than dragging each other down!" and we are prepared to bring this ethos to the world at large.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Photocopies! We're organizing a large group of people and there's nothing like good old paper to run a meeting.
  • Posters! We're trying to make something beautiful here, and tell everyone.
  • CDs! We're gonna put out a really good compilation of Boston artists' music.
  • An all ages feminist rock show!
  • Perks TBA very soon, but will include admission to the show, a copy of the compilation, a poster, stickers/buttons/tshirts.

The Impact

#yesallwomen is about more than just our daily experiences with violence, discrimination, and harrassment. It also serves as an affirmation. We're here to support women. #yesallwomen

Other Ways You Can Help

We need volunteers! 

Join us at our planning meeting on Thursday, June 5, from 6-9 pm at Boston University, 855 Commonwealth Ave. All are welcome! Women, men, youth! If you are unable to attend, please e-mail yesallwomenboston@gmail.com and share your ideas!

Projects include:

  • Event management
  • Compilation production
  • Website
  • Public Relations
  • Fundraising

Photocopies! We're organizing a large group of people and there's nothing like good old paper to run a meeting.
Posters! We're trying to make something beautiful here, and tell everyone.

CDs! We're gonna put out a really good compilation of Boston artists' music.
An all ages feminist rock show!
Perks TBA very soon, but will include admission to the show, a copy of the compilation, a poster, stickers/buttons/tshirts.
The Impact#yesallwomen is about more than just our daily experiences with violence, discrimination, and harrassment. It also serves as an affirmation. We're here to support women. #yesallwomenOther Ways You Can HelpWe need volunteers! Join us at our planning meeting on Thursday, June 5, from 6-9 pm at Boston University, 855 Commonwealth Ave. All are welcome! Women, men, youth! If you are unable to attend, please e-mail yesallwomenboston@gmail.com and share your ideas!Projects include:
Event management
Compilation production
Website
Public Relations
Fundraising

story:
INTRO

Greetings! We are Fix America Now Foundation, otherwise known as "FANdation." We are a non-profit organization soon to launch here in Los Angeles, CA.
With our extensive training and knowledge in Film & Television, we wanted to put it to good use and keep art alive in our schools. Similar to our inspirations, "Oprah's Angel Network" and "Make-A-Wish Foundation," we wanted to be a part of an organization that is expansive with its aid.  For instance, instead of focusing on just bullying in our schools, befriending our troops, keeping art programs alive, and help fund start up projects that create better, safer American schools- why not just combine them all? Through our research, we were only able to find organizations geared toward one specific venue that already have established teams, that's when we thought of starting up our own.

This is one of many unique projects, as we plan to provide you with many more, once-in-a-lifetime, experiences. As you can see, we are quite passionate about our future. With your help, we'd like to launch the announcement and the beginning of Fix America Now Foundation with a bang! We hope you will help us make our vision possible.

What We Need & What You Get

Where your money is going:
Our establishment and entity. We are a team of strong-willed individuals who have a strong and dynamic vision and we need your help in order to start our amazing journey.
In order for us to launch our first "Ultimate FAN-Raising Experience Sweepstakes", we need funding  that will be used to rent a quality camera, lights, sound, insurance, and the private studio where you will have your chance at meeting one of our celebrity guest. This Sweepstakes will launch as soon as we reach our projected. We've even teamed up with some celebrities that you might recognize from Disney Channels "Wizards of Waverely Place", and another from MTV's "Faking It." 
Our first annual, "Project; No Solider Left Behind," where we will be flying a select few active-duty service men and woman home for the holidays to be able to celebrate with their families and loved ones who otherwise can't afford to. If time permits, we would like to transport active duty soldiers who are stuck on base this Thanksgiving and host a warm, hearty, catered Thanksgiving meal in Los Angeles, CA. Having friends personally who are active duty Marines and learning of the thousands of soldiers who simply can't afford to go home for the holidays is something we'd like to change. 
In return for your donation, we are offering incentives for you to join us for our Celebrity Launch Party in Hollywood, CA. Tickets will be sold at a higher rate early next year BUT you can earn PRIORITY ACCESS NOW!!! This means you get in before the general a public at a discounted rate! 
You can even win a date with Christoper Van Etten, Kennedy Grace, or Luke Valen as they celebrate with us at our Celebrity Launch Party! They'll treat you to dinner before you WALK THEM DOWN THE RED CARPET and join them backstage as their special guest of the night. That's right, backstage access and walk the red carpet where you could be rubbing elbows with our musical and celebrity guest. We are reaching out to Emblem3, Hunter Parrish, and even Nick Jonas and will announce as we get confirmations. So follow us on Twitter @FANdationLA as well as Instagram @FANdationLA to be the first to know who's involved. *All donations are lawfully meant as donations and will not be returned to the general public for any reason. By the laws and regulations of the State of California, all donations shall remain donations and cannot be refunded. If FANdation is terminated or of dissolution, and assests are lawfully obligated to be distrubted to one (1) or more qulifying organizations.

The Impact

With your donations, we are launching:

"Project: Protect Our Schools" is our biggest passion as we readily prepare schools for possible gunman attacks by running mock school shooting drills, donate metal detectors to schools in need, and creating safety regulations that will help protect our schools.

"Project: No Solider Left Behind" we will host an annual "TROOP-N-TURKEY TIME." Every Thursday, November 27, we will transport and host a few of our uniformed men and woman and provide them with a warm, catered, Thanksgiving meal in Los Angeles. We know of the thousands of active duty soldiers who are stuck on base and cannot be with their families for the holidays, and we want to help change that​. Available at our host location, we will provide Skype/FaceTime booths where they will be able to contact their loved ones. If we raise enough funds, we are hoping to be able to fly a select few home for a surprise visit with their families.

"Project: Art is Alive" Where we will donate new pianos, instruments, and even cameras and boom mics to help develop a morning news crew team for less fortunate schools. We will also donate the funds to put up full-scaled productions as well as offer directing and coaching to put on performances for their community and raise money for their own art programs.

In Spring of 2015- we are planning "FANdations Ultimate Glee-off". Part of our "Project: Art is Alive," In Hollywood, CA, we will host 5 schools who will compete against one another for the Gold Glee Cup. More details to come soon!

Not to mention, year round "Ultimate FAN-Raising Experiences with some of your favorite celebrities.

Risks & Challenges

FAN-dation will survive because we plan to use more community outreach than anything. We want to get people actively involved instead of just giving money. This is why we like the idea of providing fans with once-in-a-lifetime chances to meet their biggest idols. It's a win-win situation for everybody! We team up with big celebrity names to bring you awesome experiences, you donate for an amazing cause and win these awesome prizes, and in return, Americas schools, communities and service men and woman, will replenish from it. 

Launching a non-profit organization requires, oddly enough- money. We are filing with the IRS to obtain a 501(c)(3) and with our production skills as well as all our marketing skills we will be able to sustain the necessary marketing tools in order to keep afloat. Government funding and grants are not a critical component for our survival and we will be applying as a "small non-profit" at least for the first three years making it easier for us to obtain the 501(c)(3), according to our organization adviser. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute even just a $1 bill, hey, we understand. We know what it's like to be broke college/high school students as well, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Help spread the word! A simple tweet or insta post will help us out tremendously! Tell your friends about us and follow us.

story:
The Need

In the greater Los Angeles area, funding for music and arts curriculum in our public schools is either non existent or has been significantly reduced. As a result, a tremendous void has been created in our schools for quality music and arts training.

Grace  and  Excellence  Media,  Entertainment  and  Production  Company (GEMEPC)  is  an innovative, creative, and cutting edge 501(c)(3) tax exempt, nonprofit organization that exists to provide children with the opportunity to realize their dreams through the expression of the arts, regardless of cultural, social, or economic differences, which contributes to an improved quality of life for our area youth and families.

Recently established, the organization was formed by a group of stakeholders that were able to see the correlation between the challenges faced by children and youth in the Los Angeles area and the resources that are made available to them through private and publicly funded programs.  


The Vision

Grace and Excellence was created to provide a platform to showcase talent, provide educational outreach opportunities, to emphasize cultural diversity and encourage performers who put moral integrity first in their lives.

The organization will steer children toward fulfilling their artistic dreams that would otherwise be out of reach. In addition, the scholarships funded by the organization will seek to combat the trend of slashed arts funding in schools. 


The Benefit Concert

Grammy-nominated LA Mass Choir, co-founded and directed by Grace and Excellence Founder & CEO, Donald Taylor, will lend their voices in support of this worthwhile cause. On Saturday, November 15, 2014 at 7pm, LA Mass Choir & The NEXT Generation will be in full concert to help raise funds.

From this benefit concert, we hope to open an after-school and weekend program for arts and music education. The temporary location would be in the office of Faithful Central Bible Church in Inglewood, California. We hope to obtain instruments, sheet music, musical equipment, and other relevant supplies.

The Perks

We need your support to make this vision a reality in our community. Every dollar raised will be a tremendous help toward achieving our $87,000 goal. So to encourage you to give, we have a series of "perks" (listed on the right on this page).

As you can imagine, launching a comprehensive, wide-ranging music and arts foundation is a daunting task that requires an incredible amount of resources. Your contribution will allow us to:

  • Build organizational infrastructure
  • Secure office space
  • Create marketing collateral, website design
  • Hire guest clinicians, support staff and training experts
  • Develop summer camps to introduce students to artists in the industry


The Statistics

Headlines across the nation proclaim the state of the nation’s educational system, depicting a number of concerning issues:

  • A dropout rate that approaches 50% in some demographics
  • A narrowed curriculum and strict focus on standardized testing that teaches students to fill in multiple choice bubbles instead of how to think creatively and problem solve, skills that are essential for helping them to compete in today’s economy.
  • An achievement gap between our highest and lowest performing students that is ever-widening.
  • Teachers who want to reach out and engage their students, but lack the tools with which to do so.
According to another study by the NEA, almost two-thirds of 18-year-olds reported that they had lessons or classes in at least one art form as children in the 1982 Survey of Public Participation in the Arts (SPPA). The proportion of 18-year-olds who had received arts education as children has declined in each succeeding SPPA, reaching a low of less than half in the most recent survey — a drop of 23 percent.


The Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you aren't able to contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us spread the word and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Don't forget, use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

We are Antagonist AD, a hardcore band from New Zealand.

We have parted ways with our old record label and are currently looking for a label to sign with to release our new album.

Since releasing 'Nothing From No One' two years ago, we've been lucky enough to tour the US and Europe, as well Australia and New Zealand numerous times. We've taken in a lot of experience from being on the road, and poured everything into the new set of songs. We've evolved our sound and pushed it in a number of new directions, while still anchoring it in everything Antagonist AD has always been about. 

Tracking for the album has already been completed, but it still needs to be mixed and mastered.  We're also excited to be working with Jacob Bannon who is putting together the artwork for the album.

What We Need & What You Get

We're really excited about the new material and we can't wait for you to get your hands on it.  We want to make this album the best it possibly can be, but we need your help with covering some of the costs of production.

We've budgeted for $10,000 to go towards the cost of making the album, and a further $5,000 to create a music video for the first single.

We've come up with a number of perks that we think you'll like, including a digital covers EP, limited edition prints and exclusive coloured vinyl.

story:
Our Story

Fresh off a wild three-month tour of Japan, Kenichi Minami, performing as Ken South Rock came all the way to the USA to do a self-financed tour of New York City.  When acclaimed rock n roll drummer Adam Amram saw him play four weeks ago at Goodbye Blue Monday, he was blown away.


"I invited him up to play for five minutes," Adam said.  "We instantly learned a whole set list."


They haven't stopped playing since.  Their passion, energy and dedication in their live shows caught the attention of the whole NYC rock n roll scene, including Jason Rutherford, engineer at the phenomenal 3 egg studios.  


It's not just the sound.   It's two people from opposite sides of the world connecting like long-lost brothers. Together they explode with a unique combination of intimacy and intensity that reaches right up into any crowd.


But don't take my word for it.  Check 'em out!


They tracked in 3 days.  It was a miracle of recording.  You can see a lot of awesome pictures and video of the marathon at Ken South Rock.  If you're of a technical mind, you can read all about the recording engineering details at  Adventures in Music Production.


Now they're getting ready to tour Japan!!!


Making Great Music for you

Our first priority is getting in touch with our fans, because you are the most important part of Ken South Rock. We want to bring our show to you.  But we need help to do it.  We can all work together to make this happen.  


What We Need & What You Get

With just $1500, we can bring our music to you.


Adam and Ken are determined to hit the road in March.  Adam will fly in March 9.  Without wasting a day, they will go straight to rehearsal, then launch a month-long tour of Japan starting in Kamisuwa on Friday, March 11.  From then on, they will tour the following cities:


Kamisuwa

Nagoya

Osaka

Fukuyama

Hiroshima

Shunan

Kurosaki

Kagoshima

Fukuoka

Oita

Matsuyama

Kyoto

Gifu

Tokyo


Fans of Ken South Rock are eagerly awaiting us in each of these cities.


With your financial support, you will help Adam and Ken get ready with merchandise to make this a success


Other Ways You Can Help

Become a fan of our page on facebook!  Subscribe to our blog at kensouthrock.wordpress.com!  Share the music with your friends!  And come to our shows when we tour Japan!

story:
Our Story

Hi! I and my band, Dawn Drake & ZapOte have been invited to play at the Iowa Women's Music Festival, which features women who write and perform all kinds of original music. It is held in Iowa City every year. The festival impacts about 1500 people in Iowa City and it is a grassroots festival run by dedicated women. The festival is paying us a fee to come play, and the fee paid meets about half of our expenses towards traveling to Iowa, eating, sleeping and paying these wonderful female musicians a small fee for their time and talents. We are starting this campaign to raise money to help make this trip possible. We have 5 shows: Baltimore, MD; Cleveland, OH; Bloomington, IN; Iowa City, IO, and Youngstown OH. Most of the venues are small and are offering us a small fee. But we are 5 females, so we need some extra help meeting our needs for our trip, which will be fro Sept 7 to Sept 13, 2011.


The Impact

The impact will be that we girls in the band will be able to rent a van, eat 3 meals a day and sleep in a safe place on the nights that are not covered by the venues that we play.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1600 to make this tour happen. $500 for a mini-van rental, $400 for gas(for 2000 miles of travel), $300 for food for 5 musicians for 5 days, and $450 for hotel rooms(2 rooms for 3 nights for the venues that do not provide this).  We are offering several campaign options.  Check them out!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with others who might be interested in supporting the cause of us sharing our sound and words  in places where perhaps people don't see kick a** females playing original Afro-beat, Latin, Brazilian and World music! Post it on your facebook or twitter pages! thank you!!

story:
My Story

My name is Samira Nicole and I am an upcoming artist located in Jacksonville Florida. I am in the process of releasing my first music project. It is an EP and it's titled My Hallelujah. 

My Hallelujah walks you through my personal experience of some of the most difficult and intimate moments that I have experienced in my walk with Christ. In the end I realized that only I can give God the praise that He deserves for all He has done for me.  

We are all living in an interesting time. For years I  have dreamt of sharing  music that can help bring healing, hope, and joy to those who are hurting. With this EP, I am one step closer to seeing this dream become a reality!

 

The Need

I am looking to raise $3500 dollars in 30 days to help cover the following cost and other activities associated with the completion of this project: 

  • Recording
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Digital Distrubution 
  • CD Production (Hard Copy)
  • Advertising (Products, Social Media, Promotions)
  • Love Offerings (to those who have worked endlessly behind the scenes throughout this entire process)

 

Giving

You are welcome to give any amount you desire, but with the suggested amounts below, you will receive one or more of the following perks:

$500 or more: Composition of original song + hard copy of EP + t shirt

$250: Personal Performance (Choice of any song) + hard copy of EP + t shirt

$100: Cover Dedication on social media (Choice of any song) + hard copy of EP + t shirt 

$50: Hard copy of EP + t shirt

$25: Hard copy of EP 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the love!

There will be several opportunities to share content and this campaign with your friends on multiple platforms.

The more people that know, the more people that can help! 

Indiegogo also has great tools that can help you spread the word! 

 

Thank you

Thank you for taking the time to listen to my heart. 

Thank you for helping transform a dream into reality. 

If you have any questions, I would love to speak with you! 

You can contact me via email at samiranicolemusic@gmail.com

I look forward to doing this together! 

- Samira Nicole
story_txt:
My StoryMy name is Samira Nicole and I am an upcoming artist located in Jacksonville Florida. I am in the process of releasing my first music project. It is an EP and it's titled My Hallelujah. My Hallelujah walks you through my personal experience of some of the most difficult and intimate moments that I have experienced in my walk with Christ. In the end I realized that only I can give God the praise that He deserves for all He has done for me.  We are all living in an interesting time. For years I  have dreamt of sharing  music that can help bring healing, hope, and joy to those who are hurting. With this EP, I am one step closer to seeing this dream become a reality! The NeedI am looking to raise $3500 dollars in 30 days to help cover the following cost and other activities associated with the completion of this project:
